Reviews.Title: “A comfortable Base in London”
Reviews.Author: Victordriver
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to see the sights of London for a few nights you could do much worse than this hotel. The rooms are smallish but adequate, the breakfast choice is good and the service friendly and helpful. We booked it through Superbreak and had never stayed here before. We could criticise its location as it is at least 10 mins from any tube station without any local attractions to visit. However, it offers very good value for money in this expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, max. 3*”
Reviews.Author: Mantas_Siauciunas
Reviews.Content: The hotel hard to find and quite a distant walk from the metro station. Has two buildings: one where you can live, have breakfast and go directly to sauna and other that you have to get through outside. I am not sure how much the rooms are better in the first building, but I stayed at the other one, where rooms are to the street (the one little window in the room opened american style and an impression was that ir is always a bit open - noise and cold incomming). Except for the lobby, the room was run down, very little, no mini bar, only one draw for clothes. Had a safe and ironing stuff. I was told it was 4 star, but I would give only 3. No slippers! :) and robes are only in suits, but I managed to get one - although no point to use it if you don't have a straight way to the basement pool (havent cheked that). Overall the staff was helpfull (although I needed a standard mini usb to usb cable and they could not get me one). Breakfast poor.

Reviews.Title: “Warning! - Groups treated as second class citizens”
Reviews.Author: Han_n_Ry
Reviews.Content: This hotel has two very separate very different blocks. Although I realise that not all hotels are willing to take groups I do feel that hotels which do should not still charge four star prices for what can only be describe as a cheap two star experience. Bedroom were tiny (I know we're in London) but you could bearly walk around the bedroom. Decors was tatty, and everything in our block in a VERY bed state of repair. Breakfast was a complete free for all, with a lack of bowls & plates not to mention food items to put on them. All service in a conference room. I have since a school dining hall with more atmosphere and better food! If you are going to offer this quality of product and service to groups then I feel it's plain mis advertising to say its a four star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of those hoteles with variable standards of room.”
Reviews.Author: JBlunt
Reviews.Content: Was attending an event at the Barbican (10 -12 minutes walk away) so I was booked in by the event's organisers as part of a group. The room and breakfast were satisfactory and the staff in the restaurant were pleasant. The breakfast was standard fair but getting hot tea proved a challenge. One of our group had a room on the 6th floor which was rather poor. Overall I would rate this as an average 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for one night.”
Reviews.Author: saharaboy_12
Reviews.Content: Overpriced, like every London hotel. Bit of A trek from the tube (Old Street), but on the plus side, there was a Wetherspoons en-route, so managed to at least get a couple of reasonably priced pints in on the way! The staff at the hotel were friendly and courteous, and the room was ok. That's as much as I can say; I've stayed at a Premier inn for a Quarter of the price of this, and it was just as good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: FlikandCoco
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were booked in to this hotel by his work. It wouldn't be a hotel I would choose to stay at again - it's not situated in a very nice area, the room was basic and the decor tired. However on the plus side, it was clean, the staff friendly and the breakfast offered a good selection of pastries, fresh fruit, cereal or a full English - be prepared, breakfast was extremely busy with student tourists, so service was a little slow!

Reviews.Title: “Old room, ok breakfast and gym room”
Reviews.Author: El_Titiritero
Reviews.Content: The room I got was pretty old, definitely not the top hotel I ever stayed. Breakfast was OK and it was good that the hotel had a free gym for the guests, I haven't used the pool

Reviews.Title: “A bit of a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: davidwilliams58
Reviews.Content: Lets get the only downside out of the way first. It's in the middle of nowhere which in London takes some doing. It's a brisk 25-30 minute walk to get to Upper Street in Islington where most of the bars and restaurants (including the Angel Islington which, in case you didnt know is a Weatherspoons) however I'm sure that this is reflected in the price. The staff were extremely friendly and the breakfast was excellent as is the bar. Didnt use use the restaurant for evening meal or the leisure facilities due to pressure of time but to find a hotel in London for the price we paid which also has a leisure centre is pretty remarkable. I'd definitely go again and I'd explore the area a bit more and have a look at buses and taxis because I might be being a bit unfair on describing it as remote. Happy to be corrected if anyone knows better.

Reviews.Title: “Great room”
Reviews.Author: Hopstepper
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded and had a room in the hotel 'proper'. The room numbering is somewhat strange and it took me 4-5 longer than it should have to find my room. The cost of the room was around Â£100 but its not always possible to get a double that cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Better than anticipated!”
Reviews.Author: tedbandme
Reviews.Content: After reading the very mixed reviews on Tripadvisor, I was relieved to find I need not have worried. I booked this hotel through Laterooms Secret Hotels , so had taken pot luck. The room was clean and warm, plenty of hot water, the missing hairdryer was promptly replaced after speaking with one of the very pleasant reception staff. The room was quiet so we had a good nights sleep. ( I always think the quietness of the room depends on the courtesy of the other guests) We had paid in advance for breakfast but reception seemed not to have a record of this, fortunately I had the print out of my reservation clearly showing breakfast was included. All the reception staff we encountered were most helpful. Breakfast is very good, a good choice of fresh fruit, cereals,and full English, no decaf tea, but I took my own. I paid a bargain price with which I was satisfied as fair value for money in London, however the full price in my opinion would have made this hotel overpriced. As we only stayed two nights we didn't have time to use the pool facilities though we did have a look and it seemed to be well kept and clean. Old St. tube station is a 10 minute walk, turn left out of the hotel then right at the pub, past the park, then left at the church, past the Co-op, and the tube is a little way along.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but staff very good”
Reviews.Author: Noodle053
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a business meeting, it's a 10 minute march from Barbican Tube Station. The initial room I was allocated was so small it was like a broom cupboard, dated furniture and bathroom but clean. I obtained a move into the main building and a twin room for no extra charge after complaining that there was no airconditioning and the window did not open. The 2nd room was bigger but of the same standard. The reception, bar and breakfast staff are exceptionally friendly and willing to help so really the service saved the day. Food in the bar and breakfast was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Average and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: camster66
Reviews.Content: Located at roughly a ten minute walk from both Barbican and Old street Tubes, this out of the way establishemnt is rather deceptively named. Whilst many of the rooms are undergoing "improvements", this seems to have been the case constantly for the pasrt few years and the room quality never actually improves. Bog standard and over-priced. Youd be much better advised to look more centrally OR look for a cheaper alternative in the same area and give this ine a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Standard, clean, as expected for a Thistle”
Reviews.Author: exotic1983
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were booked in here by his company. It's not in the best area, very rough and surrounded by council estates. However, we went out in the evening and felt perfectly safe together. Room was a standard double and very small. Not really room for two suitcases! However, it was clean and everything was there and in good working order. Bathroom was nice with a good shower and a decent size. The hotel has a nice health club in the basement with a pool, jacuzzi, sauna and steam room. Worth a visit if you can catch it when it isn't busy! It does close 3 mornings a week though which is a bit inconvenient (it's used for schools). We had room service breakfast which was good, cooked breakfast was reasonably hot although hotels still haven't mastered the art of getting toast to your room without it getting cold. Very nice coffee and croissants! We wouldn't argue if my partner was placed here again but that would be for the health club facilities! Wouldn't book this hotel (or any Thistle, in my experience) by choice.

Reviews.Title: “Chosen for me but I would choose it next time.”
Reviews.Author: martinreddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for two nights as part of a theatre trip arranged through an agency. The room on the third floor was fine, clean, spacious and well equipped. We ate in the restaurant on the second night and again nothing to complain about. The breakfast menu was extensive and tasty although I am not a great lover of the practice of serving eggs, sausages and bacon etc buffet style so I went for the continental options of fruit, croissants and the like. However the real strength of this hotel for me were the members of staff I encountered. Without exception they were friendly, efficient and extremely helpful. Although this hotel is a bit out of the way it is not too far to tube stations so we were able to gat around quite easily. All in all I would use this hotel if I visited London again.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: insulaner1984
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here on business for a few days when my usual hotels were booked out. Rate was accordingly expensive. Check-in was slow (however, they did come around and offered drinks whilst one was waiting). Room was tiny and very tired. The little floor space that would have been there was taken by an additional foldable bed in my room, which also blocked me being able to get the wardrobe open. Bathroom had rusty spots. Asked for additional bed to be removed, only to find it still there when returning. Also, promised bathrobe did not appear. Bed disappeared after a further intervention. Area of the hotel is nice enough, if not a bit removed from the nearest tube station. A lot of school classes were staying in the hotel at the time, to be fair though I didn't see/hear much of them. I would have been fine with the above at maybe Â£60/night, but not at just under Â£200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashton79
Reviews.Content: Needed a city hotel for one night this weekend in order to attend a friends engagement party at St. James. The room was booked through last minute.com and we paid Â£60 for a twin room, which actually had three seperate beds in it so three of us could've effectively shared for Â£20 each. Unbelievable! The lobby is very smart but once you're in the room it's what you would expect for the price although very clean and quiet. Great value for London. Make sure you search for a deal. The girl on reception was hot too. Always a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of hidden extras”
Reviews.Author: Kemmina
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful but I was a little disappointed with this hotel as it has lots of hidden extra charges: wi-fi; surcharges on room service; extras on breakfast etc.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend break”
Reviews.Author: BinkySouthWales
Reviews.Content: Weekend break to celebrate my wifes coming of age. E-mailed the hotel before travelling asking for a price to provide flowers and birthday balloons. Rakesh e-mailed back saying they would carry out my request free of charge and up grade our room. It made the weekend. The hotel was very nice the room was well equiped and spotless, the hotel staff were very freindly and couldn't do enough for us. Excellent breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: James S
Reviews.Content: Night 1 - We stayed the night before my stag party for which we were also staying at the Thistle. On arrival the reception area is clean and of a good size. Receptionist was pleasant, friendly and well informed. Room was on the Second floor for the first night. Double on the smaller side but OK for a short stay like ours. Only one plug that we could find in the room for the TV, kettle and needed to unplug the TV or kettle to charge our phones. When the lift arrives at a floor it makes a loud "BONG." This noise travelled down the corridor and woke us up every time the lift opens on our floor. It would be nice if this was time restricted or quieter. Breakfast was of a good quality and service was fast and effective - we really enjoyed the selection available to us.

Reviews.Title: “Better”
Reviews.Author: BigAl066
Reviews.Content: Given a choice and my previous review I probably wouldn't have stayed here again but I wasn't paying so it was out of my hands. However, I am pleased to say the second visit was much better than the first. This time we had a room in the main building above reception where the rooms are far more pleasant than those in the annex across the entrance way. The location of this hotel means it is used by groups going to shows and other events in the city and so is very busy, expect to queue for a table at breakfast. Depending on why you are visiting London will determine how the location of the hotel suits you. It's probably a 10 -15 minute walk from Old St tube station and a similar time from Barbican but I wouldn't recommend that unless you know where you are going. The staff are perfectly friendly and willing to assist and based on this second visit i would be prepared to go back here, subject to getting a room in the main block.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Jules1810
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, booked through lastminute.com and got a good deal, cheaper than many hotels are for one night. 10-15 min walk from old street or barbican tubes. The area does look a bit rough but we walked to and from the hotel at all times of day and around midnight and felt safe. Did not have breakfast at the hotel so can't comment on that. Check in and out was quick and easy and reception staff friendly and helpful. Used the pool and sauna and husband used the gym, all pretty good. Room was not massive but bigger than some we've stayed in, not luxurious looking but has everything you need, bath with shower, tea and coffee, plenty of storeage and ironing board. Room was cleaned well and fresh towels left, we had no complaints and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: oliviarosebud
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend (birthday party) and have to say after reading the reviews was slightly worried with what to expect. I am pleased to say that my weekends stay was great. On arrival the reception staff were very nice and friendly. The room was perfectly clean and the bed was comfy. We did have one problem with the heater not working but by the time we went to bed the room was lovely and warm, thank goodness as it was the coldest night of the year! We ate in the hotel on the first night and it was really nice...to be perfectly honest i wish we had eaten there the second night too!! Breakfast was great too. All in all i think the staff were all lovely and we really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Theatre Week-end”
Reviews.Author: ebnursey
Reviews.Content: I booked a theatre week-end in London for my husbang's christmas present. We set off from Liverpool on the 7. 20 train from Lime Street, we arrived at the hotel approximately 10. 30 not wanting to get into any strenous sight seeing before theatre time that evening we were met at the desk by very friendly staff, who said our room was ready then (instead of having to wait till 3 p.m.) gratefully we went to the room, my husband was delighted to be able to watch the Lpool v Man U game in the bar with a pint while I explored the Spa and Leisure facilities. After the match we enjoyed a swim, jacuzzi, sauna and steam room. We booked for an exfoliation and massage the following day finishing with a glass of bubbly and some chocs, ready for Valentines day. We also enjoyed a meal in the hotel prior to our trip to the theatre, the food was lovely. Just before reaching our home destination the following evening my husband realised he had left the house and car keys in the hotel. Following a phone call to housekeeping, these were promptly returned to us by recorded delivery. All in all, our whole experience was extremely enjoyable at this hotel, and the staff were all so nice and helpful, Highly recommended. The only drawback to this weekend, was the actual theatre seating, Please Queen's Theatre update your seats, have never seen so many people leave a theatre rubbing their lower backs as the seats are so uncomfortable

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: gl321
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Thistle City Barbican for two nights early this week while attending a course in Central London. After reading the reviews; I definitely wouldn't have booked the hotel myself (it was booked by my company). I was surprised - the hotel wasn't as bad as the majority of the reviews had stated. Check-in was quick (under 5 minutes), as was check-out. I was staying in a double room on the 3rd floor of the main building. The room was clean, had a large TV (30-37") and tea and coffee making facilities. The bathroom was also clean. The bed was made up by the cleaner and towels were either replaced or tidied back onto the heated towel rack. I did not use the Internet in the hotel as it is not free - it is charged at Â£10 per 24 hours. The hotel was relatively quiet, but I could hear the 'ding' of the lift from my hotel room when trying to sleep at night. The walls are also very thin and I could hear people in the next room. Dinner was nice enough, but the meals were very expensive for the portion sizes. I suppose they are relative to London hotel prices. Starters are served quickly, but main courses took approximately 30 minutes to arrive. Breakfast is priced at Â£10 (Â£15 room service). This was not as nice as dinner, but there is a variety of items on offer, including fried breakfast items (bacon, sausages, beans, fried/scrambled eggs), fruit, cereals, toast and pastries. Tea and coffee is served to the tables. Overall, the staff in the restaurant/bar and on reception were very polite and helpful. The hotel is quite a walk from Barbican tube station (approximately 10-15 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: mattdwatson
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on here, I was understandably nervous about my upcoming stay - however for Â£50 on a Sunday night in (almost) central London I wasn't expecting The Savoy. Check in was polite and swift. My room (in the main part of the hotel, this seems to make a difference) was great. Typical Thistle decor (i.e. trapped in the 90s), but large, clean, and not too shabby. Large plasma TV, fridge, sofa, clean although slightly tatty bathroom. I had only booked a standard double, but assume I must have been put in a higher grade of room. The room was baking hot when I checked in, but opening the window and adjusting the aircon soon sorted this. Sandwich from room service was fine, and arrived in 10 minutes. All in all, pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “clean and spacious room , good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: backpackingwelshies
Reviews.Content: Can't complain about this hotel, it was everything we wanted. A 10 min walk to the tube it meant everything was accesable and we had none of the hiked up prices. The bed was extremely comfortable, tea &coffee in rooms aswell as a safe. The romm was a brilliant size as we only had a double and the tv was a large size. Breakfast had all options ; cooked/continenal/fruit etc... Really nothing bad to say abou it

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and Noisy”
Reviews.Author: amy n
Reviews.Content: Bad value for money. The rooms are clean but shabby and need a refresh. The cold water tap only produced hot water so I could not get a drink of water during the night, which was made worse by the unbearable temperature of the rooms. The shower temperature was fine the first morning, but the second morning the water was s hot I could not take a shower. The walls are very thin, and I could hear all the phone conversations of the woman staying next door. The staff were friendly and helpful, but the rooms really let this hotel down.

Reviews.Title: “In desperate need of a refresh!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 3 seperate occasions, in different rooms each time, first time one night, 2nd and 3rd for 4 nights each. The 1st and 3rd where on the 1st floor - and I had asked to be in the main building because I wanted to use the pool and didn't want to be going out in the cold on the way back (there are 2 seperate blocks) The downstairs and pool area are very nice with lots of marble and polish - but they didn't tell me the gym closed at 8:45 - far too early for a work out after work! the 1st floor rooms were ok, in need of a refresh but quiet at least. The 6th Floor room on my second trip was awful! chip board wardroabes where the door fell off when I touched it - terrible lighting, very noisy with the extractor fan and traffic, had better quality room as a student. This is not the room they advertise!!! At least I got my room 1/2 price in the Jan sale, other wise I would have been extremely disapointed and would never pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “misleading”
Reviews.Author: paulspuppets
Reviews.Content: on entering the hotel the reception is grandiose , and very misleading i was checked in then told i was across the road in another annexe which looked like student digs,very small room with stained carpets and shabby decor,the toilet door wouldnt shut if you were sat on the toilet and the main door wouldnt shut from the inside unless it was chained,i asked if there was an internet booth i could use in the hotel and was told yes Â£6 for 90 mins-rip off !!! as was the breakfast at Â£16.99, the hotel isnt central either surrounded by a council estate on old street it is 2 tube rides away from leicester square,there are building works going on all around and the noise at 7,3o am is deafening so dont expect a lie in .also check out time is 12 noon but i was knocked on in the early hours by the cleaner,i wouldnt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, not great not bad”
Reviews.Author: PDPatara
Reviews.Content: Hotel booked for me by company, wouldn't book this myself. Both good and bad here. Good - Comfortable, clean, quiet, reasonable size room for London, good breakfast & friendly staff Bad - Not a good area, checkin took 15mins, pay for wifi, room a bit dated but ok (once I got rid of the two spiders at the side of my locker and above my bed), out of the way unless you need to stay near Angel or Old Street which are about 10mins walk. I was really uncomforable walking home to this place in the evening/night as its 5 mins off a main road down quiet side streets with council tower blocks all around. This is probably the biggest issue I had, though no free wifi really annoys me.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: barbius
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a 1 night stay. Myself, my husband and 2 kids (4 & 6) were in one room and my mother in law was in a single room. At check in we had been allocated rooms in 2 different buildings, but after a little time the problem was rectified and we got rooms next to each other. The rooms are very hot and opening the window didn't seem to help much (especially in the single room). The family room we had was lovely, albeit that the decor was a little dated. Taps in the bathroom could do with a bit of TLC. However, can't complain as the room was bigger than expected which was great with the kids. We got to breakfast early and had a good choice - staff were great and cleared plates quickly and offered more tea and coffee. We noticed later on that there was a queue for breakfast so getting there early was a good idea. Also made use of the pool which was a bit cold at first but soon got used to it. Towel hire was free but you need a pad lock for the lockers. Leisure reception only had 1 spare so my husband and son kept their stuff by the side of the pool which was a bit annoying. Tube was a bit of a hike but after speaking with the staff, we got a bus straight to Oxford Circus and they run every 5-10mins. Bus stop is about a 10min walk away and we found this better than the tube. Of course photos people post on here will always show the bad things but don't let them put you off. Can't praise the staff enough and we are already planning another little trip down to London later in the year and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “ok for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: bertrum
Reviews.Content: stayed only 1 night 04/02/12 tired hotel but not bad place to stay for the barbican or theatres. good value only for the fact that it was 50% off winter special. would not pay full price. no idea about breakfast as didn't have but felt the cost was a tad expensive compared to travelodge or premier inn chains.which put us off having that.costa coffee just around the corner. check in was bad. even though didn't try to check in until after 14.00 as stated on their web site. our room wasn't ready. waited 30mins and by then the room we were waiting for was given to another customer. why we weren't booked into that room and just asked to wait no idea.were offered a juice but really only wanted our room even if just to drop bags off. we didn't need a clean room for that. they were very busy but no excuse for the wait. normally we wouldn't worry but had a theatre to go to and time was tight. ended up a rush. the hotel was noisey. so bring good ear plugs if you want to sleep. being named as barbican is misleading a tad as 10-15min walk from there and hidden down a back streets. hard to find. directions were ok on their web but no details on how long it may take, suppose may put some people off. we wanted a twin room and could only book the family room but ended up in the twin so why we weren't offered that online another mystery. i e mailed them asking abot fridges in the room. still waiting for the answer so customer service may not be at the top of their list. don't expect 5 star from at best 2 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: lloydie666
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I was worried about my stay, however it wan't bad. The rooms are quite tiered, but mine was clean. The breakfast was very good. Ate in the restaurant on two occasions and the food was very good. The best thing about this hotel is the staff, everyone I met was polite and went out of there way to help. The area around the hotel is not great but saying that I didn't feel unsafe walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all for price!!”
Reviews.Author: kedge
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a nice little inexpensive weekend away and were not disappointed. We picked this hotel solely because it was coming up cheaper than other hotels and apart from old fashioned decor in bedrooms it was surprisingly nice, with a lovely bathroom and was very warm despite the cold temperature outside. My only quibble was we paid Â£10 each extra for breakfast ( which wasn't that nice) and it was really busy and we had to queue although the waiters came round with drink of juices while we were queuing to apologise for the delay. When we sat down for breakfast I had to hunt down a waiter for tea and coffee, and while my partner got a pot of coffee I only got one small cup of tea, but I put this down to them being very busy. Check-in and check out was very quick and we put a bag away behind the desk while we went out for the day and that was very efficiently done as well. On the whole I would definitely consider staying at this again hotel but would consider going to a cafe for breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “impeccable staff”
Reviews.Author: debbie007_10
Reviews.Content: Check in efficient and receptionist was delightful in fact every member of the hotel staff were polite and interested that we were having a good time. The bed and linen was perfect. room fairly compact but more than adequate. pool area good and restaurant menu was extensive and the food we chose was lovely and fairly priced.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation incompetence”
Reviews.Author: blackpoolmanLytham
Reviews.Content: We had a straight forward though a little strange request when staying at the thistle barbican. We booked a nights stay either side of a nights stay booked with the rest of our company to make a little break out of a long journey. My wife phone a head of the trip to explain the situation of or 3 nights stay which was no problem over the phone. However on check in the reservations team found the fact that we were staying three nights all in the same name albeit two different bookings hard to understand. Eventually the lady got the jist of our stay and got us to fill reservation cards in for the three nights saying we would not need to check in daily as first suggested. After our second nights stay the one the company booked and paid for we went for breakfast to find ou we was not on the breAkfast list and we needed to speak to reservations. After a lengthy conversation the situation once again was said to be fine for us to have breakfast and enjoy our day. Seen as it was our final day we decided to head out after breakfast sight see all day see a show then head back to the hotel. On our arrival to our room after a long long day imagine our suprise to come to a room that had not been made up. We tried to call reception to just ask for some tea and coffee to have a late night drink but the room phone was broke. My wife went to reception to ask for tea coffee explain about the room and tell them the phone was broke. They said the room had not been made up as we did not show for the previous nights stay. So my wife explained the situation again and reception said they would bring the tea and coffee to us. After 40 minuets and nearing 00.30 hours we were still waiting. We called reception from our mobile phone and asked politely for the tea and coffee again it eventually arrived some 50 minuets after we first asked for it. I can't believe this simple reservation request could cause such a mix up. It put quite a massive downer on a lovely break

Reviews.Title: “Was worried because of bad reviews, but no need to have been!”
Reviews.Author: Rose308
Reviews.Content: I booked a theatre trip plus hotel so chose the hotel due to closeness to shaftesbury ave. Took 10 minutes to tube but easy to get to. Had to wait to book in but offered complementary juice while we waited. Staff seemed efficient. It is a big hotel in not such a nice area but seemed safe day and night. Room comfortable. Cooked breakfast buffet great and staff again seemed very efficient especially as it seemed so busy sunday morning. Obviously, it is down to personal opinion but for just one night we couldn't really fault the hotel atall.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid”
Reviews.Author: Ritafromsomerset
Reviews.Content: I booked a group of 13 of us and the hotel went into meltdown. Staff was the most unhelpful i have ever encountered, they just could not care less. It took us nearly an hour to check in, by wanting to pay all rooms in one card I was made to feel this was the most outlandish request ever heard! Location was poor as well, not in the city at all! Some back alley roundabout way to feel part of the city of london. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price.”
Reviews.Author: slippeddisc
Reviews.Content: Great service from very friendly staff. Easy to find from old street tube stop. About 8 mins walk with a bag. Come out exit 7. Turn right on bath street straight after co op. Turn left onto lever st. You will get to the hotel after a few hundred metres on your right. Area felt very safe in the daylight. Pool and rooms need a refurb but for the price I got on the london town website I cant moan. Quiet relaxed place with good service. Food ok/edible but expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice, duff location”
Reviews.Author: Noiseboy999
Reviews.Content: The location wasn't that bad, reasonably clean, helpful staff. Just a bit of a mission to find it!!! Even though the hotel is in a rough area we walked back at 1am and felt safe. If we had decided to catch minicab it would have cost Â£15 from the lyceum which I didn't think was too much at all. The hotel also have a relationship with one cab firm, and the concierge was happy to organise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, as a good as a five star”
Reviews.Author: Elephant777
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on New Year's Eve. I got a great deal on LastMinute.Com through the secret hotels offer. It was so cheap for a central hotel in London on N Y Eve, I was amazed and simply had to book it. The hotel is centrally located within walking distance from Old Steet tube, plus there are several night bus stops close by as well. It's a little tricky to find and you suddenly come across it as you walk there. It's kind of in the middle of a residential area close to a council estate. The lobby is huge and posh. The reception staff are efficient and friendly. I stayed in a room opposite the reception, meaning you walk across a terrace and use your room card and enter another block. I found this to be fine. I took the lift to my room and was delighted with it. It was clean, well presented and very nice-looking for a London hotel. ( I have stayed in many London hotels in the 3-4 star range and few are as good as this..most are old and drab as that is the way London hotels are....) I had a TV with all cable channels, instant coffee/tea and kettle and free toilettries in the bathroom. The shower worked well, the room had decent sound proofing, the bed was comfy and I really liked it. I also felt safe (being a female). The hotel is quite big and tonnes of rooms line the corridor. The room is fairly small but not unusually so - the regular size of London four star hotels is small, but it wasn't too small. The concierge was really friendly and helped me with all my travel queries and seemed really knowledgeable about everything from taxis to buses - he was impressive. The only downside of this hotel is the location - in the sense it does border a council estate and at night, in the dark, you would not want to walk back from Old Street tube alone (at least not after 11pm). Having said that, it is only a 10-15 min walk and if you did walk back (as I did at 3am) it's unlikely anything will happen. The problem is there aren't that many people wandering around...on N Y Eve there were but that was an exception. I would suggest you get a cab home if walking back alone. There is a nightbus stop closer than the tube, but not that close and still a walk through some dark roads.. The breakfast the next day consisted of a help yourself buffet - scrambled eggs, croissants, pain au chocolats, make your own toast, fruit, fruit juice, coffee and tea - and some other stuff I didnt have...It was very nice and filling and breakfast staff were very attentive and professional and the ambience on N Y Day was great. It was heaving by the way. It's a popular hotel and lots of people stay there. The best part about this hotel is the pool though. There is an amazing indoors heated pool, sauna, steam room and jacuzzi that is just unspeakably good...I spent an hour in there relaxing and detoxing - I felt so great afterwards. The fact you get to use this for free if you stay in the hotel is unbeatable. You can swim proper lengths, and it's not the crowded. It's clean and really really nice. I love this place and would go back for sure. The concierge looked after my stuff as well when I checked out and I came back and collected it. Everything about this hotel is great. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, good for expensive London”
Reviews.Author: anggingyin
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Central London, close to main attractions by the Underground. The nearest Underground station is located about 15 minutes walk to nearest Old Street station, quite a distance if you have heavy luggage. I wish the hotel is nearer though as the everyday to and fro walk is quite a workout. The room is ok, serves the purpose but nothing fancy. However the cleaning lady kept forgetting to take away the used towels while giving us new towels so we were left with 2 towels each everyday. By the end of trip, the room was spewed with used towels and we hope that they were more attentive. Other than that, the reception and concierge staff was friendly and helpful. The Thistle group is a chain in UK and they have other locations in London which might be more Central. Depending on your budget, City Barbican will offer good value for your pound.

Reviews.Title: “no complaints whatsover”
Reviews.Author: kaaljkmn
Reviews.Content: Excellent and helpful staff, buffet breakfast as filling as one would want, clean rooms, comfortable, fairly good ocation near bus stops (bus 55 particularly helpful), shops, bars and services in the neighbourhood, quiet.

Reviews.Title: “A very tired hotel in need of overhaul”
Reviews.Author: Dr_SickNote
Reviews.Content: Stayed between Christmas & New Years 2011 with my wife; she shopped & I worked. The hotel is located about 10 minutes walk from the Barbican station and about a Â£5 cab ride if you prefer not to walk. Reception is well presented & modern and the staff were welcoming and found our reservation with ease; a glitch in the website meant that I was unable to book breakfast with the room and had to pay for that at check-in. Â£10 per person per day which if you eat like a horse is good value, there are plenty of small cafe's nearby if you prefer to eat out. My double room was on the first floor of the hotel and easily accessed by the lifts. Corridors on the first had a musky unpleasant smell to them, it was a combination of a food & damp smell. My first reaction when entering the room was how small it was; this was the smallest double room I'd stayed in and I spent about 4 months a year in hotels around the world. The bathroom was big enough to be functional but not so big as to enjoy with someone else, if you know what I mean here. As you will see in the photo's the room was very clearly in need of urgent refurbishment and was barely hanging together. What I couldn't show you in the photos was the bathroom floor where about 60% of the floor tiles had no glue fixing them to the floor; they just rattled about when you walk in there. The carpet in the room was threadbare and long past serviceable. The room does not have a mini bar and the space for the fridge was just an empty void which we thought would be useful for suitcases of other large fridge shaped objects. You can use your imagination here. There was no air conditioning in the room and you could switch the radiator on which turned the room into an over or open the window and you froze from the wind whistling in. I really don't expect a modern hotel in London not to have AC in the rooms, maybe 20 years ago perhaps. The bed had no cover to the divan and again from pictures I've added you can see what I hoped were water marks and not urine on the divan. The mattress had no mattress protector which meant that I was able to smell all the sweat from the many hundreds of guests who'd used that room before me. Breakfast was a decent choice of hot & cold, tea, coffee and fruit juices. But, as I've said before the Â£10 charge is acceptable if you eat like a horse. If I stayed again I would use the many local cafe's instead. We had an evening meal 1 night in the hotel and after a wait of 10 minutes our drinks arrived and then after 48 minutes our meals arrived. With about 10 other covers in the restaurant this is a grossly unacceptable wait. To summarise my review; this is a functional hotel in need of urgent refurbishment and modernisation. Based on my frequent use of hotels across London & the rest of the World I don't feel that I got value for money and left with a feeling that once you scratch beneath the shiny veneer of reception the quality drops off a cliff. With the shabby & threadbare state of my room cleanliness will always take a hit and that is unacceptable in my option. I would not recommend this hotel to friends or family and would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Much, much better than expected, but got lost on the way to and fro”
Reviews.Author: mediastar-1
Reviews.Content: I was really nervous about staying here, having read some of the reviews, I was expecting a dingy, scruffy, smelly, infested dump, with uncaring staff. While it was not perfect (no place is), it was far far far from that. Although I did get lost, I needed a taxi to get me there, check in was a breeze, my room was large and clean, with a perfectly adequate bathroom with extra towels in the wardrobe. I only had time to run in and out again as I was late to get to a concert, partly because I got lost, partly because of it not being that simple to find and partly because I had not realised that the traffic was so dreadful. I got lost again going to the concert which was my reason for being in that part of town in the first place, a young woman came out of a fast food shop and helped me part way stay on course and I managed to flag another taxi, so I only missed the first fifteen minutes, along with quite a few other folks. Excellent concert, I have to say. I didn't make the mistake of risking getting lost again, so when I came out of the venue, I flagged a cab and a super driver took me back. When I got to my room, I realised I had forgotten to eat all day. I looked at the room service menu and decided to order, I had prepaid for my room and breakfast so I had no need to set up a tab, but they were fine with my paying cash. Be aware, there is a Â£5 charge for them bringing the food to your room, which they explained before I ordered, even though it is not on the room information. The person I spoke to told me how long I would have to wait and a very cheerful and polite young man brought my meal to me and returned with my change, but he lost out on a tip due to the "Tray Charge", I'm afraid, I enjoyed my food and glass of wine very much. Everything works in the room, although the TV left a little to be desired in the tuning stakes. The bed and pillows were fine, crisp linens, extra pillows in bags in the wardrobe and nice lights that come on when you open the doors. I didn't sleep all that well, but that's not the fault of the hotel, I simply don't sleep well ever. Great shower in the morning, the towels were soft enough and big enough. Then I went down for breakfast. Lovely staff, although they were clearing a little too efficiently, so I only got up to collect stuff from the buffet (I would suggest getting down for breakfast a bit earlier than I did, as things were a little dry from the lights by 9am) and things vanished before I'd finished, like my glass of water, but another appeared before I had sat back down again. I would recommend booking off the Thistle website, my booking was the same price and included breakfast as room only on booking sites. All I needed to do was hand my key in as I left and, yes, I got lost again on the way to find a Number 4 busstop. I found the hotel staff helpful, friendly and professional, without exception. I am usually good at finding my way around but I found that area really difficult to negotiate, so if you are in the same kind of rush I was in, put some money aside for taxis. I would definitely stay there again if I were going to another concert at the Barbican.

Reviews.Title: “A good place for take a break”
Reviews.Author: Her90
Reviews.Content: Good attention from the Swedish receptionist who spoke Spanish with a desire to practice with us, very enjoyable. The room was nice and a hot shower after a busy day, the best option. The heating could not be regular but with a little skill the lowered because it was hot. The free breakfast buffet fantastic! A good option with a good deal, but can be expensive if you do not find the offer.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints from this guest”
Reviews.Author: moselej
Reviews.Content: I have just return from spending one night at this hotel and I have to say I am rather surprised at some of the comments. I booked this hotel 2 days ago via lastminute.com, one of their Top Secret Hotels so initially I only knew the location, but the cost was Â£85 which I thought was very good. I stayed in the main building on the second floor, yes it could probably do with updating slightly but my room was clean and tidy, nothing broken. It was quite and I had a comfortable night sleep, although the room was quite warm. In the morning when I noticed the kettle wasn't working although the light was on, I rang reception, got straight through and with 10 mins I had a replacement. I had my breakfast served as requested in my room at the time I had stipulated, very pleasant. Tube station is a 10 min walk away and I was in heels and pulling a case, not an issue. Staff are very pleasant and helpful and I would certainly stop here again. Just to add, over the years through work I have stopped in many hotels and although I would say it is not the best I have stayed in, it is definitely not the worst and as I have said, I would not have an issue staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't use Tesco Vouchers at this Hotel/Location”
Reviews.Author: Vivienne B
Reviews.Content: Myself and my daughter recently spent a 2 night break at this Hotel using Tesco Vouchers. The total cost was Â£405 including breakfast in a twin room (Â£255 vouchers + Â£150 cash) looking on the web at this Hotel since being back I think this was very overpriced and wonder if the price was hicked up beacuse of the vouchers! The Hotel although was very clean and the staff excellent was out on a limb and to use public transport involved at 15 minute walk for either underground or bus and returning at night in a not very good area wasn't good. London Taxi's are very expensive with a minimum charge of Â£15 just to get to the train station (Euston) and to much to mention to get back from the West End. so this extra cost has to be factored in to the cost. I think this Hotel is best suited to business people who are able to have all their expenses paid, I do not feeel it is suitable for a weekend away shopping or going to the Theatre simply because of the location. If me and my daughter visit London again we would not stay at the this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Miserable 2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Hotelregular1984
Reviews.Content: I have to work in London frequently and my normal hotel was unavailable for 2 nights this week so I was given the Thistle City Barbican hotel instead. Never again. The walk from Barbican tube station isn't too bad other than the areas you are walking through. On arrival the communal areas seemed reasonable and the lady who checked me in was friendly despite having atrocious levels of English and struggling to understand anything I say (which amounted to my name, address, yes and no). However, once I stepped in the lift I realised that the lobby is a lightly polished charade. Battered and stinking of cigarette smoke despite the shiny "no-smoking" sign on the wall its last clean must pre-date the smoking ban. I arrived at my room to find it was tiny, cold, smelly and incredibly tatty and dirty. The carpet stained, the furniture cheap and battered, the bed small and the TV not working. I needed an iron so looked around and couldn't find one in the room. I read the guest services book in the room, the yellowed food-stained, pages told me there was an iron and ironing board in my room. Needless to say there wasn't. I called reception, it was engaged, I called room service and they put me through to reception and I asked for said iron and ironing board. This was at 9pm, my intention was to iron my shirt and then go to sleep. They said they would send one up. At 10pm I called back and was told it would be on its way. I eventually gave up and went to sleep at 11pm - 2hrs later than I had anticipated and still with creased clothes. In the morning I woke up tired, freezing and itchy to the sound of at least a dozen pigeons right outside my window - there were some flapping in the air as they couldn't find room to land amongst all their friend! I called reception once again, this time it took 15mins for them to answer - I asked for an iron for a third time. This time it arrived 15 mins later, I answered the door in my towel and the woman gave me a look as if to say - why are you answering the door undressed!? (I can't iron my shirt!!). The iron was next to useless and the ironing board was broken. It collapsed to its lowest setting and I resolved to ironing on my knees then going to work in a half creased shirt. In the bathroom I found the remains of someone's poo smeared in the bowl and the shower curtain had splodges of blood stained on it. I didn't have time to complain about any of this (for all the good it would do and the responsiveness of the iron request) and headed off to work. That night I stayed in the office until 11pm to avoid the hotel room for as long as possible. The food was out of my price range and given the levels of cleanliness and hygiene on display in other areas of the hotel I wouldn't have eaten it for free. My usual hotel costs Â£20 more than this but has free wifi. I had to pay Â£20 for wifi here so that cancelled that out. How Â£20 for 48hr wifi is justifiable in a major capital city in 2011 is beyond me. You'll notice the manager answers reviews on tripadvisor (and fair play for doing so) but they always, always follow the same formula. Pick up something positive the reviewer said and spin it to sound like a compliment. On that basis you can fully expect mine to say "I'm glad you liked the reception area and found our staff friendly, you rightly point out that we do have irons and wifi available in the hotel and local wildlife outside your window." The manager never refers to the state of the rooms. It's absolutely disgusting. I've stayed, with no word of a lie, in youth hostels in East Europe with fair better states of repair. Yet they have the nerve to charge people such significant sums of money. The crux of how bad this hotel is is how poorly maintained it is. In an ideal world the management would have a choice, cut their prices to youth hostel standard or refurbish the whole builiding. The reality is that they are raking in cash for such an awful, awful product they hardly care and no matter how many reviews on tripadvisor you try to answer, if you don't care they may as well give up.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job but avoid the concierge service”
Reviews.Author: Burdocks
Reviews.Content: My company placed me here for one night as it was the closest hotel to my business dinner location. Check in was professional and friendly. Concierge wasn't very helpful at all and I would question whether he had been trained at all.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: craigeuan
Reviews.Content: As I write this I am holding for "Customer Service" at Thistle - not for the first time. And yes....the lines gone dead. Be warned the customer care number on the website is for reservations not customer care. That number is 0207 138 0000 wher you will put through to customer srvices who dont pick up. on november 24th my wife and I booked in for one night. It was last minute but the location seemed ok. Ir ithis was a truly awful experience and thank god it was for only one night! It is a souless place but the staff were pleasnat enough. The room was terrible and the noise that the 4 or 5 people in the room next door made - all night - was of relentless. The constant wrapping and unwrapping of cellophane packages could be heard through the connecting door. What were they doing ?? The window catches were broken so noise from outside was awful too. The bathroom was very grim , broken taps, stains. At reception the next morning we were told that their computer system had crashed and that invoices would be emailed. We asked that the manager call us so that we might explain how unhappy we were. Neither has happened. So we learnt a lesson. Dont stay at the Thisltle City Barbican even if it is last minute. Even if g rer next , God obsolluess

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but not cheap enough!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew_1975
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business as I was attending an event at the barbican. My room was in the tower across from reception. My first room had a screeching bathroom fan that could be heard from the corridor. Reception moved me quickly so no complaints there however the second room was very small with a tiny bathroom. Cleanliness was average but as the decor is so 80's no amount of scrubbing would ensure the room felt properly clean. Overall, whilst the room was cheap for the area, I wish I had paid more and gone somewhere better. I cant fault the service of the staff though.

Reviews.Title: “Management need to clamp down”
Reviews.Author: nic_280359
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Thistle city London Barbican from 2-4 dec 2011, a package consisting of two nights, dinner first night, full english breakfast & theatre tickets and booked through Superbreak for my husband's 50th birthday present. Greeted at reception by a girl who couldn't find the booking, and worse couldn't speak very good english.Once we were finally booked in by what we thought was a more competent receptionist we found we had only been booked in for one, not two nights. That was resolved fairly quickly. We were looking forward to a lovely three course meal on the first night, what we got was poor to say the least. Each paying guest in the dining room on friday night had cause for complaint, one group of about 12 ladies all ordered starters and one of the group received her's when everyone else had finished, the excuse was they were waiting for it to be done (how long does it take to prepare prawn cocktail??) the lack of service, poor food and general malaise of the staff throughout the hotel was apparent. The restaurant staff were running around like headless chickens but getting nowhere!!The soup we ordered was cold on arrival, it came with one slice of bread, no butter/spread we waited twenty minutes for it to be returned....the main course was ok so far as it went..we then ordered dessert and at 9.15 they had run out of one of the two hot desserts entirely. Guests were refusing to pay for their food and walking out, another couple had to wait an hour for pate and toast, if i had not pre paid on the package deal i too would have refused to pay. Breakfast was even more chaotic...queueing for a table i suppose is to be expected... the greeter then went off to reset tables that had been used when there were more than enough staff to do this but they seemed unsure what they should be doing.... leaving the guests to wait even longer. The breakfast was acceptable but the wait for food to be replenished was annoying. The crockery was being piled high on the window sills and no-one seemed prepared to move it. I had to ask for clean utensils and glasses both mornings. I have stayed in thistle hotels on many occasions before and never had cause for complaint even the beds were like solid wood!!! and it spoilt the weekend for me. This was an expensive gift for my husband and the hotel spoilt it, it was made worse by their lack of apology when i complained.

Reviews.Title: “Room was filthy - avoid!”
Reviews.Author: ob1knbxtrail
Reviews.Content: Appreciate that the rate offered is low for a London Hotel but that does not man that basic standards of cleanliness do not apply. I was absolutely appauled at the state of the room.Furniture, walls and celing were covered with various marks and stains. Picture of solied mattress attached. I raised a complaint through my company and the response from Thistle Hotels did not deny a housekeeping problem, but offered a free upgrade next time I visit! Absolutely no way I would go anywhere near it again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit worn but fine.”
Reviews.Author: django2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in the Thistle after my works Christmas party. The check in was slow at 3pm. Not sure if I was just unlucky with timing but 15 minutes is too long to wait to check in. Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Bit of noise from near by building site in the morning but that's not the hotels fault. I'd come back early from the party so spent longer in my room than anticipated but it was perfectly adequate To those reviews who say its a long way from the tube, Angel, Barbican, Old Street are all within 10 minutes walk. This part of town is a bit in limbo but within 10 minutes walk you can be in any of the above mentioned places or Clerkenwell. There were a few things that showed the rooms were in need of a bit of love, rips in the curtains, door handle surround in the bathroom was falling off, old shower curtain connectors still on the rail, large chips out of the bed side table top. It was well worn but just shorty of tatty.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: emi_demi
Reviews.Content: I have just checked out of this hotel. The reviews are a very mixed bag and I think that really depends on which side you stay of the hotel you stay on. There are two "towers". These are not far apart. Literally across the foyer. However the room quality must be far apart given the reviews. Firstly, it took me an hour to check in. I gave my name and..no reservation. I advised I had a booking ref through trip advisor and could they let me just log on to get it. They told me the charge would be 10! I declined. Eventually got my temperamental single sorted and showed the ref. I didn't get an apology. Just another wait whilst they blamed superbreaks. Good practice would have just been to check me in whilst they sorted it out. The food in the evening was overpriced and mediocre. The room was a tiny single room. It reminded me of my student halls of residence. It was hot and the window would not properly close. The tv was about the same size as the free floorspace. The bedroom was clean but badly run down. I didn't get a good sleep because of the noise. The next day the shower was ok but I was horrified when I saw the shower curtain. It had blood stains on it. I told a colleague and they called reception whilst I was at work to get it sorted. Came back for night 2 and it was just the same. All in a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Katrinamassingham
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negatove reviews for this hotel I was slightly apprehensive about staying here but needn't have been. Rooms are clean and comfortable, reception area and bar area is spaciuos and staff are friendly and helpful. Use of the hotel pool, sauna and jacuzzi is also included in the price of the hotel which is a bonus. Location is also very convenient for most central london locations and tube stations are within walking didtance. We were unlucky that the undergraound was out of order but taxi was only a few minutes from Oxford Street. We got a taxi in the evening for Â£4 to Angel Islington where we found a nice Thai Restaurant. Plenty of bars and entertainment here in the evening. All in all a good hotel would visit again

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Brecon Beacons National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Extra Toothpick!”
Reviews.Author: Sheshep3
Reviews.Content: Mum & I stayed here last weekend [19th Nov]. The only good thing about it is the staff! Hotel needs decorating, rooms cramped. Breakfast like Butlins! We had a drink in the bar after a brilliant show - Warhorse-I fancied some olives. They arrived in a bowl on a plate with wrapped white plastic toothpicks to eat them with.[ Very Tasteful-not!] I had eaten about 5 when I noticed another toothpick in the bowl. We looked at each other with horror. The waitress was very apologetic and reported her concerns to the on duty manager. She gave me my money back and said a manager would speak to me in the morning- he did not! We won't be staying here again. Sorry to the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Alternative to West End”
Reviews.Author: cziwkga
Reviews.Content: Although situated away from the obvious haunts of the West End this hotel is still conveniently situated for getting to most parts of London. I would baulk at paying some of the rates I've seen quoted but was reasonably happy with the discount I got for a weekend night at only 24 hours notice - unusual for a central London hotel. The rooms, even the 'deluxe double', aren't large but the amenities are reasonable. Beware though - prices quoted on their booking site are ex-VAT until the final stages of payment. It's not an exceptional hotel but the upper floors do offer good views over parts of the City skyline.

Reviews.Title: “dont expect too much”
Reviews.Author: Duncan T
Reviews.Content: Choose your London hotel carefully, i stayed at the Thistle Barbican last night and wasnt impressed i paid Â£ 126.00 for a room which made a travel lodge feel like the Savoy. Dont let them fob you off with a room in the block opposite the main building. I had a first floor room next to the main road traffic lights. the window was such a bad fit that i heard every vehicle pass by, the room was cold because the radiator was no more than luke warm, the wallpaper was peeling, the ceiling was dirty, the tiles were falling off the bathroom wall and the bathroom was so small that you virtually had to stand in the bath to close the door Everything was poor quality.I ate in the hotel restaurant and although the food was ok i resented paying a service charge for a waitress who was rude and to say the best had only a basic understanding of the English language. I complained at reception when checking out but was offerded only a passing apology. Whatever happened to value for money and good levels of service in this country!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: 365Cosmosmallpiece
Reviews.Content: Just a 2 night stay in a V busy hote, remembrance weekend, and Lord Mayors Show. Everything fine, breakfast can be a bore queuing for table but food good, staff friendly, nice walk to St Pauls, or Angel Islington with good restaurants, will use again. It was a "Times" package

Reviews.Title: “Just the job...”
Reviews.Author: ScoobyLeicester
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here as part of a show package. The location is fine 10 mins from old street station... The hotel was clean staff were friendly and the couple of issues we did have (no electric, room change) were sorted out very quickly with no fuss. The hotel has had part refurb the double room was fab very comfortable bed, iron, tea n coffee...very clean. The bar was a little pricy bit then all hotel bars are. Whilst it was busy at breakfast the wait was short and the choice of food was worth the wait. All in all a very pleasant experience..don't read to much into some of the negativity about this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Horrible..”
Reviews.Author: misteri0ustraveller
Reviews.Content: I have to say this is one of the worst hotels I've stayed in in London. My room had the smallest twin beds possible and both were ROCK HARD. I'm pretty sure some of the rooms have been refurbished, but the room I was in definitely was NOT. I'm pretty certain it was because I wasn't in the main building (if you have to go outside and cross the road to get to your room after you've checked in, you're in trouble...). Wifi isn't free and I wouldn't say it's in the best area. Wouldn't recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “terrible rooms, overpriced food, poor location”
Reviews.Author: kingmobuk1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business and had a very pokey single room in the second building. However collegues had superior room that were literally Â£3 more so if you have to book early and pay for an upgrade. Breakfast was terrible especially for the price. Save your money and go to one of the cafes just across the road. Thistle wanted Â£17 each, the cafe served four of us for Â£15 with large helpings! Wifi isnt free in the rooms - Bt Openzone. Use ipass if your company has it. London is expensive enough without being ripped off for breakfast before you start the day! Check in was very slow and they dont provide porters, lots of twisty turny corridoors to rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, but needs attention”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a weekend at the Thistle on 12-13th November and have stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions. To be fair, it's not in a great area of London which lets it down. However, and more importantly, the staff were very helpful and welcoming which always makes the difference. I've stayed in both the newer building and over the road in the older part (where I was this weekend). The older part needs some renovation and arguably more transparency when booking. The hotel should be aiming for all of its rooms to be 'delux rooms'. I was disappointed to find that the smaller '120' bar was not open at weekends (only Monday-Thursday) as this is more atmospheric than the bar adjacent to the reception area by the hotel's main entrance. As a suggestion, a differentiator would be to offer free Wi-Fi (or just free Wi-Fi in the public areas) - other London hotels can offer this. Not all visitors are business travellers who can expense wireless connectivity.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: Ladybirdx86
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a theatre trip and we really enjoyed it. The breakfast time was a bit busy with a bit of waiting but overall we really enjoyed and it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: DixieD_9
Reviews.Content: I stay regularly at this hotel and am always surprised to read the negative reviews it receives. I agree it's location could be better, but in terms of the facilities and staff, it compares favourably with hotels in a more central London location. My room is always very clean and all facilities are in working order. The reception, concierge and bar staff are always very friendly and their service is prompt. Any concerns are promptly dealt with. It appears that the annexe building is the reason for many of the complaints, however I've seen people who have asked, moved over to the main building without any argument. I recommend this hotel to colleagues who have used it, again without complaint

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Michele R
Reviews.Content: Arrived 8pm queued 20 mins to check in took forever for each person I have never known anywhere to take so long on a simple task. Then I got to the room which was fine - ordered room service 30 mins they say, after 40 mins I ring another 5 mins they say, 5 mins later they ring me and say sorry we haven't got any salads left needless to say I was not happy to wait nearly an hour to be told this. Checking out was almost as slow staff seemed ok but the system and processes are dire. Wasn't just me either as I commented in the lift (which was also slow) and everyone nodded and started saying how they must make a special effort to take as long as possible. As a business traveller I will never stay there again and unless you have a lot of spare time would keep clear.

Reviews.Title: “Lacklustre”
Reviews.Author: Yazoofiend
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Hotel for two nights last week. The room was ok, however there was no TV remote so I attempted to ring reception for one, after 10 minutes of ringing and no answer, I decided the better option was to go down to reception to resolve the situation. The room I was in was 1360 as already stated the room was suitable. However being situated so close to the lift with it's very loud "pinging, tinging" every time it arrived at the floor was irritating. The service in the restaurant was adequate but the food was awful. On my first night I had Gammon steak which was very salty and the plate was covered in water/juice. The second night I had a "Roast Beef Sandwich" In my naivity I expected a bloomer style beef sandwich, what I actually got was the cheapest bread imanginable, I had to send the first sadnwich back as the beef slices were thicker than the bread, it looked like the bread had been squashed flat, the second sandwich was not much better and for Â£7.50 the whole thing was a joke. The requested desert "Trifle" advertised as being available 24/7 was infact not availablel. The restaurant tried to overcharge me for my meal, and watch out for the "discretionay" 12.5% service charge. In my opinion you should earn tips by offering good service with good food, not have it become a right of passage. After I had asked for that to be removed from the bill the revised bill was just dropped onto the table in a huff. Overpriced and rubbish.

Reviews.Title: “Thistle City Barbican Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: RICHIEONTOUR_10
Reviews.Content: Appearance and facilities are good-to-excellent. Location is less than best, and is northeast central London, about 12 blocks from Barbican tube sta; and about 6 blocks from Old Street Sta. An aggressive walker, I did not find this a problem and was able to navigate most all of London by foot and tube easily 3 times over. Hotel has pool, gym, incl. Desk staff is an abomination. Personnel create backup at the desk by ignoring all customers. They do not meet your eyes to assure you they are aware of your presence....they take people out of turn; they disappear into back rooms with folks lined up for anything from key card failure to room problems. During my stay, housekeeping apparently broke a glass and left it covered for re-use in the lavatory. Shower facility instructions for use advise to pull up on nobs that don't exist. TV remote never worked. Desk lamp bulb was burned out; it was replaced with a night appliance bulb. They apparently have no checklist to prepare a room for use. There are three (3) people at concierge, but only one maintains the quality of service one should expect. This is magnified because the desk staff takes on nothing but the minimal desk services, sending all other needing customers to the concierge for aid. Kitchen staff at breakfast, and breakfast...excellent....coffee person very good; maitre d' obsessed with chasing down customers who mistakenly come in the wrong entrance to satisfy a room number recording fetish. This breakfast maitre d' needs an attitude check. Main restaurant meal reflected the excellent kitchen staff and wait service.

Reviews.Title: “Poor on so many levels”
Reviews.Author: ClarkeAT
Reviews.Content: Really a dower hotel in the middle of nowhere. Evening food was sub-standard - gristly. What ever you do don't order the Cumberland sausage and mash as they'll come back to you after an hour to tell you they haven't got any!

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel.”
Reviews.Author: LA1Wales
Reviews.Content: All staff were friendly and helpful, inparticular the concierge. Room was clean and ok. On the downside the pillows were too thick and hard and the hairdrier in the bathroom was unsuitable for use (just giving a little light breeze) Ladies take your own! If your going to be spending some time in your room there are only 4 channels on the TV. Although there was a reasonable choice of food at breakfast, the cooked just wasnt up to much and seemed to of been around a while. Finally the hotel was too far from the nearest tube (Old Street) for what we required and on the wrong side of London for the sights we wanted to see....but this was more our fault for choosing this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Such a shame...”
Reviews.Author: sambolace
Reviews.Content: I was only here one night as I had a course nearby. The room was basic, with 2 single beds instead of the double I had booked. The window was jammed open and even the reception and handymen couldn't close it so I had noise drifting in all night (luckily it wasn't a cold night) I couldn't get a clear picture on the TV and the bathroom was dingy and not very clean looking. Considering I spent close to Â£200 on this I am not happy.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs!!”
Reviews.Author: doughboyBolton
Reviews.Content: How Thistle can put their name to this hotel, god only knows. I really can't think what tourists coming to England must think if this is their first impression. Based in a really run-down area of London the hotel is situated in what is basically a back street with a filthy entrance area. Once inside one is greeted by incompetent (although pleasant) staff. No-one else was was at reception but it still took 20 minutes to check-in. When finally given my key i was directed to room 2114. The room is a throwback to hostels of the '70's with filthy floor and walls, peeling wallpaper, ceiling tiles falling down and a tiny bathroom with cracked tiles, mildew and a 99 pence shower head. The window would neither open or shut properly with broken locks and an outlook over a half-derelict shopping precinct. At least the bed was comfortable but that may have been because I was levitating for fear of catching something. Breakfast consited of overcooked and congealed food (and i was down for breakfast at 7.15 am). The receptionist summed it up when i responded to the question "did you have a pleasant stay?" by stating "absolutley not, the room was a disgrace", she just shrugged her shoulders. A truly horrible hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Two different hotels”
Reviews.Author: T22303
Reviews.Content: if you stay in the main building this is a good hotel. The annex, however is old, dirty and definitely not up to standard. I don't think anything has been painted or replaced in this building in over 20 years. Check-in was slow due to the number of people complaining about rooms in the annex and I don't blame them. Inisist in the main building or don't go!

Reviews.Title: “A sound london hotel, a with a could do better subtext”
Reviews.Author: matt_from_nottingham
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Thistle City Barbican a number of times before; infact over the last ten years I have probably stayed there for over a month in total. It is a good location just off the Northern Line (10 minutes walk, two routes with pubs on the way), fairly reliable quality standards and a nice pool area. Arriving on a sunday mid-afternoon I was checked in by a trainee; which I was happy to wait a little longer for them to learn the ropes. I was in the main building in one of the deluxe rooms due to a half term special offer. On arrival at the room, I found housekeeping had not yet finished, but I had an apology and I waited outside for 10 minutes, a little frustrating I know. The pool was clean and not too overcrowded; although you need to bring your own padlock for the lockers now, some are available to borrow, but not many. BT Openzone coverage on the fifth floor where I was staying was problematic; I had to use the wireless in the hotel bar area. We ate in the restaurant on the first night; I opted to try one of their 'signature dishes' it was very nice. I was a little disappointed that the Service Charge was added by default with no explantation and the waitress was unsure what it was for. On the next two nights we ate at the Bavarian Beerhouse just around the corner; Snitzel Madness at Â£15 including a beer! I didn't have breakfast in the hotel, opting to buy a banana and cereal bar from the shop around the corner (the one opposite the hotel has a rather limited choice, so walk around the corner). The hotel has been spruced up since I was last here, although the rooms are still a little dated. A technical fault, hotel wide, with BBC1 meant I had to watch the last episode of spooks with subtitles, but I could live with that! :-)

Reviews.Title: “last resort”
Reviews.Author: kristalgazer
Reviews.Content: been here 4 times before ,not clean ,never be pushed into staying in the rooms across the road,meals too expensive, manager didnt want to help with my complaints about room, parking a pain,this time is the last time our company will use this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “We overpaid!!”
Reviews.Author: boers
Reviews.Content: For some reason all London hotels were full at time we wanted to visit, so we booked Thistle Barbican thru website of lastminute london.com at cost of $320.00 per night. We normally would never pay that much, but didn't have much choice due to scarcity of rooms.For that price we would expect get amenities of 4 or 5 star hotel, but Thistle Barbican is definitely 2 or 3 star. Thanks to trip advisor we saw many negative comments on the annex of the hotel, so I sent email to the manager requesting that we be placed in main bldg. Of course he never replied, and naturally we ended up in the annex bldg. This place has all the charm of a Salvation Army hostel. On our second night we were able switch to main bldg while not luxurious was ok compared to annex.Had we paid about half of what we paid the hotel would be acceptable, but at $320.00 it was total rip off. Saw many college kids staying there, and sure they paid no where near what we paid

Reviews.Title: “Get up early for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kevin S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel last weekend and found the hotel itself to be clean and with friendly if a little slow staff. However it is a good 20 minutes walk away from the nearest tube and in a less than pleasent area that you dont really want to walking around late at night. The only other comment worth making is that guests had to que for breakfast for more than 45 minutes on the Sunday morning, it was an absolute shambles and lots of people were getting very angry with the staff. So if your staying here allow for extra spends on taxi's to and from the hotel and get up early for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel at London Prices”
Reviews.Author: RUTHRIESTON
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs some work done, chairs in rooms old and dirty, some wallpaper missing from walls, television box control with back missing. Food in restaurant very average and service average.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to all of the staff.”
Reviews.Author: Brenda W
Reviews.Content: Having recently returned from our stay, both my husband and I enjoyed everything about our stay. The accomodation was spacious, well furbished, with a beautiful bathroom and wider than average bed. The staff were efficient, yet friendly, without exception. Angelo Baldanza, Concierge, was superb, This young man is a credit to your organisation. Although surrounded by luggage and people, all with different queries, he kept calm, working his way through. He even greets you by name! Given the number of guests he must deal with, this is a truly exceptional talent. Well done... we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: nearlydunroamin
