Reviews.Content: Not much going for this Hotel. It is not well located, its not well appointed, and its not wellcoming. The Hotel straddles a side street is not handy for the tube or bus routes. The rooms are small, scruffy and not very clean. It is busy which is surprising considering the eyewatering rates. My advice is to look elsewhere although good Hotel accomodation at a resaonable price is hard to find in this part of London.

Reviews.Title: “loved it and will be going again”
Reviews.Author: racheljp1986
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend has just got back from having the weekend at this hotel when i booked the hotel i read the reviews and was kind off freaking out as i had never stayed in this part of town and had saved up quite alot of money to make this stay special as my boyfriend never been to london. What a great shock i had every one was very welcoming we got to the hotel well before checking in but was allowed to keep our bags there to return later on so we could go shopping. The rooms was very clean we was on the 4th floor in a standard room which was glam compered to the other places i had stopped in everything was posh to us and will defo be going back to this hotel and we got around everywhere in good walking distance and the tube is not to far either city road to central road is longest old road to central is the far quickest i will be recommending this hotel everyone has there opinions but from a person that needs to keep an eye on money i have no faults.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Eastwoodn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel organised by the company we work for, thinking great it's at same location as our two day induction only to be disappointed not only with the room and level of cleanliness. But also the food in the restaurant. When we checked in they asked us if we wanted to book a table for dinner, which we duly did, however when we went down for dinner there was no table for us available. I could go on but would not recommend this hotel to anyone. We stayed in the main buidling too.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special - avoid the restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: nlay
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in September 2011 on a business trip. Check in was quick and the room was clean but nothing special. The swimming pool and gym facilities are a nice bonus however the restaurant is pretty rubbish. Overpriced, slow service and bland. I'd avoid at all costs! Whilst my room was fine (3rd floor in the main building), colleagues who I was staying with told me that the rooms in the annex wing were pretty poor so if you are staying here try to get a room in the main building. I probably wouldn't choose to stay here again but for a business trip it's okay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst and not the best”
Reviews.Author: Taxinick
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in the hotel this weekend gone, after reading the reports on here I had cause for concern. When we arrived it seemed really ok as time went on you notice the things that people had commented on, yes the room was a bit dated and tatty but i was reasonably clean. The facilities where not as described, there where no tea or coffee in the room and when I asked at reception they said "We will sort that out" but the never did, the free lift into the centre wasnt happening either. The breakfast was very good but very very busy you had to queue to get in, the first day we where asked did we want to have breakfast on the first floor so we accepted and went up, big mistake the food was cold it was just a complete disaster. So my tip is to wait in the queue. My overall experience was that the hotel was only just OK. Would I stay again ? probably yes if the deal was right I certanly would not pay the full asking price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: PeskyFly
Reviews.Content: After looking at the reviews on here I wasn't expecting much. Managed to book the room for Â£71 a night so rate was good. Room was nice and I thought the hotel was really nice but I suppose it depends what you have paid. The only down side is that it is a about 20 walk from the nearest tube which was a pain. I would definately go back if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the money”
Reviews.Author: cbarberxx
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Barbican off-and-on for the last ten years for business. It seems to be getting better every time, but isn't quite there yet. It is by no means bad, but if you are from the US and want the stereotypical "London Experience", you might look elsewhere. The rooms are small, even for european standards, and are very out dated. The hotel amenities outside of the rooms are very nice and have recently been remodeled. The location is "out of the way" with about a mile walk to St. Paul's Cathedral and the milineum bridge, other than that you'll need to hit the tube station a couple blocks away to sightsee. The Barbican district, through the years, seems to be getting more and more safe and a lot hipper. 10 yrs ago I wouldn't walk to the tube after dark. I wouldnt think twice about doing it now. Good resaurants nearby and a great pub a block down on the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely dire”
Reviews.Author: pmallett11
Reviews.Content: Â£430 for two nights in a dingey single room at Thistle Barbican. The room is shoddy - peeling paint - the cold tap runs hot...and no one answers the phone on reception after 15 mins waiting....what a terrible, terrible hotel

Reviews.Title: “one hell of 2 ropey nights!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jo a a
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed in the Thistle this time last year, we would of wrote of a reveiw sooner, but didn't know how. I will know tell you our story. Firstly, we arrived after a long lousy journey at about 4 ish. Only to find our room was not ready. We were on a tight schedule and had to be out by 5 so were rushed. Then after finally recieing our rooms keys, we went to our room, then all hell broke loose. The skirting boards were scratched, the shower was pathetic, horrible veiw, noisy, broken fan, rock hard pillows, stained carpet, toilet not flushed from last usage, dagger lamps, and a HAIR in the shower. Whilst getting ready, a unvited visitor (a cleaner) open our door and walked in, then saw us, didn't apologise and walked back out. It was scary for to young girls as we didn't know who this women was at the time, as the cleaning staff had no uniform. The breakfast was discusting and there was a hair in my sausage. Location was rubbish, don't be fooled by the website, or the posh hotel lobby. However staff were friendly and when the shower broke they came up straight away. Take our and the 78 other pages of advice, don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst value hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: matt_197821
Reviews.Content: I'm sat in the hotel writing this review, the hotel was booked for 290 GBP a night as it was a last minute company trip. I wouldn't pay 290 GBP for a month here, here's why: The room is poor, feels like I've landed in a bad 80's pastiche of a shabby hotel room The pillows are like stunted draught excluders, I had to use a cushion from the bed to prevent neckache The internet has dropped out 3 times in an hour There are 2 lifts for the whole hotel, I've spent a lot of time waiting for them It's not convenient for any tube station (go for old street) The lack of premium TV channels is disappointing (290 quid a night I'd expect sky sports, I could get a years subscription for that) The staff are a bit weird, it's like they've read the manual on what to do but don't know how to execute it I have silverfish in my room It's a shame that supply and demand mean this hotel will continue to exist and thrive and it doesn't deserve too. I feel embarrassed as a coach load of american's have arrived, they will think this is UK hospitality. I'm sure the manager will respond with a professional and nice response to this, that's a good touch but it's a bit late to be saying sorry afterwards.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and pleasant staff - shame about the bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: judithtravel_11
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay in hotel accommodation and have never felt compelled to write a bad review until I stayed at the Barbican Thiste Hotel. Although the staff were very efficient and pleasant and the public rooms were of a good standard, the bedrooms need refurbishment if they are to compete for business travellers in the future and I for one will not return to their chain. My room was on the front of the building and being in London I expected traffic noise, but this was exasperated by the fact that I could not close my window. There was a problem with the window which kept dropping despite a maintenance man coming to close it. The draught caused me to wake up feeling cold. I had to resort to putting my extra clothes on the bed and to wearing a jumper! The bathroom tap was extremely loose and the whole room was uninviting and shabby looking. This is not acceptable and does not give the right sort of message to tourists and businessmen and women that visit our capital city - come on Thistle! The room cost Â£185 with breakfast - way over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Value + 2 TOP TIPS”
Reviews.Author: Chatham75
Reviews.Content: The hotel was okay for what I paid (the room was clean and the breakfast tasty). Here's 2 tips for you: TIP 1 - the directions on the hotel website are rubbish - take the Tube and get off at OLD STREET which is the nearest station. When you come out, take EXIT 7 (there's 9 Exits in total out of the station so it's easy to get lost), walk along the street & turn right immediately after the Co-op shop, after 100yds turn left on to Lever Street, the hotel is then another 100yds on your right. TIP 2 - try out the Barbican Pizza shop directly opposite the hotel (their Pizza is lovely and it's cooked fresh - they also do Pasta & you can sit in), the restaurant in the hotel only offer frozen pizza straight from the supermarket. - You pay for what you get and for the money, this hotel is reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BigAl066
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit Jeckell & Hyde. We stayed in the adjacent building which appeared to be their conference area. The main part of the building was very pleasant and what you would expect of a hotel in this price range. The adjacent building has seen better days and frankly erring on the side of grubby. The room was clean apart from, what appeared to be a blood stain on the carpet and some hair items left by the previous resident. Having said all this had a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster - Bugs on the Floors!!! - Hotel to be Avoided”
Reviews.Author: JohnCHants
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this nightmare of a hotel. There where silverfish scuttling about the carpets and bathroom floors. Especially galling when you used the bathroom in the dark so as not to wake someone else to then see that in the morning, special moment I wouldnâ€™t recommend anyone repeat. They also put you in a building across from the main building and then charge you a Â£5 surcharge for bringing the foods to your room. This place needs to be avoided at all costs and should be closed.

Reviews.Title: “excellent weekend”
Reviews.Author: willywildcat77
Reviews.Content: stayed in thistle city and really enjoyed our weekend, had a fab evening meal in restaurant friday night and the 2 breakfasts we had were top class,everything from fresh fruit to full english, thanks to all at city thistle for a lovely weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Friendly staff....not a great location..............”
Reviews.Author: Pudworth
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, I almost cancelled, and was glad that I didn't - The location of this hotel is not great, next to a council block, and fifteen minutes walk from the Tube, but the hotel itself is as good as anyone else in the Thistle chain As a small tip, there are plenty of nice bars and pubs if you head south from the hotel (two minuts walk) All the public areas, reception, rooms and bar/eating areas are really clean, and I didnt see any of the problems that other people have mentioned. There was a small problem with the overflow on my bath on the first night, but the maintenance man could not have been there quicker, and fixed the problem immediately The breakfast was great - better than other hotels I stay at............... The staff here are really friendly, very professional, and genuinely want to do a good chance - Give them a chance! :-)

Reviews.Title: “There are far better, far cheaper hotels in London”
Reviews.Author: James R
Reviews.Content: I was working, with my team in London for a week and, unfortunately, our company booked us into this '4 star' hotel. On arrival, the receptionist REFUSED to accept our pre supplied company credit card which the room had been booked on and demanded alternative payment (i.e. my personal card) at a rate Â£50 per night higher than we had booked for. This was 7 people (Â£195 per night). After lengthy discussions, calling the manager who had booked the rooms at 11pm (we'd had a long day!) we finally managed to get checked in and room keys issued (took over an hour). Impressions of the rooms? Dirty, small, badly in need of an overhaul, wall paper hanging off, floor tiles in bathroom peeling, curtains hanging off, peephole glass in door missing (could see the bed from the corridor) and to cap it all off, one of the rooms main door handle fell off when trying to get in. Took another 45 minutes for that person to be found another room! This hotel does not deserve 4 stars and I'm embarrased for all the foreign visitors who stay here, there are far better, cheaper hotels. My team an I will be staying at a Grange Hotel when we go back in couple of weeks. A few of us have stayed in ones before and they are lovely (oh, and at least Â£50 a night less!)

Reviews.Title: “I only needed a comfortable bed for the night in a clean room, and it fell short on both!”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a twin room in May 2011. The hotel was very busy and check in was very chaotic- exacerbated by the fact that that it is used at the weekend by a hen night website. Our room was very small and although the bedroom was fairly clean, the bathroom was not- hairs in the shower and the toilet had not been cleaned properly. The beds were okay but my pillow was rock solid. The hotel does provide spare pillows but these were all the same! We had a drink in the bar downstairs and found it very expensive. There is a swimming pool but it was packed full and very noisy. One positive was that breakfast was delicious- an enormous selection of continental and cooked breakfast buffet- I couldn't fault this. I was disappointed by my stay at the Thistle because as a well-known chain, I felt that it failed to meet basic standards. I only needed a comfortable bed for the night in a clean room, and it fell short on both!

Reviews.Title: “I am not sure I will be in a hurry to go back”
Reviews.Author: gamfruit
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the previous reviews about the location of the hotel and I thought some reviewers might have suffered from the Mrs Bucket syndrome but it was actually true that the walk at night from Old St tube station to the hotel is not for the faint hearted. The battery cover of the TV remote control was missing, the paint on the radiator piping was peeling off, and the toilet seat wonâ€™t stand up (I am a man and I like it to stand up. I am also being practical here â€“ that will minimise the toilet seat from getting wet unnecessarily). However my biggest issue was the number of times that I was woken up by noise from the neighbouring rooms, either due to people shouting or doors banging. Not sure if it was a particularly rowdy night or the walls and doors were really flimsy. One night was enough.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Ryb2
Reviews.Content: I think your impression of this hotel depends on when you arrive. If you arrive in the day, it looks like an average hotel in a working class neighborhood. If you arrive at night, it looks like a poorly lit hotel in dark scary area of London. It's a bit of a walk to the Barbican Underground Station which will take you to the tourist attractions. At night, it's a dark. It's also hard to get a cab from the hotel. There are very few places to eat nearby. The rooms are old and outdated. The could stand an upgrade. The swimming pool, hot tub and health club were among the best I've ever seen in a hotel. The breakfast was decent and the hotel staff was quite attentive. Overall, it seem like this hotel had a Jekyl and Hide quality. Somethings were very good were very poor.

Reviews.Title: “We'll not be going back”
Reviews.Author: phandcab
Reviews.Content: A really disappointing stay and poor value for money. First room had bed bugs. Staff moved us promptly but did not seem surprised. In the second room the air conditioning unit dripped water on to the carpet. During the day staff used a towel from the bathroom to soak up the water - but didn't replace the towel! Sunday breakfast very busy and understaffed - had to wait for fruit juice to be replenished, tea / coffee to be served.

Reviews.Title: “A compromise worth considering”
Reviews.Author: Rob_Zelf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a number of times over the past few years during business trips. The good: + The price is reasonable for London standards. + The bar is OK. + The location (Islington 10-min walk) is good to go out and eat out. The reasonable: 0 The rooms are OK but could really do with a refurbishment 0 I sometimes got a single room and these are rather small The Bad - It's a 15 minute walk to the Underground - the DIRECT vicinity is drab - Taxis in the morning are a loooong wait

Reviews.Title: “need serious improvements, will not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: marcoslim
Reviews.Content: We reserved two rooms next to each other for the children to be near us. They did not provide and could not change during stay. Staff was not helpful.One of the room was smelling tobacco and the smoke alarm was covered with a nylon. Generally not clean rooms did not change towels and did not replace shampoo etc. The tel in children room was not ringing , complained and nothing happened. Breakfast was fine but you had to wait a long time to be seated.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: warren58
Reviews.Content: was very surprised with this hotel.reading all the reviews didnt know what to expect. if you look for something a bit cheaper and not fussed about luxury this hotel is fine,rooms are clean reception and bar area very nice not to bad location in london. bulding is not so gd from the outside but does it matter what it looks like from the ouside. also as a pool and jacuzzi.not many hotels in london have that. GD HOTEL DONT BE PUT OFF BY BAD REVIEWS!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Way better than the reviews led me to expect”
Reviews.Author: Poots-UK
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel as part of a hen party package (and having quite high standards myself) I was worried when I read the reviews, but our experience of the Thistle City Barbican turned out far better than I had expected. I specifically requested rooms in the main building as the TripAdvisor reviews of the annexe were so bad, so thanks to my fellow reviewers for the tip. First impressions of the hotel were good with a smart reception and friendly staff. We got a really good rate, which made it excellent value for money. We stayed on what I am told is the busiest weekend of the year for hen parties, and the hotel actually had 15 hen groups staying that night! The reception staff were great and handled our check-in effeciently, even though a number of large groups all arrived at once, and they kindly made an effort to get us into our rooms as early as possible. We had a twin room on the 6th floor. It was a little dated and shabby, but spacious and very well equipped. There was a tea tray with biscuits, a good hairdryer, a safe and an iron and ironing board, spare towels and extra pillows in the wardrobe. The only downside was that it was too hot, with no air-con or fan, and a window that would only open part way. However, as we were on a high floor we could leave the windows open while we were out, so it was cooler when we got back later that evening. The beds were quite firm and very comfortable, with clean bedlinen and unusually thick foam pillows, which turned out to be very comfy to sleep on. In the morning we were shocked to find the biggest breakfast queue I have ever seen! The hotel was obviously very full, with many large groups arriving towards the later end of the breakfast period. Although the restaurant is quite big, it is just not sufficient to cater for the number of guests the hotel can take at maximum capacity. Having said that, the staff were lovely, apologising profusely for the wait and keeping the queue moving as quickly as possible. Once in the restaurant there was another long queue for the breakfast buffet, but the kitchen staff coped impressively with the numbers as all the food trays were piled up high as soon as stocks became low. The cooked breakfast was excellent. We didnâ€™t use the spa as I had been told it was fully booked for treatments, but I had a brief look at the facilities. There is a small but well equipped gym, quite a small pool with a Jacuzzi and a sauna and steam room. If the hotel was busy it would soon become overcrowded, but I assume it is nice midweek. To sum up, Iâ€™d say that this hotel is a great option for a City based weekend, particularly if you are familiar with this part of town. Guests should be aware that it does cater for large hen/stag/party groups, but we didnâ€™t come across any excess noise or hassle. I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “over-priced”
Reviews.Author: No_Belgian
Reviews.Content: clearly no value for money : outdated rooms, outdated conference facilities & below-average food; staff tough is doing their best but are beaten by a lack of investment in the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Great centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: dellybellyChesham
Reviews.Content: the only negative comment I would give was the price of food and drink from the bar. single spirit and mixer Â£7.60, cheapest bottle of wine Â£19, quoted Â£7 for a sandwich. So if you don't have a problem with the prices it was fine, our room was great and the breakfast was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “More than a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gseigel
Reviews.Content: I'm a perplexed by the negative comments about this hotel. The staff was courteous and the hotel had extensive amenities including gym/pool/restaurant. The room was spacious and clean, while being located in a relatively quite area within Central London. The underground is only a 5-10 min walk, and there were many dining options nearby. Those who complain about this hotel are the same people who would complain at a $1,000/night hotel. Great value!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a one night stay over. Given wrong directions by reception staff from tube.”
Reviews.Author: BFem
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night. I didn't arrive to fairly late. Old street is probably the closest tube. From here it probably took me a good 15-20 mins walking. Plus the fact that the receptionist gave me the odd right instead of left and vice versa. Thanks to the two white van men drivers for giving a soggy begdraggled me directions. (Don't hold me to this but - as you come up out of the entrance of old street tube you go straight ahead until you get to the co-op, turn right after passing the co-op. Walk walk walk to the end of the street until you get to a busy crossroads, turn left. Walk walk walk until you get to a smaller crossroads and the thistle is on your left down a smaller road. It's a red brick building I think). The room was quite nice, clean and spacious. The food I had in the evening was ok but not fantastic plus I was very hungry. Small bar area. The breakfast was not that nice, croissants so tough I couldn't even take a bite without having to gnaw. I didn't try cooked breakfast. Nor did I try the swimming pool and leisure centre. I found the pillows way too high, luckily there was a cushion on the bed which I put my towel over to sleep on which was a lot better. Most importantly, being a lone female, I felt safe here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Almatt
Reviews.Content: I have to say that when this hotel was booked for me at work and I read the reviews on here that my heart sank and so I arrived for a one night business stay expecting to not like it. I have also had some bad experiences with Thistle hotels in London in the past (see for example a review of a truly awful experience at the Thistle Euston which you'll find included in my reviews on here) so that didn't inspire me with confidence. Actually, The Thistle Barbican wasn't too bad. It's not the best hotel in London but in my view it's a long way from being the worst. There were no signs of flaxing plaster, dirty linen etc as some people have described. The furniture in the rooms is not modern but, as somebody else has pointed out, you'd pay more for that in some places and they'd call it Edwardian!! The room was spacious enough by London standards and there was a flat screen TV, a safe etc. The bed was a bit hard for my liking as were the pillows but I did sleep OK - I think that was largely due to the fact that there was no traffic noise and that is always a bonus for me. My bathroom was clean and the shower was very good. I didn't try the pool complex as I did not have time but I wish I had had the opportunity. I didn't eat dinner in the hotel - a colleague did and she was unimpressed. I went to a local pub with another colleague and we shared a bottle of wine for a total of Â£17.50 - the bar prices in the hotel are astronomical but that is typical of London hotels I am afraid. Breakfast was average to good - a bit of an issue with the toaster and a bit of a wait for coffee but no serious problems. Check in and check out were both fairly efficient and staff were pleasant. One of the two lifts was not working when we arrived but that was fixed pretty quickly. I was told that all rooms are non-smoking - somebody had been smoking in mine for sure (fag ends on window sill!!) - this was true of my colleagues' rooms too - but it wasn't a big deal for me; the windows opened fully. Also the air con was very efficient. This hotel is not bang slap in the touristy centre of London and there is not much to do in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. As I said, we headed for the pub but I wouldn't have done that alone. It took me 10 mins max to walk to Barbican tube station. Would I stay here again? Well, I wouldn't go out of my way to do that but I would not be unwilling to do it .

Reviews.Title: “disgraceful room-who monitors the housekeeping?”
Reviews.Author: yorkshirefoodie30
Reviews.Content: I was booked in with a large group on a business trip for 1 night .I was shown to a room on the second floor which was disgustingly dirty.The window was covered in mould and the sill outside was covered in filth and fag ends.two club type chairs were covered in stains-did not want to look too closely and the duvet cover had a blood stain on it.I asked to be moved and was shown to the 4th floorThis overlooked the main street but overall a grubby hotel with no hospitality tray and pillows so cheap and hard you end up with a headache.

Reviews.Title: “It's a 'no' from me”
Reviews.Author: luvvacurry
Reviews.Content: Bad points for me: *15 minutes walk from Barbican tube station - if I had to do it in the dark, I would not feel safe as a woman on my own *in a run-down area *I had a single room the size of a shoe box overlooking a busy road, with wallpaper hanging off the wall, paint flaking off the skirting boards, matchbox for a bathroom *the pillow was as comfortable as a balloon *a plate of singapore noodles for dinner consisted of a handful of vermicelli with insipid curry powder, four slivers of peppers, boiled egg and cress - cost Â£11.50 *shabby decor, graffiti by the lift, wallpaper ripped Good points (struggling here): *had a new shower curtain! *convenience store and pizza takeaway opposite (can take the food back to the hotel apparently) - lovely man owns both *nice girl who checked me out Think very carefully about whether to stay here. It was very, very disappointing. I feel sorry for the poor tourists.

Reviews.Title: “It worked for me - 2 nights business stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dotttyjred
Reviews.Content: Booked this thru discount website so managed to get a twin room at a really good price. We arrived on a Sunday afternoon so no problem with check-in. No AC in the room but had a ceiling fan. Twin room was very spacious and clean and was also happy with modern and clean bathroom. Ordered food at bar - all a bit chaotic - told would take 30 minutes but arrived in 5 which reflected fast, preprepared greasy rather than tasty. 10 minute walk to tube. 5 minute walk to main road for shops and bars. Had intended to use pool but full of kids on Sunday. I would stay there again but would not be so keen to pay for overpriced room and service just because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive add ons”
Reviews.Author: RedSh0es
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Saturday night when I had a party to attend close by. I booked a single room on a discount website, but this still cost just over Â£80. Add in a Â£25 car park charge and Â£2.50 for a can of coke it was an expensive stay. The room was clean, although I couldn't face getting into the shower/bath as the bathroom was a little grotty (not dirty, just unappealing). The thing that made me laugh was the toilet roll holder was a long stretch from the toilet. In my single room there was a travel hairdryer and ironing facilities. No air con or heating. The bed was comfortable but the pillow was like sleeping on rocks. I would stay again if I could get it for a cheaper price. Use the small store across the road from the hotel for supplies ... can of coke only 60p.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!!!!!! This hotel made my trip to London unenjoyable and stressful!”
Reviews.Author: sarahmacs
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an utter disaster and for me to say that means a lot considering I only stayed here one night. I booked the hotel a few weeks ago on my way to Cambridge. I wanted to have a resting stop from my flight from the States. The people who work there are very nice but in the words of Karl Marx: "The road to hell is paved with good intentions." Here we go: 1) I asked for a wake up call that evening as well as the next morning from two different people for each occasion. Neither happened and it never seemed to phase them 2) The internet which was promised to work in the rooms did not. This was a surprise being that they tout themselves as a business hotel. When I booked the room, I was under the impression there would be internet because they promised it. I had a lot of work to do that night and suffered great stress as a result. To make matters worse, when I reported the problem to the concierge, they told me that they use internet from a company and that I should call the company to see what was up. They didn't seem to think that it was their problem at all. Also, if you want internet, you have to pay a separate fee. 3) The staff are slow and clueless. They can't multi-task, nor can they remember what time you asked them to order you a cab. All of the staff members look like they are 12 years old and just seem apathetic towards guests. And everything takes them five hours to do and figure out. Checking in and checking out seems like a daunting project for them. Stay away!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Have to be better options”
Reviews.Author: Zenman1965
Reviews.Content: Work booked this for me as part of an event at the Emerates stadium. Bottom line is it was Â£180 for a tiny single room, no better than a good travelodge room and a shower fitting that was broken. Check in took ages and the location is a right pain, quite a walk from all nearest tubes. I am sure there are redeeming qualities, but for the price I paid view this as a poor choice, even for London

Reviews.Title: “Not worth chasing the pool”
Reviews.Author: HealwithSteel
Reviews.Content: Disappointing in so many ways, including ash in the soap holder in a non-smoking room, booked for two - towels for one , broken TV remote generally grubby with lack of attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad overall! Don't know what all the fuss is about!”
Reviews.Author: Ncane83
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel as part of a theatre break, which for this the location was ideal. I can't understand a lot of the awful reviews on here; yes the decor is outdated and needs a refurb, however it was clean and comfortable had a half decent pool and gym, not bad breakfast and nice evening bar with service as expected. If you want five star facility, modern amenities and 5 star service then book a 5 star hotel. Very acceptable overall and truly not as bad as many make out on here!

Reviews.Title: “Room and Hotel Facilities are not very good, some even bad.”
Reviews.Author: Moreno132
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Thistle City Barbican for 1 night for business. the hotel reservation was not done by me but by my colugue we stayed at a time when Wimbledon Tennis match took place so most hotels in London were fully booked and there was not much choices. Check in was good, reception and lobby area gives a feeling of good hotel, service was good. However, when we arrived to our room, it was all completely different. Single Room size is small but it was ok. My room was old, no A/C, safe didnâ€™t work but they sent someone to come and fix it. Shower was ok and clean. but what bothered me the worst was the internet service. You have to pay extra for it but also, it did not work, I needed it badly since I needed to work. I ask someone from the staff to come to my room and see why I canâ€™t use the internet but their answer was that there is a problem with the service provider and if I wish I can go to a McDonalds 5 minutes from there for internet (at least the staff was trying to find alternative solution which was nice of them). Breakfast was standard and good. No complains about that.

Reviews.Title: “Lame”
Reviews.Author: Chop26
Reviews.Content: I think this was pound for pound the worst hotel I have stayed in. Overpriced, dated rooms with tiny single beds, no mini bar and the worst tea tray that Â£220+vat can buy. Oh and that doesn't even get you free wireless or a flannel. Lame.

Reviews.Title: “Did I stay at a different hotel?...”
Reviews.Author: AmyandChris
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel for a business trip and was far from looking forward to it.... However upon arrival although the air con was broken in the lobby/bar first impressions were ok. Then to the room... it was fine the carpet was a bit shabby around the edges but apart from that I couldnt fault it. There was a fan and a air con which was good as it was very hot over the days I stayed. The room was clean and the bathroom was fine almost re-done in the past year? I wasnt expecting the Ritz but I do have standards when it comes to how clean the room is - I may have just been very lucky or some people are very fussy!!! NOTE stayed in room 1208. colleagues stayed in 1357 and 1311 and they were find too. All double rooms.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't look out of the window, this hotel is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: winter-st*r
Reviews.Content: I booked a twin room for one night for a friend and I as we were going to the theatre in London. We spent most of the day in Islington and the hotel was an easy walk from there. We checked in no problem, the room was nicely decorated, lovely and clean - very comfortable. As we booked under a 'top secret' deal we did not choose the location - this was the hotel's downfall really. It's in a bit of a 'dodgy' area - somewhere I would not feel comfortable walking around on my own in the dark! The view from our window was a roof and a load of barbed wire. We did not have breakfast as this was extra. All in all, comfortable night's sleep, but I would not want to stay longer than one night. it served it's purpose, but that was all.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to fault”
Reviews.Author: nickdel
Reviews.Content: As a regular business traveller to London I normally stay in hotels that are in close proximity to my office in the Tower Bridge area of the city, however due to Wimbledon, the Thistle Barbican was all I could book at short notice. Located in an area of London I was unfamiliar with, I decided to do a bit of research, as you are doing right now. Having read the reviews on this site I was left feeling very apprehensive and worried about my stay at the Thistle Barbican. However, after spending 5 days there I am really struggling to see why there are so many negative comments on here. When I first arrive I was given a very warming welcome from the staff at the front desk. The dÃ©cor of the main reception area is modern and very well maintained. So far so good... check in process was quick and easy and I was in my room within 5 minutes of arriving. The room was a spacious & clean and came with a large LCD television & working (quiet) aircon. Yes some of the furniture is a little outdated but I find this to be fairly common in London. In Mayfair, they call this Edwardian and charge you Â£400 a night for the privileged! I admit the staff in the bar and restaurant were a little dithery but I found them very pleasant and attentive. Albeit not directly affected, I was witness to the language barrier that some people have mentioned, but it didn't seem to bother anyone too much. On the other hand the restaurant manageress did a fantastic job explaining the menu to a Chinese couple who didn't speak much English, so it works both ways! All in all, a nice enough hotel to stay in and if it wasn't so far from my office then I would certainly consider it for my next trip. I will definitely keep it in mind however for when bigger events are happening in London and other hotels raise their prices because the Thistle Barbican did not appear to do this for Wimbledon.

Reviews.Title: “Eat in the chicken diner next door!”
Reviews.Author: Charlene01
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Thistle City Barbican we found that the outside of the hotel looked very shabby but we we're relieved as we got closer to the entrance and realised that the main front of the hotel looked alot nicer. We arrived early so were not able to check in, but left our bags with the pleasant concierge so that we could relax in the hotel spa and attend our pre booked treatment appointments. When entering the spa reception we were informed that there were not enough padlocks for thier lockers, as they only had one padlock left we would have to share a locker - Therefore 9 of us had to squeeze our handbags into one locker. The changing rooms, pool and spa area were all clean. When we asked for extra clean towels there was no fuss. We were dissapointed when the final person in our group awaiting a spa treatment had been forgotten about, meaning that we had to wait for a further hour after our appointment time as the treatment team had already started other apponitments. We were not kept informed and I persume that this was all a result of a lack of communication within thier team. We then checked in at around 3.30pm with no fuss. We had booked 4 bedrooms and they were all allocated very close to each other. The rooms are clean, however very tired and worn. There was no air conditioning, just a fan. The beds are very small with extra hard pillows, not the most comfortable beds to sleep in. As there was a large group of us, we had emailed the hotel prior to our arrival with a pre order for the restaurant, this is where the problems began... We sat down to be told that all 9 of us would have to eat the same, tomato soup starter, chicken main and torte for dessert. We advised who I persumed was the restaurant supervisor that we had pre ordered our menu. The gentleman said that the hotel had not recieved the pre order and chef had already prepared the food. Therefore we asked to speak to the duty manager to took at least 10 minutes to show his face. He asked us to provide proof that we had emailed the order, which we said we would get, he then said that he would go and speak to the chef to see what they could do. WE NEVER SAW THIS MANAGER AGAIN! After another 15 minutes had passed, we noticed that the table next to us were complaining, as there was also a large group of them, we thought we would ask what was wrong. They had also been told that they all had to have the same food with no choice, however after complaining they had been told that they could order whatever they wished from the room serive menu. At this point we still hadnt had anyone come back to us with an answer or compromise. So again we went and spoke to the restuarant supervisor, at this point a very pleasant gentleman who introduced himself as the front office manager couldnt help but over hear our complaint so offered to help us. 45 minutes after we sat down for dinner we were told that we would all have to have soup and that they would also provide a vegeterian option for main course. As it was now nearly 9.30pm we just agreed. We do not understand how a hotel of such capacity could not offer a table of 9 more than a one choice menu. The restaurant was dead. No manager was willing to help us and our pre order was just ignored, even after provding email evidence. If we were 9 people who had just come down to the restaurant for dinner, i'm pretty sure that they wouldnt have dictated to us what we had to eat!!! For all of this inconvienice we were given a glass of wine each. The soup was straight out of a tin and had probably been microwaved, the chicken came with 2 new potatoes and was served cold. The vegetarian choice was spaghetti with tinned tomatoes. After a dissapointing starter and main we were all looking foward to dessert. The restaurant staff bought out everyone a slice of bakewell tart, the tart was straight out of a packet and served with what was meant to be buttercream, but lacked any sugar, so was just butter! Bakewell tart had never been mentioned as a dessert choice so we were all dissapointed, When we asked if there was an alternative, e.g sticky toffee pudding (which was on the main restaurant menu), we were told that there was not enough portions left, then after 10 minutes some sticky toffee pudding appeared for 3 people. Generally the hotel managment need some training on how to deal with complaints. They will be recieving our feedback and we are very much looking foward to seeing what they have to say, i'd also be interested to know what happened to the duty manager that was asked to deal with our complain who we never saw again! I'd strongly reccomend the chicken diner across the road for dinner, cheap, quick service and very pleasant staff, mayber the Thistle could learn something from the chicken Diner! I will not be staying at a Thistle hotel again, they have no interest in thier guests satisfaction, only the money that they're spending!

Reviews.Title: “Theatre break weekend”
Reviews.Author: Russ26
Reviews.Content: Just got home from the Thistle City Barbican. Don't know what all the fuss was about. We arrived early but knew that we wouldn't be able to check in until later, so we left our cases and made our way into Theatreland. Friendly staff when we arrived back at the hotel. Clean rooms, comfy bed and great breakfast. What more do you want?

Reviews.Title: “Shocking to say the least”
Reviews.Author: ki&mandy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent business trip. Had previously stayed in the Hotel Russell and enjoyed my trip to the big smoke. Not this place. The actual rooms are just shabby and tired, but they pretty clean. However, the bar, restaurant, dinner and breakfast is SHOCKING! First of all, I ordered a burger for Â£14.50 from the menu. When it came, it was a dry supermarket bun with a very poor reformed frozen burger in. I was handed a sachet of sauce! When I tried to explain to the waiter I would like some desert, he asked if I wanted it before my burger. It took about 10 mins to be served (at the bar) even though there was no cue. Mainly this was due to the entire staff not been able to understand you as they don't speak english. When I saw the bill my burger was Â£16.50!! This was due to a service charge of 20% being added. I pointed out that nowhere on the menu does it state this, and then they refunded me. Dodgy! Breakfast was simply a farce! When you have over 1000 rooms you would expect more than a choice of toast, fried breakfast, some cheap looking cornflakes and some dry fruit! That was basically it! 100s of people trying to find some edible. If you have to stay here, it will do but for Â£150 pn, it's really bad!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: COMuggles
Reviews.Content: The room was small, clean but the mattress was awful. No mattress pad, so every lump and bump was felt. The last night I slept on the 3 pillows provided so I could sleep. In the "guide" book it said that robes were available for use. The front desk sent me on a wild goose chase and I finally gave up. I had one breakfast there which I paid for ahead of time-not impressed with that either.

Reviews.Title: “One big disappointment.”
Reviews.Author: blackholes
Reviews.Content: Going to this hotel, I've realized how poorly they can get. The first day we got there, the refrigerator wasn't working, the toilet barely flushes, and there was scorching hot water. The carpet was uneven and you could feel the the bumps because it was poorly carpeted. We called the front desk because our phone wasn't working, but they never came and on top of that, every day for 5 days we asked for a wake up call and we got it twice out of 5 days. I felt uneasy going into the hotel because it felt unwelcoming from the outside and the floors gave me chills. I heard a myriad of noises and on the 6th flood there is a room with a mattress and a broken fan and two places with flickering lights. The ATM machine did not work, the second fire exit we wanted to go down instead of taking the elevator was shady and did not look promising. There is no off limits sign, which there should be where it is necessary. The food was okay, sometimes you have to wait a while for a person to bring you to the table. Overall, I really wished I could go home from that trip.

Reviews.Title: “in need of a good clean in some areas”
Reviews.Author: ksully63
Reviews.Content: we arrived early which was not a problem with are room not being ready, we entertained ourself had a coffee and was told the rooms would be ready in twenty minutes, two hours later we were still not in our rooms and we were eating out and had theatre tickets for that night, bad management in this hotel as no-one knows who is in direct charge when we complained, told we could have complementry drinks, when we went for them they were retracked and we never recieved them, the swimming pool and steam area were in need of a good clean and looked like it hadnt been done in a while, the only good thing was the staff who served tea/coffee at breakfast most helpful and couldnt do enough for us.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly awful almost ruined our holiday”
Reviews.Author: KerryBerry25
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 12.30pm, the staff were polite and explained to us that that we could not be booked in untill 2pm which we were fully aware of. We socialised in the reception and enjoyed the company of other guests who were waiting to book in too. 2pm arrived and we went over to reception to book into our rooms to be told that the rooms still weren't ready and would be another 20mins. We all accepted this and sat back down waiting 20mins past and still none of our five rooms were ready, yet other guest were being booked straight into there rooms. We went back over to reception to be told AGAIN ANOTHER 20MINS! This time the staff weren't as polite but we took this as them being 'stressed' as lots of rooms weren't ready. At 2.55pm the staff came and told us that 2 rooms were now ready and reassured us that the remainder 3 rooms will in another 20mins. As we were now getting slightly annoyed as the time was 3.30 and we were still not in our rooms and we were going to the West End to see Mama Mia and having Lunch we were meant to leave the hotel at 5pm. This was impossible as the remainder of the rooms were not ready until gone 4pm. When myself and my friend arrived in our room we discover that the shower was broken, the safe wasn't working and the iron ruined our clothes as it leaked everywhere. We went downstair to complain as this was highly unacceptable and was assured by the staff that the problems would be fixed and that we could have complementry drinks as way of appoligies. We accepted this but told staff it would be later on as we were already late for the West End Theatre show, they said that was fine. We came back after our show to order drinks which we were told the bar staff would know about and they where all unaware. Two other guests that were staying in the hotel heard about the trouble we were having with the lack of comunication between staff that they bought us all several bottles of champayne, by this time it was too late to have our complementry drinks as we had all been traveling since 7.30am that morning. The following night we went down to the bar area to be told that we could ONLY have soft drinks. This was not agreed by both ourselves and the staff who now where being ignorant and arguing with us saying they said soft drinks only. I asked staff to watch the CCTV of the evening when we were offered the drinks as nobody mentioned soft drinks. The member of staff who was in charge was ignortant to us and couldn't understand why we were so unstatisfied about the service we recieved. NEVER EVER again would I go there to stay because of this experience and never recomend it either.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the reviews we read!”
Reviews.Author: shehangsbrightly
Reviews.Content: I really don't know why people whined about this hotel. The room was small and the furnishings were older and nothing fancy, but who cares? We stayed here for a week and enjoyed our stay. I think maybe people's expectations were way too high. The neighborhood is not a bustling tourist area, but a quiet residential blue collar location. Be prepared for deserted streets at night. I did not feel unsafe at any point, but then again, this sort of thing doesn't bother me much the way it might bother others. We booked this hotel as a package deal through BookIt. Some highlights: Excellent breakfast buffet included with the room Helpful, friendly staff Good location within walking distance to the Underground (less than 1 mile) Hot shower, good water pressure Ceiling fan in the room (I love ceiling fans!) We would stay here again if the price were right.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, decent location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Jamsimsafc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for work and got a very good deal for London through the Thistle website. The Hotel was very good, room was excellent and the facilities I used including the Bar and Restaurant for breakfast were very good. Breakfast was fantastic value as it was included in the room but It was very expensive to buy separate. The location is good for the business area of London but its a 15 min walk to Angel tube and then a 15 min tube into central London if you are sight seeing. I'd say if its cheaper than others get it, if not there are probably others closer to central London which will be the same standard for the same price

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as I feared from reading reviews on this site”
Reviews.Author: fairy86
Reviews.Content: Overall, not as bad as I feared from reading reviews on this site. I found the hotel adequate- no more, no less. Took over half an hour to be checked in by a trainee as they'd accidentally booked my colleague in under my name. At one point they wanted to put us in a double room together!! Room in the main building was ok- Walls are thin as mentioned in other posts, but it was clean and tidy. I would stay again, but I would make sure I got a room in the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful! Never ever again.”
Reviews.Author: tsmac2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on business and found the whole experience just awful - there was not one redeeming factor. Check in took forever and there was not enough staff on the desk to help speed up the process. After checking in, I was given directions to my room which involved going back out of the main entrance of the hotel and across the road into an adjacent building. Upon entering this building, I did not feel safe. Anyone could come in, there was no reception area, staff or security. I found my room and felt dismay. The building has obviously been converted into rooms.......unsuccessfully. The room was tiny and shabby. The room was in a general poor state of maintenance but particular points to note were the ceiling, windows and door. The door did not seem to lock correctly. I tried this from the inside and outside and felt it could be opened without a great deal of force. I informed reception who said it was fine - they would not send anyone up, saying they were very busy. The ceiling was dirty and looked like an old office ceiling. The windows were rickety, would not shut correctly so I could hear everything from the street outside - didn't bode well for a good night's sleep. I ordered room service - evening meal and breakfast. Both were very disappointing. My evening meal was cold and the meat was of poor quality. Breakfast was better but it's not hard to get toast and cereal wrong :) I would never ever stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was expecting the worse...”
Reviews.Author: xBambinax
Reviews.Content: After reading several of the reviews for this hotel and being a very picky hotel customer myself, I was very dubious about going to this hotel, I advised all my friends who were travelling with me to expect the worst! I am so glad I expected the worst, because it was a lovely suprise to arrive at the hotel, (okay the area isn't Chelsea) and step into a bright smart lobby. I was expecting a very long queue after the reviews on here- we did arrive an hour after check-in time. However there was no queue, service is a bit slow when checking in however there was a lovely receptionist called Stephen who was really friendly. My group were booked into 3-bed rooms and twin rooms. I was booked into an executive room which was really nice-the view wasn't too great, but it didn't spoil the room. We did have one problem-a couple in our group went into their bedroom to find it was already occupied-luckily the occupants weren't in and luckily for the occupants of the room my group aren't the type to steal anything! After a complaint to reception my friends were upgraded to an executive. A tip- make sure you use the safes provided in the rooms, in case this happens to you! I had read reviews on here about this problem happening a lot. Overall the hotel was smart and clean. The restaurant was overly priced, aprrox Â£10-15 for a burger type meal, so we ate elsewhere. We used the spa/pool facilities in the morning with no trouble, it opens very early which is good, although it is quite small for a hotel of this size. We had breakfast fine too, the hotel staff at breakfast were very friendly and bring tea and coffee to your table. Breakfast comprises of your usual toast/croissants and cooked breakfast and cereals etc. Do not use the people carrier style taxi's outside the hotel reception as they are extortionate and the drivers were very rude to us! Black cabs are half the price and friendlier!!! I can understand how a lot of these reviews may have been based on bad experiences because travelling as a group we weren't expecting a nice quiet break, however if you travel as a couple you may not have such a great experience as there were a lot of group parties staying at the hotel and so noise could be a problem. Aside from this, I feel the hotel has been unjustly rated. Just note- this is not a hotel ideal for a couple's retreat!!

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel in London”
Reviews.Author: Bodhan
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in this hotel and there is no way I would stay there again. It cost 278 pounds for bed and breakfast (late booking). The bar only had one beer on tap, the staff at reception were all trainees so none of them knew what they were doing. In the tiny room the wall was made like a prefab so the walls shook and I could hear everything in every other room. No free wi-fi, even the gym and spa had to be paid for. The shower had two settings, roasting or boiling, it's impossible to take a shower. Breakfast was a buffett affair, one staff member brought re-heated coffee and everything tasted the same. The whole place was some kind of joke, and expensive joke mind you. For the love of God stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “ticked all the right boxes for us”
Reviews.Author: babsybabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and didn't find anything wrong, our room was spotless service was good and the breakfast was magic.Checking in was a bit slow but didn't put us off and we would certainly stay here again if we went back to London.

Reviews.Title: “So awful its difficult to express in words”
Reviews.Author: McNamaraManchester
Reviews.Content: totally agree with other travellers on the tired decor which could be forgiven but what really annoyed me was the lack of care by the staff who dont seem to care about customers. No hairdryer in room and noone answered the reception phone despite 20 calls. Rooms dirty...especially the bathrooms with dirty taps and toilets. I called the hotel several times before i stayed and was hung up on and witnessed the phone ringing whilst checking in and reception staff (including the manager!!) lifting the phone off the hook and laying it on the counter !......would never ever stay here again

Reviews.Title: “so bad i had to add to the feedback...”
Reviews.Author: Geordie28
Reviews.Content: booked in here prior to a conference at the barbican- please check as it's a long walk from the barbican!! nice communal area allayed any fears, however that was where the fun ended. A trainee checked me in (and when you read of horrendous queues checking in, i can see why- there was no one else checking in and it still took him 10 mins) every other time i went to the front desk it was 8-10 deep awaiting check in allocated a room and was slightly apprehensive as it had a do not disturb sign as i swiped in.... thankfully the occupant had left, however no-one had made the room! complaint to the desk eventually answered, however i didnt fancy waiting whilst they cleaned the room for me! rest of the stay was equally poor- no-one answered room service on two occasions, when i got through i was told it was Â£5 charge for a drink to be brought up no free wifi in the hotel at all Dinner was nice (buffet though so limited choice) decor of both rooms was shabby, old and the carpets seriously threadbare- really poor example of a thistle

Reviews.Title: “4 star - you must be joking”
Reviews.Author: cjb222
Reviews.Content: the hotel was charging Â£145 for this single room (walk in rates)- this has possibly got to be the worst example of a 4 star hotel room I have experienced in my life. Badly maintained. Appauling standards. Extremely slow front desk. Understaffed and inefficient. please see the attached pictures

Reviews.Title: “Check in early.”
Reviews.Author: jinnylongsibs
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel on numerous occasions and always found th check in desk very slow - never enough staff at peak periods. On the up side the leasure facilities are as described. All rooms vary so dont take the first one.

Reviews.Title: “Did it's job and enjoyed by all”
Reviews.Author: romina2705
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the bank holiday weekend for a hen weekend with 12 girls. After reading various reviews the problems seemed to be from people who have stayed on the 6th floor and extra building. I called the hotel direct and ensured that the entire party was all in the Main building and all on the same floor, which they were more than happy to do. We all stayed on the 2nd floor. It was clean tidy and all rooms were spacious had air con along with nice clean bathrooms. We used the leisure facilities in the morning quite early and had breakfast early. The breakfast was a good variety all sorts of fruits yogurt toast cereal and cooked breakfast. The waiting staff were friendly and very attentive with providing drinks and clearing away your dirty plates. The only tips for anyone staying her would be- get to breakfast early (before 0830) to save waiting in the que, it gets very busy. When traveling in to the city centre take a cab, it saves you the 10/15 minutes walk to and from the tube station. Then when using cabs avoid the cabs outside reception (they're expensive) and head left out of reception and around the corner, the black cabs are cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - amazing location - would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: curly_karensa
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. Spacious clean rooms, bit dated but not seriously and quick check in process. Short walk from the angel tube station and islington high street - perfect location for tube links to the centre. Islington is gorgeous too - would recommend eating here if you don't fancy venturing into the centre, really village feel within a city. Breakfast was included which was a surprise as we booked room only - really nice but try and go early as there were queues when we left. It was nice to have a pool as there were baking temperatures when we visited - however it is a bit dated and we had quite a lot of trouble getting the jacuzzi to work! Great value - we'd definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and tatty”
Reviews.Author: Fourwelshtravellers
Reviews.Content: I didn't chose this hotel. It happened to be a designated hotel for a conference I was attending. Luckily it had a reduced rate because the Â£199 per night it was charging for a single room was very poor value for money. The single room-the business traveller's nemesis-was cupboard-sized. The room and furniture were clean, but the finish was very cheap, and the wallpaper was torn at the edges and had that layer of dirt all wallpaper accumulates when its been on a wall for years. The window featured a view of the rooms immediately opposite (5 feet away), over a concrete roof featuring cigarette ends and pigeon droppings. Nice! The staff were very courteous throughout, and I have to say that a faulty light in my room was repaired without me even having to report it. I have to say the maintenance man arrived at 5.30 pm and looked exhausted, which brings me onto another subject-Thistle has clearly saved money by compromising on staff numbers and the queues at the check-in desk were huge, because this was Easter week. Food at the hotel-breakfast was actually pretty good. Dinner-don't. Surroundings pleasant but gross overpricing for average food. Try Fish Central round the corner. Much better food and a lot cheaper! I am still in this hotel but will be glad to check out tomorrow. Charging high rates for a room can only be justified if there are pleasant staffing and adequate staff who don't look constantly rushed off their feet. The restaurant charges were not justified by the quality of the food.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay here again if you paid me!”
Reviews.Author: Hatchback
Reviews.Content: The room decor looks like something from the late 70's/ Early 80's and the bathrooms look like they have never been cleaned. As one of my friends said '' It looks like Laura Ashley has gone into the room and vomited''. The hotels reputation may be better if they had good customer service but unfortunatly 99% of staff struggle with the english language. Please Do not stay here, there are hotels that are 100% nicer and alot cheaper!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PB1Oxford
Reviews.Content: For the 1st time ever I let a friend book a hotel for us & this was it!!! Never again will I make the same mistake. This place is horrible. It is dirty. It is in a rubbish location. I really cant say anything nice about it. The lobby isnt hideous its just the rest of the place. The check in & out was sooooo slow, so many people had to wait ages.... Stay in a Premier Inn for the same price, at least they are clean!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Last minute deal”
Reviews.Author: artmac21
Reviews.Content: Got a good price for double room Â£80. Went for this as had pool. Pool was too deep for my daughter 135m deep but excellent otherwise. Good facilitoes. Used more by business traveller. Room as expected for hotel chain - staff all very good. Location was a bit out of way 10 min walk from tube. So good value for longer saty in London at the deal price but for 1 night should have stayed somewhere more central. All in all good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MDtravelinglady
Reviews.Content: I was in London for exactly 7 days and stayed at the Thistle City Barbican Hotel. When I arrived at the hotel you check in on the nice side but I didn't get to stay on that side. I was sent across the driveway to the (dark and cheap side) other building. When you enter the lobby of the 2nd building it's just basically an empty lobby with dirty floors. The size of the rooms are VERY small, but I was by myself so I can live with that fact. This hotel has a LOT of kids (teenagers) staying in it at any given time. Upon closer examination of the room, there was hair on the bathroom floor and on the bed. I tried calling the front desk but no one answered the phone. So I walked down to the front desk to request that room be recleaned and no one showed up that day. I went down to the front desk again in the morning explaining about the hair and requested that the room be cleaned properly and left for the day. When I got back to my room that evening the trash had been emptied and my bed made but the offending hair in the bathroom floor was still there. I tried calling the front desk again and got no answer. This is a common practice for them as I tried calling the front desk more than once to get a wake up call and no one answers the phone. So again I have to walk back downstairs to head to the front desk to ask that my room be cleaned. When I went back to my room to change clothes and head out again my foot went under the bed and touched something...GROSS! I get on my hands and knees to see what it was and it was a chunk of food just hanging out! Mind you the bed only sits maybe 1 - 2 inches off the floor so there is no way for the vaccume to reach underneith. This was more proof that I needed to know that the rooms were NOT being cleaned. It's just nasty! I got tired of asking them to clean my room and just kept my sock and shoes on after that. I don't know if it's standard practice in the UK for hotels to NOT have washclothes but the Thistle City Barbican has none. So if you stay here be prepared to bring your own washclothes and soap because the soap they provide smells like dirty feet! The only bonus about this hotel is it's a 10 minute walk to the underground!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, really!”
Reviews.Author: MartinMontreal
Reviews.Content: I want to reassure people that my stay was good. I only had problem to get the front desk to asnwer my call when I requested a wake up call. The water pressure is quite faint also, but I have seen much worst. Very clean and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MistiLondon
Reviews.Content: On arrival they couldn't find the booking - that was because we were part of a group booking and it had been printed out and therefore removed from their system! Genius! Having battle the crowds of american teenage tourists to get into the lifts I finally got to my room. Apparently I had been upgraded - not sure from what - but it was an ok room - average cleanliness i.e. it looked tired and exhausted so was hard to tell if it was age or dirt, but no overt signs of dirt. However it was the bed that was unbelievable. It was SO hard that I was unable to sleep at all. My other colleagues also complained about filthy bathrooms, noise and dubious pillows. We were booked in for a 4 night stay but we all wanted to leave immediately - it was telling that independently all of us had packed our bags after the first night! We were booked through a corporate booking agent who persuaded us to allow the hotel to attempt to make amends and stay one more night. We gave them the benefit of the doubt but it was irretrievable (unless I got a new mattress I don't know what they thought they could do to improve it!) a third of the party stayed but the rest got transferred to another Thistle hotel - which was much more acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Ladies show trip”
Reviews.Author: jazzjean
Reviews.Content: Hotel in quiet area, a good 20minutes walk from tube station if you are carrying luggage. We left our luggage as were to early to check in, and when we returned had to wait 1/2 hour as they had lost it. We had requested rooms together and even though we arrived at 3pm one room was not ready so 2 of us were given a room on the 5th floor in the annexe. We should have waited, as the room was like a sauna, no air con = no sleep. Went for a swim at 8am in mornings to cool down! Spa and pool were good, and towels, shampoo etc are provided. Concierge was courteous and efficient and arranged quite cheap taxis for us to go to our destinations. The breakfast was excellent, although we had to wait for coffee/tea as it was brought around by a waiter instead of being put onto the tables in coffee/tea pots. Beware of extra sur charges, eg: 10% on drinks if the waiter brings to the table instead of going to the bar yourself! Cheapish hotel, 3 star rating, could do with an upgrade, staff very nice and helpful, would we go there again - probably not. The best resturant near the hotel was a Greek one, superb food.

Reviews.Title: “paper thin walls, dodgy area”
Reviews.Author: W0rktrip
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the annexe for 5 nights, the walls are paper thin, was woken by snoring, alarm clocks, shower, phone calls and televisions in neighbouring rooms. Also the 15min walk from Old Street Station does not feel safe after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: rhiload
Reviews.Content: Hotel was ok clean and breakfast ok.We went with red seven leisure hen party -you need taxis everywhere!!! Dont get put in the annex its rubbish but we got put in hotel on 6th floor-one point though My key opened my next door room fortunately they were my friends!!! the brekkie was ok not a massive variety but it was good enough.Go to the local brittania down the road it was like the queen Vic -really friendly people.The hotel bar was expensive but we are in London and its a Hotel Bar!!!Swimming pool was nice and the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly adequate for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Fifer
Reviews.Content: Decent enough hotel. A bit expensive in the bar but to be expected. Breakfast was good and plenty of it too. Would use hotel again but would want a room that was a bit bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: JessieDaydream
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say i would rather sleep in my garden in the pouring rain than stop another night in this hotel! Everything was wrong about it! We have stayed in a thistle hotel before in london and it was fantastic so booked into this one expecting the same standard. The room we were staying in was in the other building. Right next the stairs and lift. The walls were cardboard thin, the two carpets on the floor stapled together and turning up. Wallpaper was running off the wall, there was chunks out of the furniture and beds as well as staining. Our view outside the window was right into someone 25 other peoples rooms. The tv mounting on the wall was terrible. We had to swing it to the door to get to the dressing table and swing it back again to watch or get out the door. For a hotel chain with a good reputation this hotel should just be knocked down and put some place else. Perhaps they could put another lot of tower flats. Thats all that was around you anyway. Took forever to get into the centre and you never felt safe if you were walking back in the dark or even to the shop accross the road. Im glad we booked into a new hotel because spending another night there would be torture.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and depressing”
Reviews.Author: rhyd78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on business in March 2011. A very average stay, main points are: - unresponsive staff at reception but pretty good / friendly in the bar area - tiny room with an even smaller bathroom but relatively clean and comfortable. No frills. - ominous, 1960's style building in the middle of what looks to be a pretty rough area although did not spend any real time exploring it. - the hotel is around 10-15 minute walk from any decent bars/restaurants - the radiator in the aforementioned tiny room swung (noisily) into action at around 5:30am making it unbearably hot pretty quickly A few others I spoke to seemed to have nice rooms which suggested to us they were renovating the rooms floor-by-floor starting at the bottom (I was near the top) but my honest opinion is that there are plenty of decent hotels in London at a cheaper cost than this one. I would therefore suggest staying in one of those places and avoiding the Thistle Barbican.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money if your in the right room.”
Reviews.Author: Lovelylady002
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and could find no faults at all. Reception was fast and couldnt be more polite and helpful. The room was spotlessly clean, bathroom the same, probaly the quietest hotel room I,ve ever stayed in, a good nights sleep. The only thing I found that even with the radiator off the room was very warm - even though it was March - but with the window open and the fan on we overcome this. Breakfast was good with more than enough to eat if required. Didnt use the spa facilities through lack of time so cannot comment on these. If I could stay in the same room I would definately return to this hotel, certainly good value for money in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty Hot rooms, no a/c, long queues for reception”
Reviews.Author: ianjmorley
Reviews.Content: If this is a 4 star hotel I very much recommend those people who determine the star rating need to make an urgent visit. Just two receptionists in a 400+ room hotel at the busiest time of day - you guessed it - 15 people in the queue in front of me = 20 mins to check in. I was given a room in the block over the way that turned out to be a shoebox facing onto the road junction. It was red hot in the room as the radiator was on full blast. Went to open window to find the windows filthy; so too were the net curtains - indeed they had blood splats on them. Disgusting. It took me 30 seconds to find this so why didnt housekeeping? Back to reception - just 12 people in the queue this time so only 15 mins to wait. Explained problem and was given a twin room on the top floor of the main building. The room was much bigger although it too was very hot, despite the radiators being cold. You could hardly open the windows, there was no a/c and the faulty fan in there did little to move the air. How can hotels in London be classed as 4 star unless they have a/c? The single bed was something i'd expect to find in Mrs Smiths B&B in Bognor, not a four star in London. Cheap, uncomfortable with the hardest pillow Ive had in a while. The wallpaper was peeling off the walls, the tv picture was fuzzy. Thankfully the shower worked ok although with two separate taps instead of a proper mixer it wasnt easy to get an ambient temperature. Big queues at breakfast with no queue management - have to admit the breakfast chice was fairly good although they have way too many tables squeezed into the restaurant. 20 people queuing to check out so asked for an envelope for speedy check-out. There was a box on the wall with a big sign saying "pop your speedy check-out envelope in herre if you need to check out quickly". Receptionist told me there weren't any envelopes so speedy check out wasnt an option. All in all a very disappointing experience and for a 4 star hotel a total let down.

Reviews.Title: “Last Minute Mystery Hotel? Never again”
Reviews.Author: JEPHanley
Reviews.Content: In order to avoid lible charges all I can say is that the best thing about this "Lastminute Mystery Hotel" was the barmaid as it's a mystery to me as to how Lastminute has the gaul to pitch this as a fab venue. Stay away via Lastminute unless you want a shoebox room and surly reservations staff.

Reviews.Title: “Â£25 for parking!”
Reviews.Author: CrazyChickWales
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel to be in quiet a rough area, I would not feel safe walking outside, gangs of kid's kicking about across the road, did'nt want to leave my car on the metered road side as felt it would not be safe so asked the hotel if I could park in one of it's 10 spaces out the front of the hotel, seems like the hotel take advantage of the rough area saying dont park on the road it will be safer here and then charge you Â£25 for the privillage, surely if there is a space they should offer this complementry cosidering how much it costs to stay the night. Check in was quick, bit of a mission finding the room. if your in 1314 for instance it is on the 3rd floor not the first. When we got in the room it was an ok size comp tea and coffee, safe, fridge, nice bathroom but there was a white stain on the bedthrow very obvious what it was, made me feel sick. Asked for a late check out but it didnt stop housekeeping knocking on the door, 3 times to wake us up! not impressed! Bar prices very expensive. Concierge effecient in getting us a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Don't have Standard Room”
Reviews.Author: chriscar0l
Reviews.Content: Weekend Break, staff were excellent, friendly and helpfull. Food was quite good with a good spread for breakfast if you don't leave it too late. Initially we had a standard room, this was dirty and in a very poor state of decor, too small with hardly any floor space, we didn't even unpack and paid for an upgrade to a delux room. this had much more room and was definately cleaner but still not as clean and tidy as all the premier Inn's I have stayed in. The location is not that practical wilth the nearest tube 15 minutes walk away. Would not stay again which is a shame as the staff are so good.

Reviews.Title: “much better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: pippalucy
Reviews.Content: After reading very mixed reviews on trip advisor I had no idea what to expect but I was pleasantly suprised. We were able to park right outside the door (luck - there are only a few spaces) which cost about the same as the local ncp carparks. The staff on the desk were very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious, clean, quiet and comfortable with 2 large windows. There were a few tatty bits in the decor but nothing terrible. All in all very good for the price (we paid Â£76 for a twin on a spring break special) in central London.
