Reviews.Title: “Pot Luck - Terrible to Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: BertieDastard
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times in the last 3 months, not through choice but through the selection of my company: Trip 1: Arrived at Old Street tube with my colleagues and had a 15min walk with luggage to the hotel. It's not in the best of areas but I didn't feel uncomfortable on the walk, was just very conscious of walking around dimly lit streets with a trolley bag and a laptop over my shoulder. After trouble checking in (my company specified that everything would be invoiced but the hotel wanted a credit card, unsure if this is the hotels fault or the booking company), i was assigned a twin room in the main building on the 4th floor. I battled with the key-card, opened the door, heard the noise of the wind coming through the gaps in the wooden window frames, closed the door and went to request a different room. The staff were un-surprised and unapologetic, I was then given a single room with an internally facing window. The room was dated but clean. Trip 2: Although I voiced my disapproval after my first visit, the company booked me back in the hotel again. This time my colleague and I had a single room each in the annex building, the corridors looked recently refurnished, the rooms were not. The single room was TINY, its clear that the reason they were single was because you couldnt physically fit a double bed in there (no exageration), there was a single bed, a bedside table and that filled the width of the room, the TV, although nice to have a flatscreen, was on a hinge so you could fold it out when watching it and fold it back to walk past. The room had an inward facing window again and paper thin walls. I called my colleague through the wall in the morning to make sure he was up and it actually woke him. Trip 3: This time i arrived with only negative expectations after previous visits. I am pleased to say that the girl on reception remembered me from my last visit, im usually sceptical when hotel staff welcome me back as they can usually see ive visited before from the computer but she said welcome back before I gave her my name on checkin. I was given a twin room with 2 single, this was in the main building and the room was a very good size, again with an inward facing window but with a room that size i didnt mind. As with the rest of the room, it was dated but clean. I had to laugh at the bathroom, they had obviously refitted it in recent years and fitted a larger basin than was there before as I had to lean sideways as i was pooping because the basin was in the way. The rest.... There are 3 main choices for food and drinks: 1) the bar and restaurant opposite reception, poor food every time although they were quick to offer free drinks when my colleague complained, I wouldve preferred a decent meal though. 2) the bar by the lifts, much better service, polite staff and a decent burger (i assume it comes from the same kitchen as the rest of the food though). Nice decor and a big TV. 3) The chicken place on the corner outside the hotel, typical chicken place, like the place you buy your kebab from on a saturday night in town, still better than what the hotel had to offer. Pool and "Spa" Does the job as a hotel pool incl steam room, sauna and jacuzzi but dont book it just for a spa day, you will be VERY disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great value city hotel”
Reviews.Author: angryman1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. The room was a reasonable size, spotlessly clean, modern and with a flatscreen TV with all the extra satellite channels. Extra touches included the fridge and safety deposit box for no additional charge. Free use of the hotel gym and pool which were fantastic. The pool and steam room were lovely and really helpful staff. Reception staff and concierge were very helpful and efficient and public areas of the hotel were well presented. We didn't eat in the hotel so can't comment but the bars and restaurants all looked pleasant enough and you're close enough to the tube and bus stops if you want to eat out. Only little issue we had was you had to pay for the WiFi. And it was very expensive. Other than that I would recommend this hotel, and you can usually get a very reasonable rate especially considering the high standard.

Reviews.Title: “Awful ... dirty, old, nasty”
Reviews.Author: Marc017
Reviews.Content: The Thistle Barbican is a truly horrible hotel. The room I stayed in was dirty, with peeling wallpaper, sticky lino flooring in the bathroon, a tiny, lumpy, bed, and noise coming through the thin walls and rattling windows all night. It really is dreadful. I wouldn't stay here again, even at the "good" rates that you can unsurprisingly get at lastminute.com

Reviews.Title: “good value breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kozzie_Lumps
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights for my dads birthday to see a show. The check in was easy enough and we were upgraded to a deluxe double rooms. We all were on the 4th floor although not together, 2 of the rooms were decent in size but our room 1417 was a smaller room stuffed in a corner near the service lift, which in fairness wasnt the problem as we didnt suffer any noise. The location is a little far out but using the underground wasnt a problem for us as we wanted to see alot and werent bothered about the location of the hotel so much, If you are wanting location at a cheap price, try the premier inn near the London eye. Breakfast every morning was worth doing, all buffet style and was enough choice even for the veggies. Filled us up for the day. Gym and pool use were free, didnt use them as we didnt get time.

Reviews.Title: “friendly reception”
Reviews.Author: RonnieSM
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a theatre break...on a room only basis so can't comment on the food...check in was smooth...room was clean and warm...staff were extremely friendly and helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Curryeaters
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the facilities, decent size room, everything in working order, very clean polished doors, floors and mirrors. Huge queue for breakfast but with 600 guests who all wanted to lie in and leave it until the last hour, what could be expected? We were given a 'double deluxe' instead of a standard double so perhaps we hit lucky. We would go there again

Reviews.Title: “Scruffy and Stuffy”
Reviews.Author: amy000
Reviews.Content: Having read other Tripadviors reviews I requested the main building. The staff were fine, and I got this. Thats about the only good thing to say. There was a 10 minute wait to check in, and next morning a queue for breakfast. In the room - I killed two mosquitos, one light was not working and the others were dismal, mainly because of accumulated dust. The carpet was threadbare, and the chair was worn through to the cushion underneath. There was noise all night from pipes. The ceiliong fan was not working - the switch was sheered off. The bed was a foot from the wall and had no fixed bed head. There was a puddle from the radiator when you turned it off. If you left it on it was very stuffy - these are small rooms. If you opened the window a crack - all that you could - you needed top open the heavy curtains also to let any ait in - office blocks opposite left lights on all night. So nothing very terrible for a 3 star London hotel but one night of scruff and dust was enough. Strangely, there were two ironing boards, although as the room was over stuffed with furniture I would have been challenged to find somewhere to put one up.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff but hotel needs some TLC”
Reviews.Author: beebox
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as part of a theatre package so I must say the price was extremely reasonable and therefore my expectations were not so high. The receptionist kindly allocated our room prior to the stated check in time in order for us to make our matinee show. On first appearance admittably the rooms are a little dated and in need of a lick of paint and some re-wallpapering, however it was the unfortunate finding we were greeted with that regrettably forced us to make a complaint and I must say Anton, the young gentleman on reception couldn't have been more helpful. From that moment on we were treated like royalty and compensated extremly justly. I would not like to pay the full amount for a hotel like this but as it was just a place to "rest our heads" for a couple of nights, and taking into account the price we paid I was extremely satisfied. My final comment to make is that the hotel unfortunately doesn't do the staff who serve there justice as they could give the staff serving at the savoy a run for their money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Tlhis hotel was not fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: debina187049
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel as >a spa day< as ;part of my daughters hen weekend. As soon as we checked in and put our luggage into our rooms the NINE of us headed straight to the spa. How disappointed were we to find that there were on two loungers between NINE of us. My first port of call to complain was the spa manager, unfortunately he could neither resolve the matter or offer an apology or compensation. My girlfriends and I marched to the hotel reception, in our towels!!!!!!, and asked to speak to the hotel manager. The manager was no more help to us. Basically he said when people normally come to the spa DAY, they just had a swim and there treatment and left. What a feeble answer and no help to us at all. As we were getting no where we accepted four bottles of HOUSE wine as compensation. In between talking to the manager the staff had put 7 conference chairs at the poolside (how lovely (not)). Do not use this hotel if you wish to concentrate on the spa. Also the spa was not clean and had a visible amount of chewing gum on the side of the pool. The only highlight of my time at the spa was the banter with the lovely Dave!!!!!! Go Dave!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: LinlithgowTravelscot
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews given and as this was booked for me I was not looking forward to a two night stay , but have to say i was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is clean and functional , with (as far as my engagement with them ) very helpful and friendly staff. Based on the reviews I asked for and was given a room in the main hotel which was fine and had a great view over London . Location wise its not the best with limited restaurants nearby and the nearest tube is a good 10-15minute walk . Overall though not as bad as its made out to be and i would be happy enough staying again .

Reviews.Title: “Oh My.... This is not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Scot_10
Reviews.Content: Check in staff were pretty slow, and their uniforms have definitely seen better days. I stayed in the annexe block and the rooms are not good at all. Rooms are small and very shabby. It's quite a noisy area too. Room rate for a single bed wa Â£94.50 - very poor value. I really do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: PhilBarker
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights having booked and pre-paid, this reduced the room rate from Â£166 per night excluding breakfast to Â£95.00 including breakfast. Had I paid Â£166 per night I would have been disappointed, however for the price the Thistle offered very good value for money. Reception staff are good, there was a queue when I checked in but more staff were called and the queue was dealt with efficiently. Room furnishings were a little tired but overall clean and functional. I liked the iron / trouser press combo and the in room fridge, why every 4 star hotel donâ€™t offer these basics is beyond me. Bathroom was clean but in need of updating otherwise ok. I didnâ€™t use any of the leisure facilities. Food was good, room service quick and polite. This is not my favourite London hotel but for the price you canâ€™t complain

Reviews.Title: “Bearable for one night”
Reviews.Author: anom26
Reviews.Content: I was in the annex, shoddy decor, old fashioned room, door had a very bad lock and no chain which was worrying, the shower only had one temperature-scolding. The whole place needs refurbishment, although reception area was nice. I was there on business but if I had paid for the room myself I would have moved elsewhere. Stay in a premier inn instead, the rooms here are in a 1980s timewarp.

Reviews.Title: “Ok at best but beware the standard rooms in the annex”
Reviews.Author: MP1Dublin
Reviews.Content: Ok at best - certainly no too bad! I booked this hotel primarliy on price but I was also enticed by their website and amenties which include a pool and fitness centre, neither of which i had time to use and my "standard" room was actually in the opposite annex...... Sub-standard would be a better description. Very tired and dated, Old carpet. Exposed plumbing at skirting level in the bedroom and most peculiar, the toliet roll holder was positioned on the wall OPPOSITE the WC, barely within reach. Narrow cooridors with awckward angles. Paper thin walls. Poor towels. Depressing decor, highlighted by the huge wall mounted flatscreen TV which stood out in stark contrast as the only modern amenity in th room. This place flatters to decieve. The reception, bar and restaraunt areas in the main hotel look impressive on arrival, as does the foyer of the annex but the moment you step into the lift you know you're gonna be let down, even if you're going up! In fairness the staff are proffessional, early check in was painless, directions to the tube were perfect and wifi advice was honest and accurate. Buy a Bt Freezone voucher for 24hrs @ Â£10 instead of the vouchers from recption. Fast hassle free access. The best thing about this hotel was the price, Â£69 per nite. I'm sure that they have better but more expensive rooms, in which case I'd recommend you stay elswhere unless you're on a really tight budget. London hotels are outrageously expensive and this a low cost option. It's not the best for transfer to the Emerates Stadium. Old Street to Kings Cross and onward to Highbury is impossible during rush hour to make 7.45 mid-week kick-off. Allow plenty of time for that journey. I left the hotl shortly at 18.15 and just about made it. the Gunners wrapped up the semi-final against Ipswhich 2nd leg 3-0 with 5 mins to spare so i could duck out early and the return jounry was less than half an hour! The immediate vicinty of the hotel is none to welcoming either, surrounded by residential tower blocks but it is only a short distance over-land to Islington - Â£3 taxi fair. I reckon you could walk this direct route in 15-20mins. For the price of an above standard room at this hotel you'll get better value elsewhere! Jurys Inn for me in future! MP!

Reviews.Title: “DonÂ´t be put off by surroundings”
Reviews.Author: jag552
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights for a conference. Reception area was welcoming and that was a relief because the area immediately around the hotel is not London at its best. My room was in the annex, and although the furniture was not new, the room and bathroom were a nice size, and the flat screen TV was good. The window seemed to let in a draught, but closing the curtains solved that. There was plenty of hot water for a shower, and tea and coffee making facilities were provided. Sleep quality was good, though by the time I got up at 7am some traffic noise was noticeable. Breakfast in the main building was quire good and was also offered refills of coffee. I paid 99 pounds per night including breakfast and i would say that it is a good deal. DonÂ´t forget that you have free use of gym and sauna falcilities. The only disadvantage of this hotel is that it is not really close to an underground station and it is not a very touritsy area. It was, however, handy for where I wanted to be. For a really cheap meal you could try Dixi Chicken across the road, and there are also a number of pubs around, but you have to walk a bit to get to Old Street where there is more choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed, dreadful room and over priced”
Reviews.Author: annejanewaters
Reviews.Content: Tiny, tiny shabby, old cupboard of a room for one. Broken window, therefore lots of traffic noise. Hard bed and solid pillow - woke with a crooked neck. Smelt of disinfectant. Staff let the room to another visitor who was very disgruntled that he couldn't get in! (fortunately had the chain on!). Phone to reception wasn't working properly so spent a very anxious 1/2 hour before I could get through to anyone to let them know. Certainly did not match the photograph on the web. Would not recommend to anyone. Maybe the double rooms are better?

Reviews.Title: “No problems for us”
Reviews.Author: FlorenceMilfordHaven
Reviews.Content: Worried when reading reviews but have to say we were very happy with our stay. Room was spacious, on third floor and very quiet. Bed clean and comfortable. Bathroom facilities good. Staff very friendly. Breakfast good and varied. Booked using Tesco vouchers so stay was free. If we had had to pay maybe we wouldn't have been so happy with the stained chair but overall we had a lovely time. No 55 bus into town, runs frequently so would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Oo2sulliedflesh
Reviews.Content: The staff here were exceptionally helpful and charming. We provided with a gluten free breakfast, and with soya milk. The breakfast room manager was charming. Reception staff helped us to solve a couple of problems with our travel arrangements. The concierge was delightful. We used the gym, sauna, steam room and pool, and found them all clean and well maintained. Our room was clean and comfortable. For a short stay this hotel was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected.”
Reviews.Author: emmze
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that this hotel was much better than expected. Travelled to London for one night for freinds 40th, 4 couples all together. There were a couple of minor issues but these were all dealt with swiftly and to our satisfaction. The staff were patient, polite and professional at all times. Rooms were clean and beds comfy. Breakfast was great and plenty of time to eat it in. Its a little off the beaten track as you have to change tube trains a bit to get to main attractions but we got a great deal so well worth the 10 min walk from Old Street tube.

Reviews.Title: “Far too hot”
Reviews.Author: bennevis503975
Reviews.Content: The reception is quite bright and clean and the staff are quite freindly but once you get to the stairs and corridors its dark and dreary and FAR TOO HOT. The air con in the bedroom didn't do much had to sleep with the windows open which was a bit noisy. The breakfast was o.k. but they seem to be short staffed.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Luke warm water and filfy fabrics”
Reviews.Author: Gazzaboy1960
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Thistle City Barbican hotel on the 12th Jan 2011 room 1420 which was meant to be an upgarde as our room wasn't ready. We had booked through superbreak.com We found that the fabric coushions and seat base fabrics were clearly stained and looking very unhygeinic. We had booked a meal and theatre in the city so started to get ready when we finally got in our room. I found the water supply to be barely luke warm ast best so I contacted the hotel reception desk and they said they would deal withn the issue but I heard nothing. I telephoned again and they said they would remind the maintenance man. I gave up asking again as we was by now running late for a meal booking prior to our theatre booking. I had showered, and my wife was now showering before the maintenance man knocked on the door. I explained the problem and asked him to check the supply at source as the water supply was good just cold. He said he would look into it. I also asked him to take the coushions away. I complained to the desk in the morning as my morning shower was axactly the same, (Barely luke warm), They apologised and said they could not offer any financial compensation as I paid in advance through Superbreaks.com. I am really not happy with this service, and I have to say I have never had to suffer such uncomfortable washing, and Hygiene conditions in all my 51 years.

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireSmudge
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Superbreak for our son and his girlfriend who are both studying abroad and came home for the first time in 4 months on New Years Eve. They stayed at this hotel from the 2nd for 2 nights. I did email prior to their arrival asking if they could be looked after as this was an Xmas present for them. They were upgraded from a standard room to a Deluxe King at no charge. On arrival the reception staff were very helpful and friendly, their room was very good. They had dinner as part of their package on the 1st night and said they really enjoyed it, again staff were all helpful and friendly. They tell me breakfast was good but could have done with more choice, but it was very adequate. Overall they had no complaints and said it was a great area for where they wanted to be.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: ChongSS
Reviews.Content: First we were given a room I suppose had not been occupied for quite a while. The double-bed room was a corner room (2101), the bathroom tiles were peeling off, the wash basin took >5 minutes to fill a 1L water jug. The cistern was not functioning properly, taking >30 minutes to fill up. It's just worst than a hostel room! We complained and was given a slightly bigger room (2127). winter-time and the heater was not functioning! after complaining, the heater was ok but no thermostatic control. Bathroom fixtures were badly maintained. I wonder how the maintenance were doing their work. At the rate they were charging, I wouldn't recommend this place. It's just not as advertised! The rating was based on the second room.

Reviews.Title: “Time Out”
Reviews.Author: griffsSouthsea
Reviews.Content: Having booked this hotel as a Superbreak and later seeing the reviews on Trip Advisor post booking I was quite anxious about our stay. I emailed the hotel prior to our arrival asking that we were allocated a double room in the main building and not the annexe. The hotel staff could not have been more accommodating meeting our request and upgrading us to a deluxe room. We thouroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel making good use of the room. pool and spa. The meal we had in the hotel was excellent and we found all the staff both efficient and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: MelonsUK
Reviews.Content: In London for a week long business trip with colleagues. Stayed in the annex part of the hotel for the first couple of nights. Room was tiny, but had what I needed - bed, bath, telly, kettle. Ironing board fell off the wall first time I tried to use it, but someone came to fix it quickly. After the first night I woke up with blotches all over my skin. I thought it was a reaction to the soap powder used on the sheets. Second night couldn't sleep as I was itching all over, then I heard the pitter patter of tiny feet and a rustling in my bag. Yes, I had a little furry friend sharing my room! I must admit, my problem was dealt with quickly and efficiently. The duty manager arranged for housekeeping to move me to a 'deluxe room' in the main part of the hotel. They also cleaned out my bag and the few items that were left in there. He did offer to buy me a new bag, but I'm not one to take the mickey. The deluxe room was a lot nicer with no extra visitors, but I still wouldn't have called it deluxe, or paid the price that they usually go for. Breakfast in the restaurant was good, but a long wait for coffee and every day I had to ask for a teaspoon! Restaurant food in the evening was also nice, but again the service was so slow. There were a few of us in my party and they always got at least one persons order wrong every evening. They were all very nice though. They eventually moved all of our party to the main hotel after someone else had a rodent issue in their room. After that, we couldn't move through the lobby or restaurant without a member of management coming to ask us if everything was alright! I don't know if they were genuinely concerned or if they were worried about losing our company's business. Still, they did go the extra mile those last couple of days. To sum up - rooms terrible, food good, service slow, staff pleasant, management helpful, rodents plentiful!

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach found in bed!”
Reviews.Author: kezz43
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a hen weekend, and I was HUGELY dissappointed!!! We staed in the annexe part of the hotel, and it is very delipidated to say the least! I felt like the room was falling apart at the seams. The over blanket on the bed was filthy, the bathroom had mildew and the ceiling had holes in it. We all had a spa treatment which was rushed and felt like a back tickle instead of a back massage. And then for the cockroach .... we came back from a night out in London, and neatly nestled in the bed was a baby cockroach ... and you know what they say 'if there is a baby there has to be a mother!' We left pretty early the next morning, so didn't get chance to meet the mother cockroach. Please I advise you not to stay at this hotel unless you absolutely have to, and even then take your own cleaning products with you.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: r1tracey
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband booked this hotel as a mystery hotel on last minute.com for 2 nights.When we arrived and checked in we was given a complimentary upgrade which was nice.However maybe we are not used to a double bed because it seemed incredibably small and we could'nt sleep so had to upgrade again at 1am in the morning which meant packing up again and moving rooms in our pyjama's and paying Â£40 for the privilage.When we arrived in our new room the decor was incredibly dated and the bed was big but as my husband pointed out was infact 2 single beds put together.In the morning while we was getting ready the water went completetly off and my husband was in the shower.As we left our room about 20 min,s later we bumped into a housekeeper who when we asked when the water was going to be back she just shrugged her shoulders! We did infact get our Â£40 upgrade money back,which in all fairness would have been better spent at a premire inn.Totally dissappointed with this hotel and would'nt return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again - Worst hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Fiona1984
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I were looking forward to a London getaway for the night to see a show. We booked this hotel via LastMinute.com - which we have used many times in the past & always had a happy outcome. The site advertised this hotel as 4star; this is definitely NOT the case. On arrival we were told that they didnt have any double rooms available (which we booked) & that a twin room is the best they can offer - not a great start. We then went up to our room; which was all rather shabby to say the least. Plug sockets were hanging loose from the wall, the bathroom was falling apart with no ventilation, there was a massive gap under the door. In addition, when leaving our room we realised that we had gone to the wrong room by accident (we got a digit wrong on the room number, a simple mistake). However, our room keys worked for both rooms which was very unsettling and hardly secure - it seem that you can just go in any room you like! Unfortunately, while out that evening my purse was stolen & had in it my room key & the hotel address/details. When I phoned the hotel to alert them (at the request of the police) the staff couldnt care less & even hung up on me twice - disgusting behaviour! Later that evening at the room we noticed our window was broken (it would not close properly, had several gaps & caused a graet draft. We called reception thinking that they would get another room for us but instead they sent a concierge up who entered our room & pulled a knife out of his pocket with the intention of fixing the window - the guy was asking for our help in ramming the window shut while he tried to fix it - a total joke is the only way I can explain it. We stressed our annoyance at the hotel & the so called service we had recieved from arrival. He told us that nobody had time to deal with our complaint & to speak to the day manager in the morning - we were not happy to say the least. The next mroning we were both woken by a women entering our room at 9am - housekeeping apparently, lovely how they thinnk it is ok to just walk in. I am not one to make a fuss usually but I was so disgusted & shocked by our experience that I really wanted to write this review to avoid others having thier London breaks ruined by such a shabby, unprofessional, unsafe & clueless hotel & staff. I will NEVER stay at a Thistle hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Do your homework 1st!!”
Reviews.Author: Josallyon
Reviews.Content: After reading comments on here i was very apprehensive so, i emailed the hotel telling them my concerns and asked to be placed in main building, which the hotel did and they also upgraded our room to a delux free of charge. The room was very clean and had no complaints whatsoever about that. We were entitled to a free 1st night meal through Superbreak, we were told immediately on being seated that this was only 2 courses and could pay extra for 3, on saying we would stick to one course and as we had booked the final sitting we were then told we could have 3 free of charge, the restaurant manager (larger guy) was extremely friendly and also remembered us throughout our stay which was lovely touch. The meal was ok as it was free although a carvery there was only turkey left in the meat section?! So glad we didnt pay for it. The breakfast was very good, great selection too, I agree with other comments regarding the toaster, very slow and your hot food does get cold whilst waiting. Tube station - well the directions are not very good from there to the hotel, but once we found our feet found a few short cuts and did only take 10 mins to walk there, although pretty safe wouldnt recommend to solo travellers at night, as did feel a bit nervous even with my man. We got a taxi from the hotel when going to a show and cost Â£14, black merc and very comfortable, agreed a price before we got in and was well worth it, he dropped us at the door of the theatre too. The reception staff were very very friendly as was the restaurant manager (the larger guy not the little one or slim one) waitresses and bar staff non descript really. Bar prices were extortionate but to be expected.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: lydiareid
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through lastminute.com for a one night stay recently. It was a "mystery hotel" and i thought it was a good deal at Â£99 until i found out the hotel name and checked the feedback on tripadvisor. I was nervous about my booking so i phoned the hotel and made a couple of requests. First, that my partner is very tall so could they ensure that we didn't get one of the low-roofed bedrooms that some people have referred to; second, that we got a double bed rather than a twin; and third, that it was a quiet room because i'm a light sleeper. i was told this was no problem. We arrived at the hotel and i was a bit concerned about the location. The front of the hotel itself is quite nice but i can understand why some people are a bit miffed at (what appeared to be) the dodgy area of town. The receptionist had no record of my call a few days previous and was going to give me a twin room. I told her about my phone call and also that it was our anniversary that weekend. She then upgraded us to a premium room at no extra cost, and sent up a bottle of wine. An unexpected gesture which certainly made up for my requests having been lost. We got to the room and it was a good size. The decor is rather dated although the bathroom had had some work done recently so it looked a bit sharper than the rest of the room. The room was split into two parts - a living room and a bedroom. The room was quiet, warm and comfortable enough. We went into the leisure facilities which was a small trek from the room (a bit of a maze!) and it was fine. The steam room was cracking although they'll need to look at where the steam comes from - it could burn when the steam comes out! The shower area in the changing rooms wasn't great and could do with a complete upgrade. We ate in the bar area - the barman was very helpful on advising about how fresh the food was etc. The food was very average. Perhaps we should have tried the restaurant! We didn't have breakfast because we were heading off early the next morning. Overall, a reasonable stay. For Â£99 in London it was fine. Made infinitely better by the helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would NEVER pay full price, but OK as a discounted 'Mystery hotel'”
Reviews.Author: IslandDragon
Reviews.Content: A very average hotel stay. This might be listed as a 4* hotel but really aside from the over inflated bar prices I don't appreciate anything that makes this 'special' I had got this booking for a 2 night stay as a last minute deal on popular website as an unknown 'Mystery Hotel' - and was pretty nervous when I read the reviews. Emailing my concerns to the company who made the booking I requested to be put into the main building, which they did with no problems or extra charges. I had to wait to check-in because the room wasn't ready, but once I got to it the room itself was small but clean and cozy and the bathroom facilities were all in working order. The hotel is a good 10-12 minute walk from the nearest tube station, which made going out at to see shows/eat and then having to walk back all that way along the streets late at night not the safest feeling thing to do. Because of this I wouldn't recommend this for other solo females, elderly or disabled guests, or guests with children unless they had alternate transportation.

Reviews.Title: “memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: jonnyshila
Reviews.Content: After seeing a few negative comments on trip advisor about thistle city barbican hotel, I did have concerns about our stay. But we found check in very friendly and efficient. The whole hotel was clean to my high standards, the bed was AMAZING. Booked this hotel through Priceline and so, for some reason was already getting a positive vibe from the front desk. I would like to particularly mention and recommend Ghosh, for his immense effort made to make our stay more memorable. After following his instructions the first day, we lost any "fear factor" of navigating around and found the exact location, which was simply great. I appreciate his assistance on getting the mini bar sorted .Anthony, the concierge with the Italian accent was very easy and fun. Now the unfortunate part, we ate breakfast (buffet) one morning in the hotel restaurant; I hated the food (my wife thought it was just o.k. - but I hated it). I loved the atmosphere of the restaurant however the workers were unfriendly and inattentive. Dinner service was average and as mentioned before.. â€˜â€˜inattentiveâ€™â€™, can be lot better. It would have been nice if free internet service had been provided in the lobby (common area) like many other hotels have; it would have been helpful to search and map out restaurants and other things of interest. It was like Â£15 for use, which I thought was extravagant. Anyway, we had Ghosh to explain us everything, so I can't complain. What noise were people experiencing we heard none. We cant wait to come back and would encourage anyone to stay here however the lounge experience makes me think twice. Just wanted to share my feedback, as I always believe, feedback helps business improve and grow.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: tools99
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel Dec 2010 I was put in te detached part if the hotel in a rooms only section away from the main hotel, the corridors are shabby and old, the room was basic to say the least and the bed was a single. Very hard pillows and windows that dont seal properly makes for a sleepless noisy night, I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Fantastic staff!!”
Reviews.Author: wlljones1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights to watch a show. The hotel was clean, the room was fine for what we wanted. If you want to stay in luxury then this is not the place, but the facilities are great, the pool and steam room are fab and the breakfast is fantastic, they even made us poached eggs especially. Most of all we found the staff fantastically helpful and friendly, especially the concierge called Angelo, he will go out of his way to help you. Once you work out the bus routes and tube it's really easy to get around, would advice a travel card as you can use for tube,train and buses and is only Â£5.60p for 24 hrs. We would definetely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Awful”
Reviews.Author: Areviewer2
Reviews.Content: We were going out for the night in London and just wanted somewhere clean, cheap and central for one night - I was not expecting much - just as well as this hotel could not be worse. We were in the old part of the hotel, the room was tiny and despite the heating not working and there being no air conditioning, plus the window was jammed open, the rooms was still stiflingly hot (in the middle of November!). I imagine a prison cell is more luxurious, although we are a married couple we were allocated twin beds, the most uncomfortable I have ever slept in, the bathroom was tiny and grotty, there are no facilities at all and the whole place is utterly depressing. The area is not somewhere you would feel safe walking late at night and the service is non-existent. When I checked out I was not asked if I had a good stay - I suspect they stopped asking their guests that long ago as they already can guess the answer. Maybe the newer part of the building is better, it certainly looks like it. We paid Â£120 which was a cheap deal through a consolidator, I would say it is worth no more than Â£30 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive tiny box room”
Reviews.Author: YeovilSS
Reviews.Content: This is the smallest hotel room I believe I've ever stayed in; and at Â£179 the worst value for money. We were in the older part of the hotel (room 2507) perhaps the newer part is better. It's a top floor 'attic' room with about 6 inches to squeeze around between bed and wall to get to the wardrobe and very tight to move around generally. Shower pressure was low with a virtually inoperable temperature control. The electric power for the hairdrier and the TV switched itself off a about 09.15 causing great concern to the female guest! When booking in/out the staff were very helpful - all those booking in when we were appeared to be visitors to the UK and I can't imagine what impression they had of the hotel. Parking in the surrounding area is a nightmare and we could not even unload luggage at reception due to a 'traffic jam'; apparently the hotel does have a few expensive parking bays.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KD1982traveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Barbican previously and after booking a secret hotel deal and discovering I was going to be stayiong there again I was very pleased. The secret hotel deals tend to guarentee a very nice stay for a very low price..... How wrong can you be! When we arrived we were told by reception that our request of a double room had not been met and we were in a twin room. This was not too much of a problem, but having booked nearly 4 weeks earlier I was at a loss a to why I had not been informed when it was requested on the booking form. the room we were allocated was on the 4th floor of the 'other' building. From the moment we stepped out of the ;lift it felt like we were in a lower end, poor-sister version of the barbican. the room was 'cozey' and the bathroom was so snug the door would not open. Despite the very cold temperatures the radiator hardly seemed on and despite booking the hotel for its spa facilities we were so disappointed that we decided in the morning to just get out of there. Finally the hairdryer was melted, only stayed on for a minute or 2 before cutting out and seemed to start smoking. when I called down to reception the lady I spoke to seemed at best uninterested. she assured me housekeeping would be informed, but 2 calls later the replacement hairdryer had still not materialised. In the end we gave up. The only good thing I will say about this stay was that the concierge was very helpful and at no extra cost our bags were looked after for the day. I am hoping this is a one off experience, but after paying nearly Â£100 for one night I wish I had picked somewhere cheaper, more central and a little nicer, as I am sure I could have found something better than this!

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: TIG60
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on last minute.com for 2 nights. It was a top secret location listed as "Price Madness at hotel with Pool near Square Mile - 4* - London close to Europe's largest arts centre - the home of the London Symphony Orchestra - this modern hot minute.com as a secret hotel " It was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed in!!! Its location is poor - middle of a housing estate Its cleanliness was poor - sink had hair in the plug hole and the towels were so thin you could almost see through them and you got 1 double and a hand towel between 2 people. value for money - advertised at one price but charged an extra Â£20 for the room we booked in the first place, upgraded to "deluxe" what a joke!!! breakfast - Â£10.95 a head, all served cold, tea served in a thermos, no choice and the beans tasted of burnt plastic. facilities - ordered a taxi from the hotel, it charged Â£13 to covert garden when we had done the same journey the day before in a black cab for Â£8.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy, good value”
Reviews.Author: lincolnshiregirl76
Reviews.Content: Attended my graduation ceremony at london guildhall, needed a triple room so chose this hotel. Found it was in a reasonable location and quiet. The room 2131 was a great size for a triple room and although definitely in need of refurbishment was clean and tidy. The beds were firm but we slept very well, good pressure in the shower. The main lobby is not as welcoming as it could be and unfortunately is quite cold due the outside doors opening and closing all the time. However the food in the restaurant was very good, perfectly cooked steak. Overall the service was very good, and the restaurant manager was particularly friendly and helpful. We were informed that there are plans to spend alot of money continuing the refurbishment in the new year. Would definitely use again. We also ate at Thai Thai on Old Street which is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Moorlanders
Reviews.Content: Booked an overnight stay at this hotel expecting a decent standard of accommodation. The room was shabby and in need of refurbishing & redecoratingwith bathroom fixtures hanging from the wall. The double glazed window wouldn't close properly making it a noisy room. A maintenance man attempted to fix the problem but couldn't. Â£164 for a tiny single noisy shabby room (2122) not impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: smudgecat153
Reviews.Content: After booking two night stay I read reiews (wrong way around!). We were pleasantly surprised,we upgraded our room for Â£20. The room was clean,quite spacious with reasonable fixtures and fittings. Our deal included dinner on Friday which was disappointing rather bland-also I thought Â£15 for a bottle of Echo Falls was a bit expensive! The breakfasts were much better and everyone was seated quickly considering it was very busy,plenty of choice and quantity.The staff were excellent -helpful and friendly throughout the visit. Very accesible would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: manniesharp
Reviews.Content: Having read some reviews we arrived with some trepidation. However all fears were allayed on arrival by friendly and efficient staff at check-in. Our room on the second floor was very clean and comfortable and we both slept very well. Breakfast was constantly refreshed with fresh produce and staff always helpful. Good location as only 10 mins from tube giving access to all areas. Would stay here for theatre break again. Thanks again to all staff.

Reviews.Title: “Too far out of the city”
Reviews.Author: howfener20
Reviews.Content: Book as a trip through our local evening news, for mums birthday. The hotel is too far out of the city, especially if you are elderly. Nice clean rooms, nice food, but expensive, but then again it is london. Its hard too find from the tube station, especially if you have never been to london before, the nearest one is old street. The concierge, would help you out with information, but you werent given any maps. He would order taxis for you. The staff are all friendly enough, but it does get busy at breakfast time, and they have to open up the upstairs to cope with the rush. Had a nice time here, but wouldnt use it again, because its too far out of the city, especially if you are going to the west end, as we were

Reviews.Title: “Was fine for what we paid and was expected”
Reviews.Author: Divemad
Reviews.Content: A group of 9 of us stayed here for a hen night, booked as part of a package with freedom events. The concierge was very helpful with our bags when we dropped them off early in the day. We had previously requested rooms in the 'hotel/reception' side of the building. Upon arrival we had still been allocated rooms in the other building opposite. We asked again to be placed in the main building and were first offered 9 single rooms as an alternative...I appreciate some groups might see this as a benefit, but we really wanted to stick with the original room booking (3 twins and a triple). The receptionist said we would be able to have these rooms, but that they wouldn't be ready until later. That was fine by us, so thanks to the receptionist. Un fortunately we didn't get chance to checkout the spa facilities. The rooms were ok, a bit on the small side apart from the triple which was much bigger. Cleaning left something to be desired (dusty!) and the bathroom was tatty. We were only here for one night and didn't spend much time in the room so it was ok. The beds were comfortable and we apprecited the tea and coffee in the room. The shower was quite disappointing pressure-wise. Breakfast was until 11am on Sunday, which was much appreciated. The downstairs breakfast area was very busy, but the staff did their best to clear tables quickly etc... The layout of the breakfast was a bit odd with sections of the buffet allower the place so you didn't immediately see all the options. Overall it was fine. We were aware of the location before booking and it was only a short taxi ride into central London for the evening. The concierge sorted this out for us. In summary: Fine for getting ready and a few hours sleep on a hen weekend. I wouldn't really recommend staying here for a romantic break away, especially at the list price - you can get much better for that kind of money. Persevere at reception if they try to put you in the other block of rooms (NB: We didn't actually see them), recommend requesting this before arrival. Don't panic if you've booked this hotel and read the reviews on here (I was worried!), it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Bad”
Reviews.Author: smiddyy3k
Reviews.Content: Don't think this is going to be a ok stay because it won't be. I stayed here in November 2010 and I was shocked about how bad the hotel was. I have stayed in many hotels but this deserves 1 star. I've stayed in better hostels. Trust me I'm used to bad hotels this is terrible. The worst I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling - shabby, dirty, graffiti on the bedroom wall and very noisy”
Reviews.Author: SBeaumann
Reviews.Content: Fortunately I only had to stay one night in this terrible hotel. The room was dirty, large areas of wallpaper were peeling off, there was graffiti on the walls, cables dangling, the curtains fell down when I tried to draw them and the bathroom was something out of the 1950s with mould, broken taps and a missing plug on a broken chain. I arrived late and had to eat dinner in their restaurant as I did not want to risk walking about in the rather run down looking immediate area. The meal matched the room - substandard, terrible service, too expensive. In short this hotel does not merit its rating in any way, it's overpriced and substandard, I've stayed in better 1* accommodation !

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: thekop123
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in numerous high quality hotels each year all around the world with work I was slightly apprehensive about my stay at the Thistle Barbican (mainly due to the negative reports on Tripadvisor). As it turned out this hotel was more clean, comfortable and friendly than many of the 'more exclusive' hotels I have previously visited. I will be staying there again next time I visit London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Jimbo32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights at the Thistle City Barbican in the main building and enjoyed the experience so much we have booked to return again in December with our daughter. From when we arrived at reception to serv ice at the bar and friendliness at the breakfast room we cannot fault the attitude of the staff. Our room was clean and the food was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, dirty, shabby and expensive - terrible even for London”
Reviews.Author: Hywel.Morgan
Reviews.Content: I had to make an on-the-day booking for business in London, and in hindsight I'm not suprised this hotel had availability. It cost Â£200, for a tiny room that was incredibly shabby. The room was horribly warm, even though this was November. Opening the window wasn't an option as there was a very loud air-con fan outside that kicked in every 2 minutes making sleep almost impossible (unfortunately I'd forgotten my ear-plugs). Closing the window had little effect on the noise though. This was in the part of the hotel that is across the road from the reception. Never stay in that part of the hotel. Staff seemed friendly enough, if a little weary of the criticisms and embarrassed. Terrible hotel for Â£60 let alone Â£200. Never stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Gropius365
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Thistle Barbican for business a few weeks before -- I found the room a bit run down and not worth the money my company was paying, but as London is expensive and this was short notice (and it wasn't my money) I did not complain. This time (again booked this hotel by my company), however, the room seemed considerably more run down but again I did not have the time or energy to ask for a different room. I woke up the first morning to see dark spots on the sheets -- I tacked it up to old linen, just another mark against the hotel. The next night I awoke to feel the sensation of bugs crawling on me and indeed when I turned on the lights there were bugs everywhere!! I even photographed one crawling on the ceiling. To their credit, the hotel moved me to a suite immediately. They were only willing to reimburse one night, however. This hotel is situated in two buildings. The building that is not attached to reception is very decrepit, the carpeting is worn and dirty, and my bug-infested room was in this building (as was my previous sub-standard room). The suite they moved me to was in the building with reception on the ground floor and this building in general seemed to be of a higher quality. I see that another guest had an experience with bed bugs here as well. If you must stay here, insist to stay in the building that contains the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was superior, making the stay enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: rosietraveler45
Reviews.Content: I stayed for seven nights and found the staff really wonderful. The concierge staff were able and friendly and always available with good information and a friendly smile. In the breakfast and dining area, both Jyoji (don't know last name) and Christina Esposito did an outstanding job. I had two different rooms, but the one in the main building was the better of the two. The price was right and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: cfm1984
Reviews.Content: I stayed with this hotel for two nights on buiness, I would not use it again. I'm generally not a fussy traveller and not hard to please, especially when away on business, but I had such a bad experience with this hotel that I felt I had to at least write a review to warn others. The hotel itself is clean and well presented, there are a few minor issues that could be better but overall not a bad hotel - although nowhere near 4*. My issues were with the poor service I recieved. I had an issue with my account which I asked the reception staff to help with, they couldn't be less interested in helping me - I was genuinely appalled at thier attitude. When I called up to chase up on the issue I was actully laughed at on the phone. I was promised call backs which I did not recieve and the issue has still not been rectified, nor have I at any point recieved anything by way of apology from the hotel. Had the mistake not occurred I might not have recieved such bad service, however I have been put off for good!

Reviews.Title: “never again...”
Reviews.Author: mishtanno1
Reviews.Content: Terrible stay- hoped to be in central London in a good Thistle Hotel. We booked a standard double and got a corner room, mis-shapen, TV at an odd angle, small bed, poor quality towels, smelly bathroom, no views....you name it. We had to move out the next day ASAP. The area around was all estate and the choice of food/restaurants poor. Stay weel away.

Reviews.Title: “Thistle Barbican, I recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: oldandbold
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed for a week in august, we had a great time, the room was basic but the price was so reasonable, we didn't mind. We had room service every day, the breakfast was a great buffet, with lots of choice. We had to wait to be seated some days, but that was not much of a problem. I do not recommend the restaurant for evening meals however, it is over priced and bland. After the first night we ate in London at either Wagamama (love that place) or in pubs. The front of house staff were very friendly and helpful, booking theater tickets and sorting out the door swipe card. They tell you not to put the card near your mobile phone, but I had a tiny purse........ and Yes, we will go back there

Reviews.Title: “Value for money but not great”
Reviews.Author: Coz&Kiwi
Reviews.Content: We were a hen party of 12, who paid Â£130 for two nights in a central hotel with breakfast on both mornings and a gourmet meal in a private dinning room on the Sat evening. Of course being a London hotel none of the staff were English and sometimes the language skills needed to be a bit better given itâ€™s a service industry The gym was good. Pleasant surroundings and reasonable selection of equipment for a hotel gym. Spa and pool are looked lovely although one comment from another of the party (I didnt try) was that the jacuzzi was gritty. Gourmet meal was very good and full of flavour. The choc torte was fierce some! Service of the food was excellent too but they wer very slow to take drinks order and deliver. Also the waiter had a BO problem. Not good given his occupation and was leaning in close to deliver food and drink. Also they wanted payment for the drinks immediately rather than at the end of the meal. I think they are missing a trick. People will drink more if its on a tab Top tip â€“ book some music for the room and plan to decorate. Itâ€™s a meeting room which looks very bland and business like, not what you want for a party. Hamed the catering manager allowed us to decorate the table and room which was great â€“ thank you, Hamed. Bedroom was a bit shabby, window dirty and didnt close properly but bed and bathroom clean. Bathrom and bath were compact. Most of this I didnâ€™t mind so much given the price of the package. Street noise was intrusive and walls were paper thin. Ok if you know your room neighbours and can sleep anywhere but would have been very annoying otherwise. Saturday breakfast was fine other than a huge queue for the hot food. All buffet style. Sunday was dreadful. There was a massive queue just to get seated. We were a large group (12) and so were put into a separate room which was a meeting room adapted for breakfast over flow. Unfortunately they had not set the room up adequately or allocated sufficient staff . The tables were not set, no napkins, cutlery, cups or glasses. No hot water for tea. No juice. Bins overflowing. Tables were not cleared for the hour we were in this room. Left over food (there was a lot) plates etc., sat there. Disgusting. The food was cold, probably because it sat undeneath the air con unit, also not very hygienic. We complained to Hamed who apologised (altough initally tried to argue - mistake) and offered teas, coffees and more breakfast if required. Overall probably just about value for money but not somewhere I would plan on going back to unless money was tight and I had to stay in that area. It suited us as a group with different budgets and the package was ideal for our purposes. There are plenty of other places to stay in London, so look round first!

Reviews.Title: “No bells and whistles, but a good value for our package tour price.”
Reviews.Author: Melissa_Imladris
Reviews.Content: I read so many bad reviews about this hotel that I was very worried about staying there, but we had no other choice, and it was included in a very good vacation package deal. Yes, we had to stay in the annex and not the main part of the hotel. However, they have remodeled, and the annex (other than the one elevator that didn't always work, though the other did), was very clean and smoke-free. Our room, though quite small, had all the amenities we knew we were to receive, and everything worked (though the shower was a bit difficult to turn on at first). Yes, the rooms are small, but we didn't plan to spend much time in the rooms. Also, as with most UK hotels, internet was not free, but you could buy a multi-day voucher online, and we used that to share photos with our family about our vacation. The English breakfast was probably the best part of our stay. Yes, there was a line if you arrived between 8:30 and 9:00, but it moved quickly. All the food was warm and freshly prepared. The juice machine worked, and since we had our meal included, there were no problems. There was also no voucher required for the meals, we just had to give our room number. The hotel bar/restaurant, however, was extremely overpriced, but because we got to the hotel early (we had been told that we would get to check in a few hours early), we were forced to eat there. Hotels have a 12.5% surcharge on food, so just walk down the street to get something to eat. They did promise to let us check-in early, and they did not do so. They seem to have many late check-outs, so don't arrive early and expect to do anything but hang out in the lounge. The hotel is not close to any Metro stops, so we got a lot of walking in (warning that Old Street Station has some steep steps, and suitcases have to be carried). However, the day concierge was wonderful and helped us navigate the tube systems. The evening and weekend concierge was far less helpful, and was somewhat grumpy. The one thing we had a major issue with was that the maid did NOT understand the "Do Not Disturb" sign, and came barging in after we had just taken a shower. She got a very lousy tip from us for this indiscretion.

Reviews.Title: “Best of a bad bunch in the area”
Reviews.Author: tpbel
Reviews.Content: I have to be in this part of London quite regularly for work and have stayed in the Thistle twice now. The first time was in the Annexe in a small single room and it didn't feel safe for a solo female to be kind of isolated there. This time I checked all other options in the area which were more expensive so I thought I'd give the Thistle another try and specifically requested a room in the main building, which I did indeed get upon arrival. This room was so much better - larger and just felt safer. Bathroom outdated and curtains torn in places, but a world away from the previous room in which you couldn't swing a cat. I talked to colleagues about where they were staying and the Holiday Inn Express was apparently no better at twice the price. So I will stay at the Thistle again, in the main building, when I have to be in the area. But they could improve the breakfast experience - if you want to eat at 8am, queue from 7.45!!! They need to get their processes improved - too many empty, uncleared tables leading to a long wait time - on both mornings that I was there. A better option is to eat breakfast at Jamie Oliver's Fifteen - just a 10-minute walk away :-)

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, Bad Food, Massively Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Joeyb14939
Reviews.Content: The hotel was dirty and very dated. The rooms were fine in size, but were quite dusty and dirty in places, the towels and sheets had a wierd smell and it just felt like it could do with a deep clean. The bath was also a little grotty. The breakfast was the worst I've had in a hotel and I do always look forward to a breakfast when staying in hotels. The bar was also very very expensive - even for soft drinks. We did get most of this stay free using tesco clubcard vouchers, however, if I'd have paid over 300 pounds which is what the regular price is of the hotel for two nights I would have been bitterly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Big waste of money, and it wasn't even my money!”
Reviews.Author: georgeerice
Reviews.Content: One night stay here for approx.. Â£240 in a single room. Unless the hotel was specifically aiming to make the room feel like student digs then the quality of the decor and fittings was appalling. I was on expenses, but felt completely ripped off. The check-in staff promised it wil be a 'really nice hotel next year'. I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here - bitterly disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: InMyHonestOpinion
Reviews.Content: Definitely not 4 stars! I booked a double room for two nights for my boyfriend's birthday and was very disappointed by the room. My boyfriend had arrived a little before me and had checked in. He immediately upgraded the room paying 20 pounds for the privilege. As a previous review has written this must have been in the 'old' part of the hotel. I only got to view the upgraded room which was still very small, had holes in bedsheets from wear, an old cathode ray tube TV and bathroom with dusty, polystyrene ceiling tiles and no vent. The curtains and bedspread and room decor was a confection of some garish yellow and red pattern which did not soothe matters. The hotel is also about half a mile from any tube station and is located in the middle of nowhere (yes, despite being in Central London!) My boyfriend had a quick lunch upon checking in before I arrived and despite having already checked in and having asked if the meal could be added to our room bill we were subsequently ordered downstairs from the 4th floor to pay our bill immediately! What is the point of having a room bill? There is also an extra 5 pound charge for any room service so don't bother. Only plus point is the McDonald's within walking distance! Do Not Waste Your Money!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Gillygirly
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of hotels for work and this one is distinctly average. Dated rooms, surprisingly ok room service but no robe, no water in room and basic toiletries for Â£180 per night is shockingly bad value as well as a poor experience for the customer. My checkout experience was terrible, the advisor Inok Yong did not even enquire if I had enjoyed my stay and "processed" me before moving on to create an equally bland experience for the next weary traveller. Needless to say, I am not recommending this hotel nor am I likely to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I was charged Â£200 for a pokey single...”
Reviews.Author: card01
Reviews.Content: I was charged Â£200 for a pokey single bedded room that had all the hallmarks of a 1970s student flat. Do not accept a room in the 'annexe'! Public areas are well appointed. Breakfast was bog standard buffet, but the food was cold! I complained to thistle but have not had a response three weeks later.

Reviews.Title: “Decent enough Hotel, if a little dated”
Reviews.Author: jane_2962
Reviews.Content: On arriving at this hotel, the reception staff did let us check in early, the rooms (2 twins) were clean and tidy, the bed linen was fresh and clean, there was adequate tea, coffee milk etc, shampoo and shower gels etc, the bathroom was clean but did need a bit of a revamp. Breakfast was a little basic, but nice enough. My only bad comment on this hotel was, on departure we left our bags at the desk to collect later in the day, as we had a train to catch we had to wait for someone to come and release our bags, when someone did come, she was not very pleasant, and didn't apologise for keeping us waiting. Apart from that, I would definately stay there again, it was convienient for the West end and shopping, only 2 tube stops from Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad....”
Reviews.Author: humanbeingLondon
Reviews.Content: Perfectly reasonable room on the 4th floor in the main building. Let myself and mate check in early. Desk staff very efficient and friendly Room a little dated but not the end of the world. All in all ok, however only was intended to be a place to rest head...

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel inspector should vist this place”
Reviews.Author: SteveTheRanger
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were efficient but totally lacked even eye contact on arrival, I was given a room on the third floor, the reception staff failed to warn me that the place was like a rabbit warren, the hallways all look the same and you can get lost just finding your room here, Entering your room here was like stepping back to the 1970s I think they are still using the same fixtures and fittings, anyway the room looked ok, until I noticed that the T/v in the room was just for show it did not work, the chairs were dirty and stained, the bed mattress had a stain, and the bathroom needed a good clean see photos of the shower taps and holders, No Tea or coffee making stuff, the towels were like sand paper, and the room noise in the room was loud with the windows open, the sheets on the bed were clean at least. The only good thing I can say about this overpriced Hotel ,is that the bar staff (although very busy due to the amount of people in the bar, proberbly could not sleep ) were indeed friendly and a true asset to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will never use again”
Reviews.Author: jimmydash
Reviews.Content: Many problems. Needs a lot of money spent on the rooms - bathroom was totally worn out. Towels were stinky because they were washed at too low a temperature. Had my shower, dried off and drenched myself in aftershave to overcome the stinky towels. My windows were jammed open near the taxi rank which operated all night. Check in took ages over 20 minutes. Breakfast was poor quality and dreadful range - one fruit type. I will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews do this place no justice, will definately recomend this hotel to friends!!!”
Reviews.Author: Linzy30
Reviews.Content: Firstly I will start with saying that the reason I am going out of my way to write this is because I feel like previous reviews on here do it absolutly no justice at all!!!! ... My partner had booked us a night here to celebrate my 30th birthday, when he told me the name of the hotel I checked it out online and read some of the reviews and found myself dreading our stay!! As it goes upon arrival we was greeted by very friendly and efficient staff, checkin was a breeze with no problems at all. We let ourselfs into our rooman after bickering about who was gonna go in 1st as we where dreading what horrors lay behind, to find a bright and spotless room with an extremely comfy bed, with all amienetys in working order, hairdryer, iron, aircon and fan above bed oh and a flat screen telle with great selection of chanels, we found the bathroom in the same pristine state as our room, no sign of any damp or dirt that we had read of before, the shower had perfect pressure and we had plenty of towels!! Me and my other half where both plesantly suprised and relieved to say the least. The only one gripe we had was that we found the room service was not up to scratch, we found ourselfs waiting for over an hour for a roast beef sandwich and a coke!!! Overall we was more than happy with our stay and I have to say made for the perfect setting for a fantastic 30th birthday!!! So thank u all staff at the Thistle hotel we shall deffinately return for another stay!!! Oh and I can not finish without also adding that the barstaff where brill and kept us stocked with plenty of ice buckets to keep our bubbly nice and cold!!! And would also like to thank the maintenance man who kindly rescued my mobile phone after I had dropped it out of our 5th floor window into a courtyard that u could only access through the window of a lower floor room!!! He done so without even a raised eyebrow infact he made a joke about it!!! Fantastic staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling hotel - exploiting foreign visitors to London at extortionate prices”
Reviews.Author: Wilverley
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel for one night only and paid Â£220 excluding breakfast. During my stay I witnessed a Spanish family excluded from the bar, when it was the only place to get food late because they had (teenage) children. 2 customers having to ask for bottled water for their room at the bar (like in a bed and breakfast). An unstocked mini bar (pointless) Terrible service and food at breakfast. Scruffy, dirty room. All in all a 2 star experience at 5 star price. The hotel is badly managed with no sense of ownership or pride. It exists through a cynical reliance on receiving sufficient numbers of transient foreign visitors. None of whom will stay again and who do'nt have the English, nor the inclination, to complain. After I raised my concerns at reception on checking out, all I received was a further request to compain on line and have since heard nothing. Don't use this hotel under any circumstances, it makes you ashamed to be British.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise ....”
Reviews.Author: snadge
Reviews.Content: ..... as having read reviews on here we were a little apprehensive to say the least. We arrived at Old Street tube station with no clue as to which direction or distance the hotel was. Eventually we figured it out, and after about a 15 minute walk we found it (for those that read this - from the tube station walk towards St. Lukes, and at the traffic lights go right, then at the next lights you will see the hotel). Reception staff were great, checked in with no hassle, and told we had been upgraded at no extra charge. Our room was absolutely lovely, it and the bathroom both fresh, and spotlessly clean. Despite reviews to the contrary, breakfast was an efficient and tasty experience, lovely staff who couldn't be more helpful. The same can be said for the downstairs restaurant bar, with a fantastic barmaid, very helpful and friendly, and the light snack we had in there was lovely, service with a smile. Only downside was the walk from the tube station, after a long day sightseeing in the city the last leg of the walk was just a few steps too far. A shuttle bus would make this the perfect hotel - but a taxi to Kings Cross only cost us Â£7 worth it not to have to trundle the cases back down that blerdy road ;o)

Reviews.Title: “Terrible. Worse than some 2 star hotels ive stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: jackinbox99
Reviews.Content: My partner & I stayed here for a romantic weekend. It was a "mystery hotel" from a well known website, so we didnt know the actual name of the hotel until it was booked. We then checked out the Thistle website and was very impressed. It looked awesome, and even tho Â£94 seemed expensive, we felt it was worth it. We soon found out why it was a "mystery hotel" as it was miles from anywhere, and a long walk down some very dodgy looking back streets and area before we found it. All the local flats had bars and extra security gates installed. Not a good sign. Arrive at hotel and staff were polite. Room was terrible. We were in the main hotel, but the room was shocking. Dodgy stains on the cover which goes around the bed, the furniture was 80`s. The bath handles were all rusty, loads of sealant everywhere, paint had all faded and was yellow. Ive been in 2 star hotels better than this. The taps on the bath didnt work properly, and no privacy with curtains drawn as about 8 other rooms all looked straight into ours. We looked at the prices for the restaurant and was amazed.. they were just shockingly expensive. Can of coke? Â£2.95! a Vodka & Coke in the hotel bar downstairs came to nearly Â£6! Even though the pool & spa were free and we packed our swimming costumes in anticipation, from seeing the state of the room we just didnt bother using the pool or spa. Ive stayed in 4 star hotels all over the world and this easily has to be the worst. Thank god I was only staying there for 1 night!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, brittiant, wiil return.”
Reviews.Author: champagne1950
Reviews.Content: very welcoming staff. room clean and tidy.loved our weekend stay. will recommend hotel to everyone. helped with roomservice and taxi's. women alone in London FANTASTIC HOTEL. Thankyou everyone xxx

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting rooms, awful restaurant and food and VERY overpriced - do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Dismayed_10
Reviews.Content: My mother and I needed a hotel close to the local hospital prior to an operation so I looked up a selection of local hotels. The Thistle Hotels have a very impressive website and looked something special so I decided it was worth the HUGE expense. Having been persuaded by the booking staff to 'upgrade' to an executive room, and having read about the great restaurants on offer I was optimistic about having a really special eveningprior to my mum having serious surgery the following day. NOTHING could be further from the truth - heaven knows what the standard rooms were like - the exectutive upgrade rooms had dirty wallpaper peeling off the walls, threadbare and fraying carpets, uncomfortable beds, limited tea and coffee, no minibar. AWFUL. We put a brave face on and went to find the supposedly very posh restaurant. OH MY GOD. Even worse - the 'restaurant' was not even private - right in reception, no walls, awful service (5 waiting staff), cold horrid food - and all horrendously expensive. I have stayed in hotels throughout the UK and the World and this was probably THE WORST experience I have ever encountered.

Reviews.Title: “If I pay Â£90 for 1night I don't expect a room like that”
Reviews.Author: LovetheWorld2010
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner booked this hotel because it was near to the bar/nightclub we wanted to visit. The lady at reception was lovely, she asked us if we wanted to pay an extra Â£10 to upgrade to a executive room...I didn't see the point as we were only stopping for 1 night and I thought paying Â£90 was enough anyway. We asked where our room was the lady at reception told us the basic/standard room were across the way....I though OKAY! We went across the road to the other building, which reminded me of entering a block of flat....there was no reception...we went in the lift......and I said to my partner gosh it looks like they were about to refurbish and couldn't afford to then opened back up the building to let out the room. He said it looks likes this is the side of the building where men take their illicit affairs too or .......well need i say more. Upon entering our room I was not happy, the wall paper was peeling off the thread on carpets was frayed really badly.....the furniture in the room was dire, handles and things falling off, thank god the telly was flat screen, the bathroom was dire very old fashioned.......with lots of sealant used around the bath and sink......the shower fitting was not working......so much things.......and the room was so dusty.....I am sorry but if someone hasnt booked the room at least send someone in to give it a wipeover.... We went and got breakfast that was the best thing about our stay...apart from having to wait so long until we were seated. After we came back from our breakfast we wanted to relax for a bit before checking out, then the fire alarm went off.......we didn't know what it was, we went downstari thinking it might be a false alarm..we were just standing there staff were walking around and didn't even direct us where to go. I will never book this hotel ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: BhuddaBean
Reviews.Content: Having enjoyed Thistle Hotels abroad, thought I would try this one for a one night business trip. Reception was in some disarray fighting with a printer problem. Rooms are in two buildings opposite each other across a vehicle entrance. London in the summer means lack of air con can make for a hot and stuffy room. This was not the case here as the window opened OK, but did not close properly. The room and bathroon was showing its age. As the room was on the main street and there was constrution work, I'm glad I took earplugs. The room was very small and a single upright chair and small desk was barely adequate for working on my laptop all evening (Â£9.99 for 24 hr BT OpenZone connection). I suspect this was a single room business deal and tourists should get better. The main gripe was poor service in the bar in the evening, the snack and drink took ages to come and I needed to chase. The sandwiches were dry and uninspiring when they came. Having looked forward to breakfast I found the selection poor and the hot food luke warm. Please note, Britsh traditional fried breakfast is not pleasant if not hot. The toaster took 3 goes to make acceptable medium colour. I had to seek out staff to ask for a coffee refil. Sorry folks, it was uninspiring and I would not go back. PS. Choice was partly due to being 10 mins walk from Old Street tube station on the Northern line which I needed for a meeting next day. There are shops underground and if on your own wanting a modest meal, try the Nincomsoup shop with homemade soups and snacks at reasonable prices. Non threatening for those who want to blend with the surroundings, sit quietly on their own and read. Ask for a sample of each before you decide which soup to have.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag really”
Reviews.Author: DansTours
Reviews.Content: Rooms weren't ready for us when we got there at 2pm, rooms were ready around 5pm... not a good start. One good thing about the hotel is its location (for younger people & groups of friends) as the junction of Old Street/Curtian road has plenty of nice bars/clubs.
