The rooms were a bit budget really, hard beds, not much space, broken shower etc but we didnt spend much time in the rooms anyway. Breakfast was average at best. Just didnt taste right plus huge queues to get in. Your money is best spent elsewhere in my opinion as this place is an overpriced budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “shabby room, breakfast a shambles”
Reviews.Author: solo_traveller39
Reviews.Content: Stayed six nights. Room was small and shabby. Much of the chrome on the bathroom fittings had worn off and there was a foul odour from the sink each time I ran water. The bed was reasonably comfortable. There were long queues to get into the restaurant for breakfast even before 8 am. Even when you got a seat the table had often not been cleared. The food was generally OK but there were frequent shortages and the staff were too busy to serve you a drink. The situation got progressively worse the later it got. I would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: gminter
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my wife & friends & we all thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our room was comfy, clean & quiet. The staff during check-in & behind the bar were attentive & very friendly. Breakfast got busy but we were still seated & fed to our satsifaction. We didn't use the gym or pool though did have a look & these seem ok for a relax after a hard days sight seeing. Favourite parts of the hotel were it's location for nightlife with Clerkenwell & Hoxton on it's doorstep & the friendly bar downstairs. Sometimes hotel bars are huge souless places but not this one.

Reviews.Title: “Shocking!!!!”
Reviews.Author: buttons089
Reviews.Content: After many years working in the Travel/hospitality industry i have never ever stayed in such a shocking place. Room 1123 avoid like the plague, the carpet was stained, frayed and thread bare, the bathroom had someone elses toothpaste on the unit the shower tap was thick with grime and the tap was awful with limescale. The cupboards were missing handles, the chair had holes in it, dust you could write your name in was every where, there was no chain on door for security and no radiator top. When we called down to reception we was just told to put it in writing they really dont seem to fussed no doubt they have to deal with these complaints all the time however for the price that they charge they should be getting it sorted!!! There is also lotsof roadworks which start up very early in the morning as well.We then spoke with the conceriege to book us on the courtesy bus back to the tube station which was ok we went down to get the bus at the designated time only to be told it was no longer available as the duty manager was using it!!!! I have lived and worked in 3rd world countries and their hotels and hospitality is far superior to this here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thomas K
Reviews.Content: Nice standard business hotel , located in Central London, 10 minnutes walk to next Underground station, fresh and good quality breakfast buffet and a nice restaurant with delicous food. The bar is located in the lobby environment. The hotel seems to have different kind of romms, some are refurbish, some are not. This was my experience being already twcis time in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING”
Reviews.Author: belmontdon73
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely disgusting. My room had old, tatty wallpaper and lots (and lots) of stains on the walls. and carpet. The room was tiny - the smallest and dirtiest I have ever been in in 14 years of travelling on business, including many trips to Lithuania, Belarus, Latvia and Estonia. Everything is the room was dirty and a lot of things were sticky. The TV remote was covered in clumps of sticky brown goo (God alone knows what is was). The room was very dark and there wasn't mch natural light so no way of improving matters. There was a distinct smell of urine in the room - it didn't come from the bed so I simply slept on top of the bed (the sheets were heavily stained so didn't want to sleep in them). There was no aircon and the room was roasting with no way of changing the temperature. The bed itself was stained and I'm not 100% sure if it was actually made since the last people were there. I was a guy travelling on his own and was shattered after a very early start so just crashed out. However, if I had my children in this place I would have left immediately as I would have been concerned that they would catch something (that is not a joke). There was a damp stain and mould in the tiny bathroom. Also, the sealant was coming away from the bath which made it look even sleazier. The toilet was cracked which made you worried that if you used it, it would flood the bathroom. My (solitary) towel was ripped, but trust me that was the least of my problems;-) The door to my room didn't swing shut, you had to give it a hard shove. If I hadn't realised this I would have lunwittingly eft my room with the door unlocked. Also, you could see at the lock that the door had been forced open sometime before (I wonder why??) There was pipework in my room and fixes that resembled bad DIY projects. There is no way this is a 2 star hotel far less a 4 star hotel. There was no mini bar in my room and not enough plugs (which is what you'd expect from 4star places). Any Travel Lodge I have been in is a million times better than this place. I did smile at my iron cupboard. It had no ironing board....or an iron. Just the broken fittings for them in an empty cupboard. The location is not good. It is in the middle of a council estate and there were several groups of youth hanging around drinking when I went out (7.00pm). There were shouts and screams till about 3.00am (nothing dramatic - just drunken teenagers doing their things but it does keep you awake). It is not near a tube station. It is not near any nice bars, cafes, etc. Check in took 15 minutes with a grand total of 3 people in front of me. HOWEVER..... the reception area looks pretty smart and clean (so if you're a big fan of tidy receptions ......;-)). AND.....the gym is clean, although small and got overcrowded quickly, Overall, this is a disgusting, horrible hotel. If you're thinking 'I'll give it a go anyway' so be it but under no circumstances take young chldren to this hotel - they will get ill; you will hate yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money - pool is excellent”
Reviews.Author: hols_ob1
Reviews.Content: I've never written a trip advisor review before but I use them quite a lot. I felt I had to write one about this hotel to do it justice. We travelled to London for my hen night as a group of 11. I booked the trip through an agency and therefore didnt get to read the reviews here til after the hotel was booked. As you can imagine I was very nervous and panicking about it being horrible after reading the horror stories. However I was pleasently surprised when we arrived at the hotel. It was a short walk from Barbican tube (approx 7-8 mins at a medium pace with suitcases) so not central but by no means out in the sticks. We got a cab to Tottenham Court Road and it was only Â£12. As for the comments about being a rough and unsafe area to walk through, blimey if you think this is a bad area then you don't know London very well, it could be a lot worse! We walked back from the bus stop on Goswell road at 2am and didnt feel vunerable at all. The reception and concierge staff were efficient and helpful. Only complaint was is was v hot in reception and it wasn't even a sunny day! We had 5 rooms in total, and all of the were perfectly acceptable. All clean and well kept. Only one room had a problem and that was a dodgy bathroom light. This however was soon rectified by the hotel. Rooms had good facilities which freeview tv and tea/coffee making facilities. Beds were comfy and space in the room was fine, even in the triple room with a z bed. The breakfast was of a reasonable standard, in a buffet style. Some of the hot food was a little cold but there was staff constantly replenishing. They accomadated our large group quickly and easily which was nice to have brekkie all together. The pool area definitely deserves a mention as well as it was so good. The pool was quite and clean. We also used sauna, steam room and jacuzzi. Good sized changing rooms. The young guy that booked us in couldn't have been nicer. I didn't catch his name but I hope he gets a gold star for this mention! Anyway to summarise, in my experience, this hotel is not as bad as all the other reviews say

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS !! Filthy place!”
Reviews.Author: YMAX
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Thistle barbican and in the 2nd night I woke up to find myself covered in bites. I realized that the bed was full of bed bugs. Filthy place! How could that be possible? In London, in a supposedly 4 start hotel in the city? I can only think that they do not clean properly an do not change sheets between 2 guests. When I informed the staff they did not believe me. I had to show the bites. Absolutely disgusting! Avoid the place if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced & Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: Pendlerjp
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night in this hotel and will definitely not recomend nor return - the room I had was stuffy (cell like - aka hostel), no air con and unclean (or at least in need of new decor and a good scrub).

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend to my worst enemy!”
Reviews.Author: lois_malfoy
Reviews.Content: Do not stay this hotel. Period. First of all its miles from the city or and tube stop, it is in the middle of a rough estate, I would be wary walking around at night! Secondly, the room was small, dirty, my light did not work, the bath was only superficially cleaned, so on a closer look, around the taps etc was grimy, they were handles missing and or falling off the walls. Overall poor room standard. The walls were incredibly thin and you can hear EVERYTHING from people on either side. I had particularly bad neighbours, one came back drunk and mistook my room for his and tried to break my door down at midnight screaming to let him in! The people on the other side were having a mini party at 2am, on top of that someone kept prank calling my room. I eventually asked to me moved at 2.30am and luckily they understood and moved me. The other room was fine, still poor quality and the bed was old and lumpy, I was then woken up at 6.30am by people next to me getting up, talking, and putting the TV on. I Left my room so quickly I forgot to brush my teeth in the morning as I was so desperate to leave. To top it all off they charged me twice for a one night stay and I had to ring up the bank etc to cancel the second payment!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: jltomo
Reviews.Content: This hotel should not be advertised as a 4 star, we have stayed in better 2 star hotels. No one to help with cases. Outside our room 2423 there was a sewerage smell and the room was very small it was so hot and there was no air conditioning either. The carpet in the foyer of the 2nd building where our room was was all wrinkled up and the carpet in the dining room was a disgrace, it was full of stains everywhere. The queue to be seated for breakfast was ridiculous this was at 8.30, the queue for the food was even longer. Then there was even a queue for the toaster which didn't even work properly, my toast went through 3 times then it was only toasted on one side. This was reported to the dining room staff but there was no improvement the morning after. The tea was luke warm being served from flask like pots, however after complaining about this we were served tea from a teapot. The hotel was very busy however the staff and hotel capacity were not able to cope at all. The staff in the dining room had no sense of urgency at all I asked for butter however the waitress finished clearing a table first! Over all very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY .REMARKABLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: vikki_10
Reviews.Content: I travelled with a bunch of friends to enjoy my friends hen weekend . I was responsible to arrange everything for her . i am kind of important ..you know... any ways the hotels review was not really impressive , so i was a little worried but now i am glad to say , it was one of our memorable weekend in london. Staff at reception was great . Nancy was charming . Mr Ghosh assisted us to get the room on time . It was really important as we were already late for the treatment . They have a nice swiming pool and treatment room . do not miss it its all free... breakfast was the only disappointment . Never saw a manager guiding the staff at all. they were running around all over the place ...any ways apart from that ,over all a great stay and a good exciting weekend . i will remommend this hotel to other friends . xx v

Reviews.Title: “Could be dire - push for better standards.”
Reviews.Author: ayacastle1
Reviews.Content: Booked a basic double no breakfast (Â£80 per night for the room, 2 persons). Foyer large and glitzy. Got to the room (in block opposite) and it was clear we couldn't stay. Poky, hot, shabby, no A/C (fan) grotty view, nasty bathroom. Went straight back to reception and explained that the room was horrible and asked what it would cost to upgrade to something a little less revolting. Staff unsurprised (is this a marketing ploy to sell upgrades, sending you to the room for naughty guests first?) and offered better room with AC plus free breakfast for an extra Â£20 per night (per room, not per person). New room much nicer, bit of a view etc etc. All in all ended up okay (just) but why have they got to play silly games like this? Next time I would look for a deal with a proper hotel like the Pestana Chelsea Bridge (or the Union Jack for all you ex-servicemen out there).

Reviews.Title: “Stay here on Saturday night if you want to walk to Spitalfields Market on Sunday”
Reviews.Author: NWPDWR
Reviews.Content: This hotel represents really good value for money at the weekend, but this is probably because it's not a great location if you want to spend most of your time in the West End of London. It was actually great for us - we walked up the hill to Islington on one evening, then walked to Hoxton the next evening, and we also walked from the hotel to Spitalfields market in about 20 minutes. The hotel is no where near a tube station. The reception/lobby is really nice and check in was efficient. Our room was old-fashioned, but was not in a bad state of repair. I enjoyed the little touches such as having magazines in the rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Not in the City and not very nice”
Reviews.Author: jimthefisher
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if you think you will be in the city, near a decent tube, expecting sleep, modern facilities or wanting value for money. Obviously it is the job of London Hoteliers to rob you blind in the summer months but staying here is like a mugging without the personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Beware single rooms”
Reviews.Author: NorthStar62
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night for business reasons. The location is not great but I had a meeting at the hotel so it was convenient. This hotel has 2 blocks including one across the road that seems to house single rooms. I'm not sure what the main block is like but the single rooms were very tired, cramped and badly maintained. Very hot with only a loud fan to cool the room. The windows opened to an inner courtyard so very little light came in. The interior lights were rubbish so there was not enough light to read or work by. WiFi internet was ridiculously expensive. I didn't have breakfast and opted to go across the road to a cafe instead. I wouldn't recommend this hotel at all - very expensive for what you get. I'd say it's nearer a 1 or 2 star than a 4 star hotel. It's put me off using Thistle Hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “TURNED AWAY”
Reviews.Author: guineapigs2003
Reviews.Content: Hotel was booked over internet for Saturdaynight 24th July 2010. Be prepared to be turned away/offered alternative accommodation in a sister hotel without a pool several miles away. There was a problem with overbooking - we were told there was no room for us and we were offered a room in a Thistle hotel at Marble Arch which is about 3 miles away and has no leisure facilities. We did not take up this offer of another hotel as we wanted to stay in the City area of London. We will not be using Thistle hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “rip off, students live better than this, prices are disgusting”
Reviews.Author: tracylouise77
Reviews.Content: there were a group of us staying, so the hotel made some serious money, but what we recieved was disgusting - no better than student accommodation, tiny single room was Â£199 per night (not including breakfast AND then paying VAT on top) the rooms were ridiculously hot, the towels stank, the single bed was not comfortable. there was a dirty cushion placed on my bed. the tiles were not clean in the bathroom. 4 out of 5 times i couldn't even get into the room using the key card and had to get help. one lift was not working so we all had to wait for ages for the one working one.

Reviews.Title: “thistle barbican”
Reviews.Author: krautbrat
Reviews.Content: luxury for little money , excellent staff and service..... everyone makes you feel welcome and feel at home. Great location close to shopping, restaurant, city center, train and bus stations. would highly recmment. Easy transportation from airport with dot-to-dot service.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as other reviews”
Reviews.Author: Businesstravelagent
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with colleagues over a weekend stay. I found the reception area to be modern and clean. The restaurants food was tasty and priced reasonably for a London hotel. Breakfast was good, although due to the hotel being full booked we were made to wait for a table. However when we managed to be seated we ate a nice cooked breakfast and were able to take a selection of fruits up to our room. The rooms were a little old, the bath rail were hanging off and the mini bar didnâ€™t work but apart from that it was okay. Rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. All in all a good stay. Can't wait to revisit once the refurbishment has finished.

Reviews.Title: “The room was small, with only a single...”
Reviews.Author: Sly105
Reviews.Content: The room was small, with only a single bed and although not very dirty, the fittings were dated. The staff were helpful but this hotel is very over priced (over Â£100). A real disappointment and not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Still as awful as ever!”
Reviews.Author: MintTea
Reviews.Content: I last stayed here a couple of years ago and vowed never to stay again. Unfortunately I had to go to London on business and there was no other accommodation anywhere near the office. So... I gave it another go... My room was a double deluxe and was pretty horrid. Very old and tired looking, marks all over the walls and chipped paint everywhere. The two chairs in the room had stains all over the upholstery - disgusting. I didn't look too closely at the bedding as I'd rather not know what lay beneath! My television remote didn't work and I had to use the controls on the side of the TV screen. I phoned for a replacement and was told a concierge would come up... he never appeared. I tried to order some room service, no reply, then left a message with reception who said someone would call me back. Eventually I managed to place an order and was told it would take 20-25 minutes, 50 minutes later my food appeared. My meal was a bit hit-and-miss, my Caesar salad as well as including all the usual ingrediants also had the added bonus of the big stalk bit from the lettuce and a huge lump of chicken fat - yummy! I visited the hotel gym which had the usual rubbish gym equipment stuffed into a room with poor air conditioning. The hotel pool did redeem it somewhat as the pool area is actually decent and has a little sauna and steam room. Given that this hotel is chock-a-block full of commuters and holiday makers I have no idea why they don't invest more in it and improve the service ten-fold. Or perhaps they feel they've a captive market that's not worth investing in. Really do not stay here, it's grotty.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tedsmith68
Reviews.Content: This was a nice European hotel. The room was fairly nice although quite small which can be expected. It was well lit, and I especially liked the water boiler and the coffee and tea provided were both excellent tasting. The television was nice, however I did not like how there was only one main outlet that had to be shared between the television, water boiler and fan, so you could only use one at once. We quickly found out that the fan in the room served as the air conditioning. The room did stay fairly comfortable with the fan running and the windown opened, but nonetheless I sweated intensely during my sleep. The bed was very comfortable. The shower was very hard to work and the pressure was not adequate. It was very difficult to get the shower to activate because of the low pressure. Also, the toilet did not have enough power to get down waste. When we became aware that other people in our group had clogged their toilets, we established a rule in our room and had to use the lobby toilet to take care of our business. The staff was very professional and friendly for the most part, however, I was very displeased by their unwillingness to make change. Overall, this was a very nice hotel and we had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: MEAD46
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through work and paid Â£100 for a one night stay. I would have made a complaint if I'd paid myself. It's the only time I have stayed in a hotel and been disappointed with the room. My colleagues room was the same so it wasn't just a one off. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. My room was freezing but my colleagues was too warm and she couldn't sleep. The bathroom was old and in a bad state of repair. My colleague had an invoice for Â£99 shoved under her door at 4am even though she had prepaid (possible scam?). There was a queue to be seated at breakfast so not good for people needing to be somewhere early. We also had to ask for coffee as our table was ignored. A bad experience all round.

Reviews.Title: “Absoloute, stinking, BALLACKS!!”
Reviews.Author: Joelywoley
Reviews.Content: Good points: Checking out!! A fine selection of p**n channels Bad points: Wall's are thick with dirt (you can leave handprints) Towels are rough and smell bad Poorly lit room, with only bedside, bathroom and mirror lights Unchanged sheets with sexual residue Mouldy, dirty and damp ceiling panels with holes inside No instructions for use of phone Hairdryer is awful, with only 1 setting Have to cross road to get to reception Damage to customers personal belongings, and a considerable amount of money missing after a visit from the maid. Breakfast would have tasted better if the brown sauce was dog [--] Dirty knives Lack of British staff There was an underlying smell of [--] in the bathroom... When a member of our party asked for a caffeine-free drink the waiter replied "coffee??" Me and my wife had to push the two single beds together on our wedding night (after specifically requesting a double), we are currently considering a divorce after 2 nights

Reviews.Title: “over priced rubbish”
Reviews.Author: xavier030
Reviews.Content: Dear All, If you are thinking od staying in this hotel,, dont. I stayed there this week for one night only with 2 colleagues, they felt the same about it as i do. For my work i travel all the time so i am used to a wide variaty of hotels worldwide, this is one of the worst ever. I shall list why, you can then decide yourself. - not clean. - no airco, bad smells everywhere - uncaring staff - very small rooms vastly overpriced no service at all, no minibar no glasses allowed in rooms??? walls made of paper, you can hear everything, this place is the pits, do not stay there you will regret it, i did not check the hotel on this site beforehand, and i regret not doing so.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED IN”
Reviews.Author: hannah_apps
Reviews.Content: Please spend your hard earned money elsewhere. The rooms are disgusting, the staff are useless and unhelpful and it was genuinely the worst experience i've had from a hotel. Premiere inn put this place to shame!

Reviews.Title: “Thought I must have been reading the wrong hotel reviews!”
Reviews.Author: maxine2404
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from a great weekend at the Barbican Thistle Hotel. We got a bargain break through our local paper so the hotel and train tickets from Liverpool only came to Â£250. The hotel was clean, the staff helpful, the rooms were a good size, clean and the bed really comfortable. The pool and spa were lovely. We were down for a concert at Wembley which was a fair way from where we were staying but the nearest tube was only a 10-minute walk away and the buses stopped pretty much on the hotel doorstep. We would definitely visit this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “SHABBY, STAINED BEDS, RUN DOWN NASTY HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Sapphire169
Reviews.Content: I was charged Â£328.00 to stay in this hotel, to be honest I have paid Â£9.50 for one night at a travel lodge which has been much better. The staff were very hard to understand as a lady on reception did not speak very good english. They could not find my booking which was booked via tickettree which was for a family room (2 adults + 1 child) they then said there were no rooms left and made us have a double room which was very shabby they then bought in a very stained single bed which made it very tight with no room to move. The room needed repairs - eg curtains hanging down, marks to walls etc, very battered furniture. I was appalled with the state that the single bed was in that they bought in - I would not let a dog lie on it. - brown stains all over it and by that I mean it was hard work trying to find a patch where there was not a stain.! When I complained the receptionist said they were full and could not put us anywhere else (that was by the third time that I managed to understand her english!) view from window was another window into someone elses bedroom. this has got to be the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and at Â£328.00 per night I found it a pure disgrace. If this is a four star hotel I will eat my hat!!! What was planned for my birthday and a city break for my family was wrecked by the standard of this hotel and what it cost. this hotel should be shut down - its apalling, the hotel is in a run down area, go by taxi if you go out at night, its not in a safe area.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great value at full price”
Reviews.Author: javamike9
Reviews.Content: Book early, get the discount rate. The website requires a very good internet connection, or it will not work. The staff is OK, the breakfast was OK, the room was OK. For the price I expected better than 'OK'. The concierge was the very helpful. When asked about walking around the area at night - he hesitated and responded "Well, this is London, it might not be a good idea" The room was small, the view was non-existent (see pictures). The bathroom was a bit cramped, the sink intruded on the toilet. The water pressure was weak, the shower was not very strong. If you can get a discount rate, this is worth the stay - otherwise do not bother. Do not pay for breakfast, it is not worth it, and there is a bakery across the street that is very good and less expensive. There is also a laundromat across the street next to the bakery if you need to wash clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommend!”
Reviews.Author: tiiterr
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend have got good offer from our travel agency for 3 nights in this hotel. 4 stars and 100Â£ per night in London - nice! Reality was not so nice... At first lady in reception offered us upgrading the room with nice view from window, with mini-bar and with air-condition for 20Â£ per night. I was surprised that in 4* hotel I have pay extras for having mini-bar and air-condition in my room but we wanted not pay more money and had taken pre-booked room. There was a nice LCD-TV and nice double-bed. That's all. No mini-bar and (of course) no refrigerator. View from window: wall in 10 m. No map with hotel information, no pen, no paper... Recycle bin in bathroom was broken and there was no brush for cleaning toilet. I hate that! About breakfast. The price of english breakfast was included in room price. The choice of meals was very poor and as a rule something was finished. Coffee had bitter taste but it looks normal in UK. If we wanted to change coffee with cappucino, they asked from us 3,50 Â£ per cup without possibility to add the bill to our room-account! When I had gone to my room for taking the wallet they have made telephone call to our room, that why they have to wait me so long time! OMG! On the One and only normal thing was the leisure centre underground of hotel. There is a swimming pool, yakuzi, sauna and steam-bath. The nearest tube station is ca 800 m (Old Street) and in other direction ca 1000 m (Angel) but they both are on the Northern Line, so you have to change the train for catching heart of the London (Piccadilly Circus, Trafalgar Square, Leicester Square). Maybe the reason is so good price for 4 stars-hotel, but hotel was full of guests and Sunday morning in restaurant was quit crazy. I am from Estonia and in our country in ALL hotels internet is free as a primary human right has to be. In this hotel they have wi-fi in rooms, but excuse me! 15 Â£ for 24 hours... Thanks, no!

Reviews.Title: “what do we expect of a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: manifoldsnet
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were happy with the roomnot so bad as in the reviews would imply However problems I encountered was the swimming pool only open untill 8pm so to be able to use it sould you be sightseeing in the city you have to be back at the hotel by seven so if any one likes a swim it has to fit in with your plans for the day also it was crowded as it is a small pool the times i went it was disappointing as I had booked this hotel for the pool . BREAKFAST the breakfast staff didnt come to ask if we wanted tea when it eventually came it wasawfull out of aflask . not english tourist board standard I wouldnt think having ran a B AND B .. ALSO the soap one little soap for two peoplefor 3 days . we had to buysome as requests to housekeeping did not happen Not four star---which is a shame It certainly needs the shuttle what about older people

Reviews.Title: “Go to Argyl Square at Kings Cross. You'll get a better room for 1/3 of the cost”
Reviews.Author: JimmyKK
Reviews.Content: RECEPTION First of all they could not find the booking I had made via the internet. I was asked to sit while they tried to trace it. After half an hour they still could not find it so I booked another room at TWICE the cost just to get my head down for the night. The next day guess what - they found my booking so I got the refund which was due to me. ROOM I was put in the annex. The room was on the fourth floor and when I opened the door the heat blasted out at me. I tried to open a window but it had a stop which only let it open a few inches. On top of that there was a stack of air conditioning units and one kicked in and out all night. The room itself was tiny and in a bad state of disrepair. There were cables hanging out of an electrical bow over the door. The bath support rail was ripped of they wall. The door security chain had been smashed off and some really incompetent person had tried to fix it. Wallpaper was hanging off and a tile was loose in the bathroom. AREA Very threatening run down area. Would not advise walking in that area after dark. All the doors and windows in the nearby estate had metal grills attached to the outside of them. That certainly told me something about the area. I put up with it for four nights then went to Argyl Street at Kings Cross. There is a good choice of hotels from budget upwards. It also felt much safer than the Thistle City Barbican area

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel like the plague”
Reviews.Author: tmanddb
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not particularly handy for public transport and is in the middle of a dismal, concrete, low income area of London. The annex is a disgrace and needs urgent refurbishment. The walls are paper thin so we heard all of our neighbour's activities. The paintwork was tired, chipped and flaking. The bedspread was faded. We were on the 2nd floor, just above the canopy between the main building and annex. The noise from what we presume were the smokers from the Brasserie/Bar beneath was horrendous and went on until at least 2.30am. At the same time we could not shut the window because it was so hot and airless. We have stayed in Travelodges which are far better and less expensive. We suspected that rooms in the annex were allocated to those who refused to pay for an upgrade and this is a shabby ploy. Having seen the bedroom there was no way we would have contemplated eating at the hotel. The hotel seemed to be geared primarily to large group bookings. It is certainly not a romantic venue.

Reviews.Title: “Good value if booked on line but definetly not upto a 4 star rating.”
Reviews.Author: Ccupcakes
Reviews.Content: If you book correctly and don't pay the full hotel price then it's good value for the money. The location isn't ideal and a goog 10 minute walk from any tube station. A walk at night may not be ideal for all. Convenient enough to get into the city. Also walking distance to 15 restaurant which is well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid, small pokey single room!”
Reviews.Author: Marshwiggle
Reviews.Content: The reception and public areas presented a nice image and I was looking forward to seeing if the rooms held the same promise. I was allocated a single room in annex building just across from reception, on the 2nd floor. On entering the room two things hit me; the size and the heat! The room was absolutely tiny! The small single bed only just fitted. The bathroom was small and very dark with no light over the bath/shower so once the shower curtain was drawn it was extremely dark. To close the bathroom door you had to stand between the toilet and the bath. Free toiletries consisted of two small bottles of shower gel. Next the heat! it had been a hottish day and I entered the room at 8:30ish in the evening and the room was so hot. I even checked the radiator to see if it was on! There was no air conditioning but the window could be opened onto the central atrium - so there was very little breeze. There was an electric pedestal fan provided but this proved so noisy you couldn't hear the TV let alone leave it running to sleep. If this was a budget hotel then I would be less crytical, but having paid Â£210 I found it a complete disgrace and a rip-off - even for London prices. I've stayed at the County Hall Premier Inn for half that price for a double room and that is 10 times better!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable....but only just !!!”
Reviews.Author: JohnandSyl
Reviews.Content: Very welcoming on arrival, concierge & staff helpful. The room was clean, warm & reasonably comfortable, but "tired" and in need of decoration. The bathroom also was in need of a makeover. Breakfast was chaotic. We were there 2 nights, and at breakfast there were never any butter knives or tea spoons on the table. The buffet regularly ran out of plates...at least 3 times in 2 days...the food was not hot, due to it being cooked in bulk & left out for self service, and you have to wander round to find a waiter in order to get a cup of tea or coffee, and then I had to get milk from the cereal bar as the jug on the table was empty. Dont be tempted to drink at the bar here. 2 x 1 pint glasses of orange juice made with lemonade cost Â£13.74 !!! Rip off or what?? Also,the location is not the best. Walking in the area after dark is un-nerving to say the least. Best to use a taxi. This hotel was booked as part of an all inclusive theatre break. If it had'nt been I would'nt have paid the normal price this place tries to charge.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal”
Reviews.Author: jcann
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from two nights in this hotel. We paid Â£160 pp for two nights in this hotel, high speed rail fares from the North (Preston), plus best seats at a leading London musical. Check in and other staff were excellent. Rooms were small to medium, but clean and comfortable. We did not use the gym / spa facilities but they looked good. Breakfast was of reasonable standard, but as the hotel was full to overflowing you had to queue at peak times. Location is fairly central but you do have a 10 minute walk to the nearest station (Old Street). Overall an excellent value deal. We are returning in July to seee "Hair", forty years after watching it on our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “No Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: WiersDelft
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on two occastions for two nights each. The bathrooms are really old and broken. The window almost fell out of the wall when opening and was really dirty. Rooms are small and old. This is really no four star hotel where you should pay 120 Pound for 1 night for. Only for 70 Pounds I would sleep there. I need to mention that I was in the second building and not the first, so maybe that one is better. It also is a 15 minute walk to the oldstreet tube station.

Reviews.Title: “What a hairy walk in the evening”
Reviews.Author: NanoPelato
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible hotel, located in the middle of a low income area which makes it unsafe to walk back late in the night. My room was in the dependance and very cold, tired and noisy: being on the corned, winds were strong and woke me up several times in the night. Breakfast management is cahotic, with long queues as restaurant too small to accommodate for the overall number of rooms available in the hotel. In the dependance, many meetings are organised on a daily bases and security remains a concern given that anyone can wonder to the crammy corridors via the fire escape stairs - if you venture there, close your eyes as they have a tendency to park there for a few days dirty trays from room service.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel of 2 halves”
Reviews.Author: rattlin
Reviews.Content: Similar experience to other reviewers. First room I got in the adjacent building to the entrance was awful. Stunk of paint, had mould on the ceiling, the wallpaper was hanging off, window didn't shut properly so had a draft. All in a room that just about had enough space for a double bed, but not enough to swing a cat. Complained to hotel, and was told that there were no more rooms of that same standard, however I could "upgrade" for a fee. Asked to look at it first. This was back in the main building and there was no problem with it so took them up on the offer, but only because I didn't really have any option as I would not have been able to sleep in the original room. Perhaps its a little con they have to get you to upgrade, cheap trick though. As I say the second room was fine. If I would have got something similar initially I would have rated the hotel a lot higher. Also wouldn't bother with hotel breakfast as there are a couple of cafes over the road that did an okay English fry up for less than a fiver.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gotogo
Reviews.Content: Words cannot adequately describe how bad this place is. Unfortunately, I checked out before I though of taking any pictures. Take my word for it - seen 3 different types of rooms - one in the main building and 2 others in the adjoining building - horrible ! Pealing wallpaper, damaged furniture, mould on the toilet ceiling, dirty carpets..... - forget it ! Take my advice and go elsewhere. No one should have to pay for something like this - an absolute disgrace. After what I had been shown I decided not to stay even 1 night.

Reviews.Title: “Good,clean, friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dylanShropshire
Reviews.Content: Visited London for a superbreak, stayed for 2 nights at the Thistle, I had read the reviews which were not good, therefore was pleasantly surprised. Staff on arrival were friendly and efficient, our room in the main building were spacious and clean, the bathroom was clean and roomy, the shower strong with lovely hot water. The only fault with the room was that it was very hot, there was a fan which was very noisy so we couldn't use it, so night time was hot and stuffy. Breakfast was fine, a good choice of fruit,cereals etc. service friendly. The bar bill for one round of drinks was extortionate so don't drink in the hotel bar. The hotel is a long way from the main sights, so a taxi or underground is the main option but overall much better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Nice first impression - rooms tired and stuffy.”
Reviews.Author: GeeGeesFife
Reviews.Content: We travelled to London for our anniversary and stayed here for two nights. First impression of the hotel was very nice - main reception area spacious and leisure facilities were really good. Staff extremely friendly. We had dinner in the hotel the first night and due to other reviews were a bit apprehensive, but think they must obviously have rectified the problem as we thought the dinner was good. However, we overheard a guest complaining to a waitress regarding the vegetarian options. Breakfasts were plentiful, food hot and good selection. Again, quick service and staff very polite. We thought the hotel rooms were tired and in dire need of refurbishment. Our room was on the 6th floor with a nice view of a brick wall!!! It was very stuffy and we had to put the fan on every night to cool the room down. Considering we stayed in April I dread to think what the temperatures would be like in the height of the summer. All in all we had a nice stay and didn't visit London to stay in a hotel room all day, but due to the location of this hotel I would recommend staying somewhere else as it is a bit out of the way from the main areas where you would want to visit, there is nothing much around the area either and the tube is about a 10 minute walk. There is a taxi rank directly outside the hotel so don't ask the concierge to order a taxi for like we did - cost us Â£14.00 to go to The Strand. It only cost us Â£9.00 back when we flagged a taxi down in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from anywhere it was a good 20 minute walk for me to the tube”
Reviews.Author: visitor095
Reviews.Content: We were assured that there was a courtesy bus to the tube therefore we did not mind the distance to the tube station. However the concierge advised us in a very snotty manner that this did not run between Friday and Monday (when else would you require it for a weekend break) The rooms were very tired and grubby and the shower dripped all the first night and prevented a decent nights sleep. the drinks in the bar were super expensive (Â£11 for a glass of wine and a pint of lager) go to the pub by the tube station where the same round was Â£5.

Reviews.Title: “Basic and slightly tired!”
Reviews.Author: funkielynch
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the title nothing great and a bit tired! I've stayed here a number of times on business and although I would say that the staff are always lovely the hotel in itself could do with a revamp! The rooms are very tired, with floral curtains and some rooms being very dark. It's old school and could do with a lick of paint and new plain carpets and curtains put in but are clean. Breakfast is ok but nothing too exciting! If it's cheap then I would stay but not if I was looking for a nice place for a holiday! Is near to a number of tube stations which is handy.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing great - a bit aged - but due to price for London ok”
Reviews.Author: medinger
Reviews.Content: Held a training for a week in London with a colleague - as we held the training close to the Barbican we stayed at the Thistle City Barbican. Was walking distance to Barbican - but the neighbourhood around the Thistle is slightly suspicious - breakfast was english breakfast and somewhere between alright and a bit disappointing. Rooms were clean but a bit aged. Service was percived underaverage (as everybody seemed to be a trainee and/or took very very long -also we had to get our bill corrected twice), but the conceirge and the shuttle driver were great (in the morning there is a shuttle to the barbican, if you don't like to walk the 10-15 min). All in all for London a good price-value-relationship but would not unnecessary stay again. One thing to look out - get breakfast at off peak times (best earlie) otherwise there can be queues to get into the breakfast area (as you get seated).

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK for a short break, location not so good”
Reviews.Author: ayjay_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a 2 night Superbreak. I purposefully did not read the reviews as we had got a good deal and I could see on the map it wasn't an ideal location. As it was a nice day and we had small bags, we decided to walk from Euston. Got a bit worried as we got closer to the hotel and I was glad it was midday and not dark. We were offered the Â£15 a night upgrade and glad we took it. Rooms were fine and clean, and certainly spacious enough. I had trouble wiht the in-room safe, but the duty manager fixed it straightaway. We passed on the free dinner as we had tickets for the theatre. We decided to take a taxi back instead of the tube and the longish walk. It was only a Â£10 cab ride from the West End. The hotel was very quiet at night. No disturbance at all (we were on the 4th floor). Breakfast was fine. Food was plentiful and no queues. I was surprised to see so many people at breakfast considering how quiet the hotel was at night! Overall, we would have preferred to have stayed more central; that way we wouldn't have had to stay out all day. But a central hotel would have cost a lot more than the Â£10 cab ride back, and may have been very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Think before booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: brummiechinese
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked for me by my company as I was attending a course in the City of London 24-26 March 2010. The nearest London Underground tube station is Old Street, about 10 minutes walk. There were no signs for the hotel either which would help people that are unfamiliar with the area. My overall experience of the hotel mirrors many of the reviews by other people that have stayed here. My single bedroom was small, extremely warm and very, very shabby - not very inviting. The leisure facilities consisted of a very small gym (4 weight training machines, 2 steppers, 2 treadmills and one corner for free weights training, one area fore stretching), pool area, steam and sauna rooms. The service wasn't too bad but could have been better in places - my door card did not work on the second day and it took 3 visits to reception before the receptionist decided to accompany me to my room in order to resolve this issue although this was prompted by myself. Restaurant and gym staff were more helpful and friendlier. Food quality was okay with a small choice of main course meals, but expensive for what it was. Whilst trying to maintain a balanced view, I would advise fellow travellers to consider their options should they need to stay in this area.

Reviews.Title: “not awful but needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: HanD
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times on work trips as it is on the approved hotel list. However I would say that unless you get a very good deal I would be a bit wary of this hotel. The night staff were not helpful when I stayed and the queues to check in have been very long on more than one location. The rooms I have generally found to be okay it is all the extras that are lacking - one day I checked in and was told that breakfast was included in the price only to be told the opposite the next morning - very confusing! The location of this hotel is also not great unless you plan to get taxis in the evening - its an ok location to walk around in the day but too far from a tube for the evening...

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hehCheshire
Reviews.Content: Ok where to start: Location, no where near the city and the walk from the "nearest" tube station is not recomended late at night. Reception, friendly on arrival, however not the least bit interested in any complaints. Rooms, this hotel must hold on to its 4 star rating by its finger tips. The was last decorated in the early 80's at a guess, with beds of the same vintage. I understand that some rooms have been redecorated, however do you want to take that chance? The TV was half off the wall, with some wiring which while it might legal was pretty awful to look at. The lighting poor and the heating did not work. In short never again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, disgraceful food!!”
Reviews.Author: pritchardshelley
Reviews.Content: My partner and i visited this hotel through a superbreak deal, B&B for 2 nts +evening meal included on the first night, also our rail from durham to kingscross inclusive, to which we thought was a brilliant deal for only Â£129.00 per person. After reading the reviews on this site i was reluctant to book but thought we'd be daring and give it a go. When we arived it was a 20 min walk from the nearest tube which was ok i expect. We were offered an upgrade for Â£30.00 for both nights which we thought was very reasonable, the hotel was really modern and a lovely atmosphere from the staff. we were pleased we upgraded as the room was gorgeous, the pool and jaccuzzi was great too. So far so good, so we thought, we went to the restauraunt on the evening and ordered our meal, to which we were told, "we're sold out" so chose a meal we didn't really want,after 45minutes we were still waiting for our starter to arrive, so complained,when it eventually arrived were brought the wrong meals, it was also the same with the main meals, to which we were given a complimentary bottle of wine. there was over half of the restauraunt in the same position. I wouldnt visit this hotel again as the walk from the tube put me off and the meals were dryed up and disgusting and took forever to arrive.

Reviews.Title: “We will never return!”
Reviews.Author: WestieTyneandWear
Reviews.Content: After a 15 minute walk from the nearest tube station, a pleasant reception and reception staff allocating us our room or should I say our appendage to the lift. The room was miniscule having to walk crab like whilst ducking under the suspended T.V to encompass the bed. Mean while the lift floor bell constantly ringing. We were granted a room change which was to a slightly larger, very tired, room. The house keeper obviously missed inspection of the filthy windows, holes in the duvet cover and the valance was half hidden underneath the mattress. Our included evening meal was appalling, but the evening entertainment, a plague of flies dancing around the potted plant situated next to our table distracted our attention from the quality of the food - not recommended. Breakfast was OK. Never to return.

Reviews.Title: “trip to london”
Reviews.Author: birminghambabe
Reviews.Content: arrived at this hotel on a busy friday afternoon reception bright and airy was given a room on the 6th floor when i arrived in the room it was twin bedded and i had requested a double room the funiture and decor was very shabby very poor facillities in the bathroom i phoned reception and explained that i had requested a double room they asked me to come to the reception desk whre I was given a key for a room on the 5th floor when I opened the door the room was much more what I had expected from this standard hotel the service at the restaurant was very poor to all in all i would not recommend a stay there

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected after reading reviews!”
Reviews.Author: sarahba
Reviews.Content: We booked through Lastminute the day before and after reading the reviews on here I thought I'd made a terrible mistake - but actually everything was fine. The check-in staff were helpful and the room (in the main building) was really nice. We asked for a nice quiet room when we checked in and were really pleased with the one we were given. We also heard the man next to us at checkin ask to be given one of the nice rooms and the lady said the 'standard rooms' were in the building opposite and the 'de-luxe rooms' were in the main building - so I would recommend trying to get a room in the main hotel building if possible. The area is a little dodgy with some rather rough looking pubs, but we didn't see/hear anything - just best to get a cab at night. Having said all this I wouldn't have wanted to pay the rates advertised at front desk for the room which was around Â£170 / night!!

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay at the TCB”
Reviews.Author: DixieD_9
Reviews.Content: Room was again excellent & the staff's customer service is second to none. The location of the hotel is a bit daunting, but it's very handy for the City & the hotel run a free shuttle service to surrounding areas. I can't understand why this hotel gets so many negative reviews as my experiences certainly wouldn't confirm them

Reviews.Title: “Great room, helpful reception staff and good location. Poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: tell-it-as-it-is47
Reviews.Content: Really nice and clean room. The reception staff were great. Flexible checkout time. I was very pleased and will stay there again. The only thing that let it down was the long wait for breakfast, the fact that they give our table away while you are in another long que for the buffet. Just pay for the room and get breakfast across the road.

Reviews.Title: “A Disgrace to the hotel industry”
Reviews.Author: RobthePilot
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write reviews about hotels but after tonight's bar bill of Â£9.33 for a pint of orange (not even fresh orange) & lemonade, I felt compelled to share my experience with the rest of the travelling world and hopefully, if I can help one person to avoid this sad excuse of a quality hotel, I will sleep easier in my uncomfortable single bed here at the Thistle Barbican. I will start my review by focusing on the good points as it would be unfair to be solely disparaging. The gym exists and the guys who run it are very friendly. Ok, now the bad. The gym equipment is very well used and if you're hoping to use the pool/sauna, get there early as there aren't enough padlocks (you need to ask for them at reception) to fit all the lockers. Surely some of my Â£175 a night could buy a couple dozen more from the local hardware store? I have been staying here for 5 weeks now on business (not by choice) and I have stayed on most floors. The rooms are along the lines of a Travelodge but less spacious and the fixtures especially in the bathrooms are bordering on broken. Sometimes you will get a radiator with no temperature control so take plenty of water to slake your 3am searing thirst. I can't deny the rooms are clean, I know they get cleaned because I had a cleaner's sponge left next to my toothbrush last week. The sponge wasn't even new. Ok, so how about the food? well, breakfast is available and you must be seated by one of the ever changing members of staff. The food (for the added cost of Â£10 + VAT) includes bread that tastes like something from the value range of a leading budget supermarket, concentrated orange juice out of a machine, a handful of cereals oh and the coffee is the strongest coffee in the world. I added a quarter cup of milk and it had no effect on the colour. I like coffee strong but it was undrinkable. There is hot 'full English' food available but I've not had the urge to try it and probably won't. The thing that really pushed me to write this review is the bar. Ok, so you're in a hotel not far from central London, you expect to pay a premium. I tried the burger tonight, it was nothing special although I paid Â£13.44 for the privelige (that includes the mandatory 12.5% surcharge). I washed it down with a nice pint of orange & lemonade, that cost Â£9.33. Yes, I too thought there was a mistake there, Â£9.33 for a soft drink (no sparklers or umbrellas even) and so I did question that charge with the barman only to get the reply "that's hotel prices Sir". Needless to say I was greatful for the barman kindly enlightening me as I didn't realise I was staying in a hotel. What else, oh yes, the key card that you are issued with, this will get erased for seemingly no reason so you will need to goto reception and get it re-swiped every 2 or so days if you can afford or have the masochistic tendencies to stay that long.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Assessor should have gone to specsavers”
Reviews.Author: torquaytonewcastle
Reviews.Content: I went to a search engine to look at pictures of the hotel, this was a big mistake as it showed me the wrong thistle. I thought the building looked charming in the photo, though as I said it wasn't our hotel. The many council blocks looked nicer than the hotel they surrounded, I was quite worried what I had let myself in for. Now I was staying with my Gay friend so we were after a twin room, however we hadn't specified this on the booking. When we went to check in she said they were running short on twin rooms, so I said to her what makes you think we would like a twin room? She replied "Well you're two men." I considered leaving at this point, but we were off to see a concert so I couldn't be bothered with the hassle of having to find another hotel. So she concluded her poor customer service skills in trying to force us to stay in two singles as they were running very short on twin rooms. I had to argue and finally she agreed to give us a twin room. Much to the surprise of having to walk outside in the cold to get to our hotel room, we were greeted by a massive annual LGBT event in their conference suite, maybe the lady who checked us in was receiving training later. Our room was awful, and I was shocked to find that one of the beds wasn't made up, therefor having to make the bed myself as I could not be bothered calling up the reception. The Radiator was so hot, seriously, if you're ever suffering with pneumonia in London then go the thistle, it's probably a better idea than a&e. Anyway, it's getting late. If I haven't stopped you from booking this hotel room already then I now urge; do not buy this hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “For the amount of money it cost, the room was a disgrace!”
Reviews.Author: EssexSoulboy
Reviews.Content: I thought Thistle hotels were of a certain quality. Boy, was I wrong. The first cell they gave me was like a sauna. The large radiator was red hot and when I tried to turn it down the valve just fell to the floor. It was balanced on the pipe. When I went to the reception to tell them, they called a maintenance man who offered to come and turn it off with his wrench(he obviously knew what the problem was before he was even told). He said I had to get him to come to my room every time I needed the radiator turning off/on. I managed to get another room which was even smaller and stank of damp. By this time it was late and I just wanted to go to bed. I will never stay on this hotel again. Rooms are grotty, dated and very unappealing.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about staying at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DeborahSLymington
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8.30 at night to find the hotel was turning away all Last Minute customers as they had overbooked the hotel. Only people who had paid the full rate were getting rooms. This despite having, of course, already paying for our room in order to secure it. We saw at least nine people sent away. Alternative accommodation was offered in Westminster, which is useless if you have to be in the City early as we did. After a huge row we eventiully ended up at Euston. So, at 9.30 we were put in a taxi to Euston and sat down to dinner just before ten.

Reviews.Title: “Does the job for a cheap break”
Reviews.Author: TrueHotelReview
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not as bad as most of the reviews on it suggest. We were expecting the worst but given that we booked a cheap weekend break and knew we wouldnâ€™t be spending much time in the room, this hotel fitted the bill. On check-in, ask to be allocated a room in the same part of the hotel where reception is. There are two buildings and the other part is not nice. Rooms were standard, with limited toiletries or TV channels, but as I say, we werenâ€™t spending much time in the room so this isnâ€™t really an issue. The location is good for Old Street and Hoxton, with the underground and good bus links close by. Breakfast was a large buffet, and although many tables hadnâ€™t been cleared by the time we went for breakfast, the foods itself was fine. Staff could do with some training on how to clean tables properly, not just clear them. If you arenâ€™t looking for a true 4 star hotel and just want somewhere to come back to after a busy day of site seeing, this place does the job.

Reviews.Title: “No way a 4 star - no way”
Reviews.Author: t29dwn
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to London as part of my Christmas. This hotel is a major let down although we tried not to let it bother us. The reception area is lovely but its all down hill from there. The rooms are really small for a 4 star and very basic. The radiator paint has all peeled off both radiators which look very dirty, the seal around the bath was actually black most of the way round, the base of the taps were filthy (a clean with a toothbrush could have fixed that). The tiles were cracked, the fixtures were very poor, the windows are badly in need of paint, the "iron" which was a trouser press didnt work, we were told on booking that we could have a late check out at at no extra cost as our flight wasnt until 10 at night - they knew nothing about this and charged us 10 per hour extra we eventually left and just went straight to airport and hung around there for hours,i could go on..... You also had to pay to use the swimming pool which i think is shocking. On the positive our breakfast was nice and well organised. We were pretty well located, on the road round the corner we could get a 20min bus into Oxford Street which we used as our central point. most of the attractions are around that area. taxi cost around Â£7 to hotel from Oxford Street PLEASE DONT BOOK THIS HOTEL UNTIL THEY GIVE IT THE RATING IT DESERVES - HONESTLY IVE BEEN IN BETTER 2 STARS

Reviews.Title: “Treated very poorly”
Reviews.Author: sarsbuck
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with Lastminute.com for a weekend away with my husband. When we arrived reception were extremely slow at checking guests in. The room we were assigned was in the "other" part of the building and even though it was clean, it was old and worn looking. The major complaint we had about this hotel was we were given a twin room. When we asked repeatedly to be moved to a double room (with a double bed), we were told by the staff that they couldn't move us as the hotel was fully booked and as we booked with 'lastminute' we had to accept what we had been given. They said they would see about moving us the following night but with no guarentees. We had to make do with single beds that night but discovered the following morning that there was no hot water for showers. Again we asked at reception about moving rooms to be given the same response ... you booked with last minute! Eventually, after asking 4 times, at about 3pm that day they agreed to move us. The second room was lovely and if we had been there the first night, I would have had no complaints. I get the impression with this hotel that there are 2 levels of services, in two parts of the building! We definitely felt like we were treated as 2nd class citizens as we didn't book directly with the hotel. I would be very cautious about booking with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: neil1875
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this hotel through Superbreak.com and we were pleasantly suprised after reading some of the reviews on this site. Upon arrival, we were offered an upgrade for an additional Â£20 for a two night stay by a very nice and polite receptionist. The room was lovely and very clean. The hotel is a ten minute walk to the nearest tube station and on the Saturday night, the hotel got us a private taxi to take us to the West end for Â£12. Would recommend and revisit

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: RosieT_99
Reviews.Content: I booked for one night at a cost of Â£80.50 for the room plus Â£10.00 for breakfast. Then looked at the comments on trip adviser! However I took the view that it's a Thistle hotel, conveniently located for me and at lesser cost than other suitable hotels, which was important because I was paying for it myself. From the outside, the hotel looks impressive, as does reception. My room was on the sixth floor and, from the comments on trip adviser I wasn't expecting too much. The ambience on the floor and in my room - a standard twin - was similar to that of a travel lodge which, for the price and location, was absolutely fine. However if I'd paid the displayed rate of Â£189 I would have been upset. There was some trafic noise, but not to an extent that it was intrusive. I could hear the people in the next room talking, but they ddin't carry on too late, otherwise it could have been disturbing. I did have cause to make a complaint, which arose due to human error. The duty manager informed the customer relations manager who handled it extremely well and resolved it to my satisfaction. Breakfaxt at 09.00 was fine - the fried eggs were perfect! I would recommend this hotel on the basis of good value for money, iin the context of the preceding comments.

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel for the money. I would definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: Haggis_10
Reviews.Content: I feel that people have been a little unfair on this hotel. After reading the poor reviews that the hotel had received on this site; my husband and I were a little aprehensive about the accomodation that awaited us. We were pleasently surprised when we arrived at the Thistle Barbican to find a bright and airy lobby with extremely pleasant front desk staff. We had booked a standard room on Hotels.com for Â£60 (which I feel is good value for a hotel in london!) but at front desk we were upgraded to one of the executive suites. The room was lovely; extremely clean and quiet. Granted, being upgraded was a bonus and I can't comment on the standard rooms but if our room and the cleanliness of the rest of the hotel was anything to go by then I've no complaints. As for the location....it's not the most picturesque setting but it is extremely handy if you fancy a night out in the east end and it was far from what I would desribe as a 'dodgy area'. My advice to anyone who stays here is think about how much you are paying for your hotel and have realistic expectations- if you want 5 star accomodation you have to pay for it. I would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “A total rip off. Terrible quality”
Reviews.Author: wockwabbit
Reviews.Content: Although the staff were friendly the standard of this hotel is far below the standard i would expect for the prices charged. As i checked in i met a colleague who was already having to complain about the temperature in her room ( no air conditioning/climate control). Not a good start. I was booked into a deluxe room and was therefore suprised to find that not only was it tiny, it was dusty and the temperature knob on the shower was broken so i ended up leaping in and out of the shower. Unfortunatly i was due at an awards dinner with only 45 mins to get ready or i would have complained and asked the manager to change things. In the morning i asked at reception what made a room 'deluxe' and was told that it might be more spacious. If this is the case then i dread to think what size a standard room must as there wasn't even room to move a chair in front of the desk *( thank goodness i was there for a dinner and not to work!) and the fittings were dowdy. Although they did write down my complaints there was no apology. If i had had more time i would have asked to see a standard room so i could compare for myself! Needless to say, i don't reccommend this hotel to anyone as the ;deluxe' experience was terrible and as a consequence the standard experience must be trully horrific.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever been”
Reviews.Author: Smith8
Reviews.Content: freezing cold room, asked them to check the heater that was not working, they ignored me. breakfast is better in the local shops around the area that is strictly council flats and streets full of dodgy people. feels and is a rough area, don't go out at night without taxi. woke up three times during the night because of gangs shouting outside. service? totally unconcerned, they don't give a [--] avoid!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: OxfordMike1
Reviews.Content: After looking at the reviews on here I was extremely concerned about staying at this hotel! I have also stayed at some other poor thistle hotels (Exeter for example) so was expecting the worst. However it was fine. Nice hotel, good quality clean room, very friendly staff etc. I was however in the 'nice' side of the hotel so I can't comment on the rooms on the other side. Location is a bit odd but I came back at 3 in the morning and didn't feel threatened at all like others seem to have said, it's just a residential area, only 10 mins from Angel tube. Much much better than a travelodge and the same price. I was also a little late checking out and this caused no problems whatsoever (Most hotels seem to get very moody if you're even 5 minutes late checking out). In summary, good room (inc. ironing board), clean, nice TV, no noise. The only thing I can think to moan about was that it was a little on the warm side - but then again I went to sleep with the window closed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,but it could be better”
Reviews.Author: Arisp
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable,but the service in the restaurant could be better.The check in and check out were easy and all members of stuff were polite and friendly.It could,also,have a some computers for internet.All customers don't have laptops

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a hostel”
Reviews.Author: gaditano
Reviews.Content: I think 100 % people on this hotel agree on the same thing and that is the reason of this hotel having more terrible reviews than any other hotel I have been in my entire life and this includes some of them in countries like India, Turkey, China etc....If the management of this hotel would rate it as it really deserves Hostel, or maybe one star they would not get such a poor score which might be record on trip advisor. I got thsi hotel using last minute and in the last time or minute I used such a site. They do fake publicity like in the case of this hotel which they rate at 4 stars, They fool me once fair enough but they lost a customer for life and I will make sure that my relatives friends and anyone I know never ever buy anything in last minute. As soon as the name of this hotel came public to me and I came here I went straight to cancel it and the answer was as expected no refund at all...no joke I am not surprise only fooling people you get this hotel busy because otherwise someone has to be desperate or crazy to stay there. I would recommend better a Hostel or a B&B at least they are honest and they tell you their real rating. There is one more thing I do not understand the comments about the neighbourhood, it might not be vegas but it is not what people are describing, it is safe and very close to old street tube station. The place for breakfast close to the hotel will get your smile back after the thistle experience...If you still want to go here good luck....

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel for a short stay in London”
Reviews.Author: EastYorkshireJon
Reviews.Content: I took my fiance away for a new year break and found this hotel through superbreak which included train journey, hotel, breakfast and an evening meal. We found the hotel easily enough (10 mins walk from Old St) and never felt threatened when walking through the local area. The hotel staff were extremely attentive and we managed to check in within a couple of minutes of arrival. Our room was spotless and contained all of the usual amenities for a comfortable stay. we did not have chance to use the pool or gym. The hotel restraunt was pleasant and the food and the service could not be faulted. Many thanks for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could be better!”
Reviews.Author: MDKlancashire
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to London as a surprize for New Years Eve. The walk to the hotel was not pleasant and no sign of the shuttle bus. Directs from the tube station would have helped! Check in was quick and easy and our room was small but nice. As it was so cold New Years Eve could have done with extra bedding, could only find pillows. Didn,t find out until we tried to use it on New Years Day that the kettle did not work so we could ot have a cup of tea or coffee befor breakfast. This should have been checked. When we went to breakfast, tables were left ubcleared, we waited so long for a drink I had to ask in the end for one and then we had no cups, spoons etc and had to use last persons milk jug, not what I would expect. When telling the recptionist about the kettle and lon wait in the restaurant all she did was say she would tell housekeeping. I would not stay agian unless there was nowhere else, other than hotel we had a fab New Year.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague you will contract if you stay here.”
Reviews.Author: DrUKYorkshire
Reviews.Content: I have never reviewed a hotel before but felt compelled to warn others of this revolting hotel. There is NO WAY that this is a four star hotel. It doesn't even come close to some of the two-star rooms you can find in Bayswater. It's a trek from the city, despite bring described as 'Barbican' and the surrounding area isn't very nice, not that there's anything to see. Our room was dirty, the wallpaper was peeling, the ceiling was crumbling, and the soft furnishings were stained. There was no air conditioning (just an old battered fan) so we were boiling hot. We asked to be moved to a different room and we were bruskly told that the hotel was full. In the en-suite bathroom, the toilet didn't flush, the seat was broken, the door didn't open because the toilet got in the way, and the sink had two hot taps (so no cold water - and on telling reception about the problem we were made to purchase water so we could have a drink). The glasses were dirty and the remote for the TV didn't work. Breakfast was a mediocre school dinner affair (in a freezing restaurant) so please venture out to one of the many lovely coffee houses, cafes, or restaurants in the city for a fraction of the price. Please avoid this hotel. Your money could be better spent elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “this is not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pompey1001
Reviews.Content: We booked this last minute on 30/12/09. We feel that Â£122 was a great price for New Years Eve, this was by last minute.com secret four star hotel. We were given a room opposite the main hotel. It was ok, but not a four star. I would say just about three star. We book many secret hotels and this was the worst. The hot water in the shower was luke warm and the breakfast had some items missing. It was not hot. We paid Â£10.99 each. The manager refunded our breakfast and in view of our disatisfaction he refunded our Â£20 which we paid for car parking. We had a fantastic time in London and the staff at the hotel are very helpul and welcoming. I just wanted to warn customers booking this via secret four star hotel, that this is not four star, and one may be disapointed if booking this for a romantic break.

Reviews.Title: “Out of place”
Reviews.Author: UltimateRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via laterooms.com; paid 90 pounds. Mind you, it is relatively close to the City, it has a decent pool, and for UK standards a fine sauna + steamroom too. Check-in went seamless. I was in a hurry for a conference, so I was out of the building very quickly. Room is okay sized for London standards, clean, fully equipped with TV, iron board, safe and water cooker. Everything was clean and the hotel is quiet. Some caveats though: - the ironing in-room board did not work, so it took me four phone calls to get a decent ironing board. -there is a taxi rank outside the hotel, the taxis there were abandoned! -checkout, the staff notified me that the computer had frozen. -the location is weird, close to the city, but also apparently very far away. Staff is friendly, but they lack important skills. I would return though, I value the price, the pool and its closeness to the City.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant functional and quiet”
Reviews.Author: SharkyCornwall
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the poor reviews I was pleasantly suprised to find the hotel was fine. I had a twin room on the 6th floor which was well equipped and clean. Importantly it was quiet although a little on the warm side. I did eat at the hotel and found the food and service was fine. The hotel is in a safe semi residential area (ignore rude comments comparing it to Harlem) and is in close proximity to the Barbican Centre which was my purpose for staying. Check in and out was a doddle with no delays. You do have to pay for wifi at Â£6 for an hour of Â£10 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: SueDarlington
Reviews.Content: I was horrified at the state of this supposedly 4* hotel, but never more so than finding that the bed in my room had been "soiled" and left for the next guest. The smell! On telephoning reception to have the room changed I received no apology and was told to pack up and come to reception. I was given a "superior" room with damp stains on the walls, broken curtain rail, a shower that barely held together, a kettle that did not work etc. etc. Never never again. Apalling customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: charliecrossway
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say that this was one of the worst hotels i have ever stayed in. The check in took forever, the staff were unhelpful and the hotel is in the middle of what seems like Harlem. The hotel needs a splash of paint and an update urgently. I can't believe this is supposed to be a 4 star hotel?! The food was bad, breakfast was bland. i waited 30 minutes just for a waiter to pour me some tea. Don't stay here! Go to Travel Lodge instead! Better value for money. This place should be closed down!

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment - terrible bar service, cramped rooms and dirty 'spa'”
Reviews.Author: K122009
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with my stay. Waited over half an hour to get a drink at the bar, the rooms were tiny and hot and breakfast was a shambles - never again! The spa consisted of 1 tiny jacuzzi, a small pool, a cramped sauna and a dangerously hot steam room! Not the relaxing time I'd anticipated!

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* but decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsE79
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Barbican for 1 night as we were meeting up with friends in London. The hotel is quite big and seems built for business customers as the majority of rooms are twins.
